English: I checked and it's from Pyeongtaek to Dongducheon.

English: Yes, I can call back the person I spoke to.
Was the person you spoke to a man?

Korean: 아니요 여자분인데요 죄송한데 여기는 담당부서와 통화하려면요
English: No, I'm a woman. I'm sorry, but this is the department in charge.

Korean: 전화번호가 사이트 상에 안 나와있나요 담당과 전화번호가
English: The phone number is not listed on the site. The person in charge and the phone number are
If so, are you currently accessing the #@affiliation# homepage?

Korean: 네 #@소속# 내 #@소속# 홈페이지로 들어가야 되는 건가요
English: Yes, should I go to my #@affiliation# homepage?

Korean: 네 #@소속# 홈페이지를 접속하시면 경로를 안내 해드리겠습니다
English: Yes, if you access the #@affiliation# homepage, we will guide you through the path.

Korean: 그래요 그러면 아까 그 통화했던 잠깐 알려주시겠어요
English: Okay, then can you tell me briefly about the conversation we had earlier?
#@Affiliation# Have you accessed the homepage?
Wait a minute, where should I look?

Korean: #@소속#넷 글자 옆으로 정보 공개 소통 민원 소개 확인이 되십니까
English: #@Affiliation# Can you confirm the information disclosure, communication, and complaint introduction next to the four letters?
Yes, show me your #@affiliation# introduction
#@Affiliation# If you hover your mouse over the introduction
Yes, I put my mouse cursor there.

Korean: 초록색 첫 번째 줄 도청 안내부분 하단으로 전화번호 확인이 되십니까
English: Can you confirm the phone number at the bottom of the green first line wiretapping guidance section?
Yes, I see. I checked.
After clicking on the phone number
Then, the phone number will appear like this.
Yes, and what about the low birth rate and aging population policy that the teacher mentioned?
You must click on View Details under #@Affiliation#
Okay, I'll check it out and see what's more detailed.

Korean: 그리고 보육교직원 관련해서는 저출산고령화대책과를 클릭을 하신 후에요
English: And for childcare workers, click on the Low Birth Rate and Aging Society Countermeasures Department.

Korean: 하단으로 업무내용을 확인 해주시면 좋으실 듯 합니다
English: I think it would be better if you check the work content below.
Yes, that's what it looks like in terms of work.

Korean: 네 대표번호가 있는 부분이 아니고 담당자마다 번호가 있어서요
English: It's not that there's a representative number, but each person in charge has a number.

Korean: 저희 쪽에서 업무를 확인하는 부분입니다 불편을 드려서 정말 죄송합니다
English: This is a part of our work to check. We are truly sorry for any inconvenience.

Korean: 아까 제가 통화 했던 주무관님이랑 통화 하고 싶은데 연결 좀 해주시겠어요
English: I would like to speak to the officer I spoke to earlier. Could you please connect me?

Korean: 저희가 처음 연결해드린 담당자 분으로 연결을 하도록 하겠습니다
English: We will connect you to the person we first connected with.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 예 제가 요양보호사라는 자격증을 신청할려고 하는데요
English: Yes, I'm planning to apply for a nursing assistant license.
Are you a new applicant for nursing care certification?
Yes, this is a new application.

Korean: 신규신청은 교육 받은 기관에서 일괄적으로 신청이 되고 있습니다
English: New applications are being submitted in bulk by the institutions that received training.
Is this something you applied for personally?

Korean: 네 신청하기로 한 날 제가 여행을 좀 장기로 가서요
English: Yes, I'm going on a long trip on the day I decided to apply.

Korean: 그러셨습니까 제가 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: Is that so? I will check and let you know.
Could you please wait a moment?
Yes, I will wait for your confirmation.

Korean: 네 요양보호사 자격증 첫 교부 시에는 직접 방문 접수만 가능하십니다
English: Yes, when you first receive your nursing assistant certificate, you can only apply in person.
There is no other way than to visit in person.
Yes, sir, you can only register in person.
Okay, then I will apply next time I visit.
Yes, thank you. Have a nice day.
Thank you #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
Yes, I am a part-time worker.
I'm curious about how annual leave is used.

Korean: 그러십니까 관련 부서가 서울 지방 고용 노동청인데요
English: Is that so? The relevant department is the Seoul Regional Employment and Labor Office.

Korean: 그래요 지금 통화가 어려워서 전화번호를 문자로 받을 수 있을까요
English: Okay, I'm having trouble getting through right now, so can I get your number via text message?

Korean: 네 가능합니다 전화하신 번호로 보내드리면 될까요
English: Yes, you can. Can I send it to the number you called?
Yes, please send it to this number
Okay, then I'll send you a text.
Thank you for your hard work in this hot weather.

Korean: 네 무더운 날씨 건강 조심 하세요 상담사 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Yes, please take care of your health in this hot weather. This was counselor #@name#
Yes, thank you. Thank you for your hard work.
Nice to meet you, I am #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
Yes, I would like to report #@address#
Yes, is this the complaint you were experiencing at #@address#?

Korean: 당진시에서는 그거를 신고해도 자기는 상관이 없다고만 말씀하시거든요
English: In Dangjin City, even if you report it, they just say it has nothing to do with you.
Is the city saying it won't accept civil complaints right now?

Korean: 현재 업무시간이 지나 민원접수 담당자 연결이 지연되고 있습니다
English: It is currently outside of business hours and there is a delay in connecting with the person in charge of handling complaints.
Chungcheongnam-do doesn't normally accept civil complaints.

Korean: 민원 접수를 해주시면 해당 부서로 연결이 되고 있습니다
English: If you submit a complaint, you will be connected to the relevant department.

Korean: 해당부서를 당진시만 넘기고 충청남도에서는 민원을 안 받아요
English: The relevant department is only handed over to Dangjin City, and Chungcheongnam-do does not accept complaints.

Korean: 아까도 그래서 충청남도에다 한건데 당진시로 다 넘기시더라고요
English: That's why I did it in Chungcheongnam-do earlier, but they transferred it all to Dangjin-si.

Korean: 이전에 혹시 다른 번호로 저희 쪽에 전화 주신 이력 혹시 있으십니까
English: Have you ever called us from another number before?
Yes, you just passed it all to Dangjin City.

Korean: 제가 관광마케팅과에 상담 가능한 부서로 문자전송 해드린 부분이 있습니다
English: I have sent a text message to the tourism marketing department for consultation.
Teacher, do you have another number?

Korean: 애기 엄마들이 그때 번호가 또 있을지 모르겠는데 확인 좀 해보겠습니다
English: I'm not sure if the baby's moms have the number then, but I'll check.

Korean: 네 제가 #@소속# 관련 상담이 가능한지 연결 시도해보겠습니다
English: Yes, I will try to connect to see if I can consult about #@affiliation#
Yes, please do it once.
Teacher, I am truly sorry for the inconvenience.

Korean: 연결이 지연되어 오늘은 통화 어려울 듯 싶습니다
English: I'm afraid I won't be able to talk today due to a delay in connection.
Okay, I understand. Thank you for your hard work.
Hello, I am a counselor from #@Affiliation# Call Center #@Name#

Korean: 혹시 여사울에서 실리 성지까지가 오 점 육 킬로미터 거리라고 하는대요
English: By the way, I heard that the distance from Yeosuul to the Holy Land of Sili is about five and six kilometers.

Korean: 네 선생님 여사울에서 실리 성지 거리 말씀이십니까

Korean: 아홉 시 사십 분에 출발하는 게 열 한 시 이십 분에 도착한다고 하셨잖아요
English: You said it leaves at nine forty and arrives at eleven twenty.

Korean: 여사울에서 보통 실리까지 얼마 정도 걸릴까요

No, it's the Sili Holy Land in Daejeon.

Korean: 대전이 아닌 당진시 합덕으로 있는 부분으로 확인됩니다
English: It is confirmed to be in Hapdeok, Dangjin-si, not Daejeon.
Yes, #@address# is correct
Yes, are you asking about the time it takes for public transportation?

Korean: 만약에 이쪽에서 순례를 하면 도보로 갈 텐데요
English: If you make a pilgrimage from this side, you will go on foot.

Korean: 그냥 대중교통으로는 지금은 당진까지 얼마 정도 소요되나요

Korean: 여사울 성지에서 실리 성지 성당까지 대중교통으로 이동을 하실 경우요
English: If you are traveling from Yeosaul Holy Land to Sili Holy Land Cathedral by public transportation

Korean: 약 사십 분 정도로 소요가 됩니다
English: It takes about forty minutes.

Korean: 사십 분 정도요 그럼 도보로 하면은 한 시간도 넘게 걸리겠네요
English: About forty minutes. If you walk, it will take more than an hour.

Korean: 그 부분까지는 저희 쪽에서 정확한 확인은 어렵습니다 선생님
English: It is difficult for us to confirm that part accurately, sir.

Korean: 그러면 용산역에서 실리 성지로 가게 되면 아홉 몇 시에 있나요

Korean: 선생님 검사소가 아닌 도청 부서 연결 요청이십니까
English: Sir, is this a request to connect to the wiretapping department and not the inspection office?
Yes, it's not a car inspection station.

Korean: 네 제가 다시 한 번 확인해보겠습니다 자동차 검사를 관련해서요

Korean: 지정업체를 관리하는 부서가 있을 거 아니에요
English: There must be a department that manages designated companies.
Yes, I understand what you said, teacher.

Korean: 감독하고 관리 감독하는 부서가 있을 거 아니에요
English: There will be a department that supervises and manages
It's an automobile-related department.

Korean: 네 선생님 제가 다시 한 번 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: Yes, sir. I will check again and let you know.
Okay, please check.

Korean: 네 선생님 문의 주신 부분 혹시 시군청에는 문의를 해 보셨습니까
English: Yes, teacher, have you tried contacting the city or county office regarding the part you asked about?

Korean: 아니요 구청에 있는 걸로 알고 있었는데

Korean: 그러셨습니까 선생님 해당 지정 업체는 제가 확인해보니

Korean: 해당 지역 시군청으로 문의를 주시는 부분으로 확인이 됩니다
English: You can confirm this by contacting the local city/county office.
Yes, it's the city/county office. It's the city/county office, not the district office.
Yes, I will connect you to the representative phone number of #@affiliation#
What department are you in charge of at the city/county office?

Korean: 선생님 부서까진 어렵고 제가 #@소속# 대표 번호로 연결을 해드리겠습니다
English: It's difficult to get to your department, so I'll connect you to the representative number of #@affiliation#.
Nice to meet you, #@Affiliation# #@Affiliation#Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 충청 산업문화철도 사업 담당자가 누군지 좀 알고 싶은데요
English: I would like to know who is in charge of the Chungcheong Industrial and Cultural Railway project.
Sorry, can you say that again?
Yes, Chungcheong Industrial and Cultural Railway.

Korean: 네 충청 산업문화철도이십니까 문의주신 부분 확인후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: Yes, is this the Chungcheong Industrial and Cultural Railway? I will check the part you inquired about and give you information.
Could you please wait a moment?
Yes, please guide me.
Yes, thank you for waiting.
#@Name# I think the part you asked the injection would be good

Korean: 제가 기획관리실에 내용 전달해서 선생님께 연락드릴 수 있도록 하겠습니다
English: I will forward the information to the Planning and Management Office so that they can contact you.
Do you have any further questions?
Then let me ask you one last question.
Yes, it's okay, teacher.
Yes, it's the Central Region East-West Cross-Country Railway.

Korean: 예 중부권 동서횡단철도이십니까 제가 #@URL# 기사를 확인해 보겠습니다
English: Yes, is it the Central Region East-West Cross-country Railway? I will check the article #@URL#

Korean: 중부권 동서횡단철도 관련해서는 천안시 교통과로 문의를 주세요
English: For inquiries regarding the Central Region East-West Cross-Country Railway, please contact the Cheonan City Transportation Department.
You can contact the Cheonan City Transportation Department.

Korean: 네 천안시 교통과로 연락하시면 될 것 같습니다
English: Yes, I think you can contact the Cheonan City Transportation Department.
Okay, I understand

Korean: 네 감사합니다 무더운 날씨에 건강 유의하시기 바랍니다 #@소속# #@이름#였습니다
English: Yes, thank you. Please take care of your health in this hot weather. #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
Yes, it's nothing else. I'm trying to reissue my nursing assistant license.

Korean: 선생님 요양보호사 재발급 구비서류 문의 맞으십니까
English: Teacher, are you asking about the documents required for re-issuing the nursing assistant license?
Yes, I would like to inquire about reissue.

Korean: 네 선생님 혹시 첫 교부 받으신 지역이 충청남도 맞으십니까
English: Yes, teacher, is the region where you first received the teachings in Chungcheongnam-do?
Yes, that would be correct.

Korean: 혹시 재발급 사유가 어떻게 되시는 지 말씀 부탁드립니다
English: Could you please tell me the reason for the reissue?
Yes, I lost it and would like to get it reissued.
Yes, sir, is it lost?

Korean: 접수 방법으로는 방문 접수와 우편 접수가 있습니다
English: There are two methods of application: in person application and mail application.
How can I guide you?
I am an agent. Can I get it issued?

Korean: 제가 대리인발급 관련해서 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: I will check and inform you about the proxy issuance.
Yes, please confirm that you are an agent.

Korean: 네 문의 주신 부분 저희쪽에서 확인 어려워 제가 죄송합니다
English: Yes, I apologize for the difficulty in confirming the part you asked about.

Korean: 제가 저출산고령화 대책과 담당자에게 문의 후 안내해드리겠습니다
English: I will contact the person in charge of the low birth rate and aging population countermeasures department and then inform you.
You can't answer directly there.

Korean: 네 대리 발급 관련해서는 콜센터에서는 답변이 어렵습니다
English: Yes, it is difficult for the call center to answer questions regarding proxy issuance.
Then I'll call you back later.
Yes, please take care of your health in this hot weather. #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Nice to meet you, #@Affiliation# #@Affiliation#Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 예 축산자원개발부 이전 사업 담당자가 누군지 좀 알고 싶은데요
English: Yes, I would like to know who was in charge of the previous project at the Livestock Resources Development Department.

Korean: 축산자원개발부 이전 사업 담당자 연결 요청이십니까
English: Is this a request to connect with the person in charge of the previous project of the Livestock Resources Development Department?
Yes, please give me the previous person in charge

Korean: 선생님 실례지만 축산자원개발부라는 게 어떤 업무인가요
English: Excuse me, teacher, but what does the Livestock Resources Development Department do?

Korean: 국립 축산 자원 개발부라는 기관이 있는데 그 기관의 이전 담당자요
English: There is an organization called the National Livestock Resources Development Agency, and I am the former person in charge of that organization.
Teacher, is the part where you called #@affiliation# correct?
Yes #@Affiliation# is correct

Korean: 제가 축산과에 문의 후 연결해 드리겠습니다
English: I will contact the livestock department and connect you with them.
Hello, this is #@Name# from the Livestock Department.
Yes, hello, this is #@Affiliation# #@Name#

Korean: 축산자원개발부를 이전 사업 담당하시는 부서를 찾고 계십니다
English: We are looking for a department in charge of the previous project of the Livestock Resources Development Department.
That area is managed by the Planning and Management Office.
Planning Manager, thank you for checking.
Yes, thank you. Thank you for your hard work.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 네 다름이 아니고 요양보호사 자격증 대리발급을 하려는데요
English: Yes, it's nothing else. I'm just trying to get a nursing assistant certificate issued on my behalf.

Korean: 네 문의 주신 부분 저희쪽에서 확인 어려워 제가 죄송합니다
English: Yes, I apologize for the difficulty in confirming the part you asked about.

Korean: 제가 저출산고령화 대책과 담당자에게 문의 후 안내해드리겠습니다
English: I will contact the person in charge of the low birth rate and aging population countermeasures department and then inform you.
Yes, I understand. Please connect me quickly.

Korean: 제가 담당자에게 연결하였으나 현재 연결 지연으로 확인됩니다
English: I have connected with the person in charge, but I am currently experiencing connection delays.
Yes, is it delayed a lot?

Korean: 제가 담당자가 선생님께 연락드릴 수 있도록 메모 전달해드리겠습니다
English: I will forward a note to the person in charge so that he or she can contact you.

Korean: 선생님 성함과 연락 가능한 연락처 말씀부탁드립니다
English: Please tell me your teacher's name and contact information.
That's #@name# #@phone#

Korean: 제가 우선 구비서류를 안내해드릴건데 메모 가능하십니까
English: First, I will guide you through the required documents. Can you take notes?
Yes, you can. Please tell me.

Korean: 네 선생님 신분증과 재발급 신청서가 필요합니다
English: Yes, I need your teacher ID and a replacement application form.
Yeah, just those two.

Korean: 네 선생님 재발급신청서는 저출산고령화대책과에 비치되어 있습니다
English: Yes, teacher, the reissue application form is available at the Low Birth Rate and Aging Society Countermeasures Department.

Korean: 또한 반명함 사진 한 장과 수수료 이천 원이 필요합니다
English: Also, one photo of a business card and a fee of two thousand won are required.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.

Korean: 네 감사합니다 더 다른 문의사항 있으십니까
English: Yes, thank you. Do you have any other questions?

Then I lived from the time I was born until now

Korean: 대학을 대전으로 가서 이번에 주소를 대전으로 옮겼거든요
English: I went to college in Daejeon and this time I changed my address to Daejeon.

Korean: 그래도 내년에 시험보는 건 자격조건이 되는 거죠
English: Still, taking the exam next year is a qualification.
For inquiries in the Daejeon area, please contact Daejeon City Hall.
Okay, I understand. I will contact Daejeon City Hall.
#@Affiliation# How may I help you?

Korean: 지역 공무원 시험 볼 때 자격 조건을 좀 여쭤보려고요
English: I would like to ask about the qualifications for taking the local civil service exam.

Korean: 해당 지역에서 몇 년 거주하는 그런 조건이 있잖아요
English: There is a condition that you have to live in that area for several years.

Korean: 몇 년을 살아야 되는지 현재 거주하고 있어야 되는지 궁금해서요
English: I'm wondering how many years I have to live there or if I have to live there now.

Korean: 문의주신 부분 제가 확인 후 안내해드리겠습니다
English: I will check the part you inquired about and then inform you.

Korean: 선생님 오래 기다리게 해드려 정말 죄송합니다
English: Teacher, I'm really sorry for keeping you waiting for so long.

Korean: 혹시 올해 하반기에 응시를 하시는 부분이십니까
English: Are you taking the exam in the second half of this year?
No, I'm going to look at it as a tax accountant next year.

Korean: 지역을 옮겨놔야 되나 하고 여쭤보는 거예요
English: I'm asking if I should move the area.

Korean: 선생님 내년도이신 경우 변경될 수가 있는 부분이 있습니다
English: Teacher, if you are next year, there are some parts that may change.

Korean: 저희 쪽에서 담당자 확인 후 연결해드리겠습니다
English: We will connect you after checking with the person in charge on our side.
Yes, thank you. Please connect.
This is #@Affiliation# who called. Minors must be accompanied by a guardian.

Korean: 근데 저희가 일을 아침에 일찍 나가거든요
English: But we leave for work early in the morning.

Korean: 혹시 우리 딸 이모가 가면 안 되나요
English: Can my daughter's aunt go?
I'm sorry, sir. Is your daughter an adult?
No, I'm a minor. I'm a middle school student.

Korean: 아까 물어보니까 미성년자기 때문에 딸은 올 필요가 없다셔서요
English: I asked earlier and they said my daughter doesn't need to come because she's a minor.
They said that the parent should just bring the documents
Yes, sir, that's right.

Korean: 만약에 친권자가 일이 있어 갖고 못 갈 시에는요
English: What if the parent cannot take it with him/her due to work?

Korean: 다른 분이 갈 수 있나 해서요
English: I was wondering if someone else could go

Korean: 친권자가 방문 어려울 시에 미성년자인 본인이 방문하실 수 있습니다
English: If the parent has difficulty visiting, the minor can visit.

Korean: 또는 이 촌 이내에 친족이 대리 발급 가능합니다
English: Or, a relative within this village can issue it on your behalf.
Okay, yes, I understand for now.
Yes, do you have any other questions?
No, there isn't. Okay, I understand.
This is #@Affiliation# #@Name# who just called
Are you accessing the #@affiliation# homepage?
Yes, I just got in.

Korean: 그러시면 통합 검색란에 조례라고 검색 부탁드립니다
English: If so, please search for ordinance in the integrated search box.

Korean: 조례라고 검색을 하시면 #@소속# 자치 법규 열람 시스템 확인 가능하십니까
English: If you search for ordinance, can you check the local government ordinance viewing system for #@affiliation#?

Korean: 주황색 글씨로 #@소속# 자치 법규라고 되어 있습니다
English: It says in orange letters #@Affiliation# Autonomous Law
The one with the color in the middle
Yes, that's right. Please click.
So you just need to click on the connected permission
Please search for local roads

Korean: 잠시만요 관리에 관한 업무 처리 지침인데요
English: Wait a minute, these are instructions for handling administrative work.
I don't think this is right or not

Korean: 선생님 죄송합니다 업무 다시 한 번만 말씀 부탁드립니다
English: I'm sorry, teacher. Could you please tell me the task again?

Korean: #@소속# 지방도 관리에 관한 업무 처리 지침만 뜨는데요
English: #@Affiliation# Only instructions for processing work related to local road management are displayed
Wait a minute, it's showing up when I connect there.

Korean: #@소속# 도로와 다른 시설을 연결에 관한 이거 찾은 거 맞아요
English: #@Affiliation# I found this about connecting roads and other facilities.

Korean: 네 맞습니까 더 다른 문의 사항 있으십니까
English: Yes, that's correct. Do you have any other questions?
No, not anymore, thank you
Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?

Korean: 우체국 분실물 습득센터 같은 데 전화번호가 혹시 있나요
English: Is there a phone number for something like the post office lost and found center?

Korean: 실례지만 우체국 분실물 습득 센터 문의 이십니까
English: Excuse me, is this the post office lost and found center?

Korean: 면허증이나 뭐 지갑 이런 게 혹시 분실하면 문의할 수 있는 곳이요
English: This is where you can inquire if you lose your driver's license or wallet or something like that.
Yes, by any chance, what region is it?
The region is Cheonan, South Chungcheong Province.

Korean: 천안이나 아산 지역에 경찰서에서 관리하는 유실물 센터가 따로 위치하지 않고요
English: There is no separate lost and found center managed by the police station in Cheonan or Asan.

Korean: 천안 기차역과 천안 아산역 그 두 곳만 유실물 센터가 있는 부분으로 확인됩니다
English: Only two places, Cheonan Train Station and Cheonan Asan Station, have been confirmed to have lost and found centers.

Korean: 혹시 신분증이나 이런거 잃어 버리면 우체통에 넣잖아요
English: If you lose your ID or something like that, you put it in the mailbox, right?

Korean: 이런 것을 좀 해보고 싶어 가지고요
English: I'd like to try something like this

Korean: 선생님께서 분실하신 부분이 자격증이나 신분증인 경우는요
English: What if the part you lost is a certificate or ID card?

Korean: 우체국에 넣어지게 되면 발급한 기관으로 이동이 되고요
English: When it is put into the post office, it is transferred to the issuing agency.

Korean: 그 외에 카드나 지갑 같은 경우는 경찰서로 전달이 된다고 합니다
English: In addition, it is said that cards and wallets are sent to the police station.

Korean: 번거로우시겠지만 #@소속#에 문의를 주시면 좋으실 듯 합니다
English: I know it's a bit inconvenient, but I think it would be better if you contact #@affiliation#

Korean: 만약에 여권이나 이런 것들 잃어 버리면 어떻게 해야 되는지요
English: What should I do if I lose my passport or something like that?
If it's a passport, it's difficult to confirm exactly

Korean: 자격증이나 신분증은 발급 기관으로 가기 때문에요
English: Because the certificate or ID card goes to the issuing agency.

Korean: 여권도 혹시 발급 기관으로 문의를 해 보시는 부분이 좋으실 듯 합니다
English: I think it would be a good idea to contact the issuing agency for your passport.

Korean: 폐차장 관련 담당자를 확인하여 선생님께 전화를 드리겠습니다
English: I will check with the person in charge of the junkyard and call you.
Can I leave my number?
Yes, please tell me your teacher's contact information and name.
Yes my phone number is #@phone#
Excuse me, what is your area?
Here I am now in the #@affiliation# junkyard
Are you inquiring about #@affiliation# junkyard?
Are you inquiring about a junkyard permit?

Korean: 예 폐차장 허가에 대한 문의 입니다
English: Yes, I have a question about the junkyard permit.
I will check and call the teacher.
No, there isn't any, please eat

Korean: 네 업무 처리 잘 되시기 바랍니다 #@소속# 콜센터 #@이름#이였습니다
English: I hope your work goes well #@Affiliation# Call Center #@Name#
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# Call Center #@Name# How may I help you?
There's a car junkyard, right?

Korean: 폐차장 허가에 대해서 여쭤볼려면 누구한테 물어봐야 돼요
English: Who should I ask about junkyard permits?
Are you interested in licensing a car scrapyard?

Korean: 실례지만 그 폐차장 허가는 시군청 업무입니다
English: Excuse me, but that junkyard permit is a city/county office matter.
Have you tried contacting the city or county office?

Korean: 예 문의 했는데요 확인할 게 좀 있어 가지고요
English: Yes, I did inquire, but I have some information to check.
Okay, I will check and let you know.
Yes, teacher, I will wait for your guidance.
Yes, thank you for waiting.
I will direct you to the junkyard permit department.
What is the name of the department in charge there?
The department in charge of the junkyard is the Road Traffic Department.
Who is the person in charge of road traffic?

Korean: 정확한 현재 담당자 확인이 어려워 부서로 확인해 보아야 할 거 같습니다
English: It is difficult to confirm the exact person in charge, so you will need to check with the department.
I will check and call the teacher.
Do I need to check with the person in charge?

Korean: 네 폐차장 관련으로 담당자 현재 확인이 어렵습니다
English: Yes, it is difficult to confirm with the person in charge regarding the junkyard at the moment.
Isn't there a city hall under the wiretapping building?
Yes, that's right, city hall

Korean: 네 그러면 위에 업무 밑에 있다는 얘긴데 말이 안 되죠
English: Yes, then that means the work above is under it, which doesn't make sense.
Hello, I am a counselor from #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?

Korean: 빨리 자격증을 발급받으려면 제가 어떻게 해야 할까요
English: What should I do to get my certificate issued quickly?

Korean: 교육 기관으로 신속히 처리될 수 있도록 민원을 제기해 주세요
English: Please file a complaint with the educational institution so that it can be processed promptly.

Korean: 학원에서 신경을 안 써서 제가 직접 발급받으려 해요
English: Since the academy doesn't pay attention, I'm going to get it issued myself.

Korean: 선생님이 서류를 준비하시기에는 교육기관에 협조도 필요한 부분이 있어요
English: There are some areas where teachers need to cooperate with educational institutions in preparing documents.
Yes, teacher, what you said is right.
I'm so frustrated I could die

Korean: 선생님 교육기관에 불편 민원을 제출하는 게 어떨까요
English: Teacher, how about filing a complaint to the educational institution?

Korean: 해당 민원은 도청 요양 보호사 담당자에게 문의를 해보시면 좋으실 듯합니다
English: I think it would be best to contact the person in charge of the nursing care at the city hall regarding this complaint.
Then can it be solved right away?
Yes, I will help you as much as I can.

Korean: 제가 요양 보호사 담당자로 바로 연결하겠습니다
English: I will connect you directly to the caregiver in charge.
Yes, thank you. Please connect me.

Korean: 제가 요양 보호사 첫 교부 시 필요한 서류를 안내해 드릴까요
English: Shall I guide you through the documents required for the first nursing assistant assignment?

Korean: 네 제가 따로 가서 진행할 때 필요한 거 알려 주세요
English: Yes, please let me know what I need to do when I go separately.
Yes, can you take notes?
I'll bring a pen to take notes.

Korean: 네 요양 보호사 발급 신청서가 필요하고요
English: Yes, I need an application for issuance of a nursing assistant.

Korean: 발급 신청서는 어디서 떼 달라고 하는 거예요
English: Where can I get the application form?
#@Affiliation# Can be issued on the website
Yes, you mean the #@affiliation# homepage

Korean: 네 먼저 민원 서식에서 양식을 다운로드하여 작성 해야 합니다
English: Yes, first you need to download the form from the complaint form and fill it out.

Korean: 기재 되는 내용은 교육 기관으로 문의를 해주셔야 하구요
English: For details on the contents, please contact the educational institution.
Do I also need the materials I practiced at the nursing home?

Korean: 네 선생님 요양원에서 실습하셨던 부분도 필요합니다
English: Yes, sir, I also need the part about your practical training at the nursing home.

Korean: 고객님 자격증 발급이 빠르게 진행될 수 있도록 해서요
English: So that the customer's certificate can be issued quickly.
Have you tried calling the academy?

Korean: 네 제가 몇 번이나 학원에 전화를 했어요
English: Yes, I called the academy several times.

Korean: 혹시 선생님이 다니던 학원의 종류는 무엇인가요
English: By the way, what kind of academy did you go to?
The academy I went to was a nursing academy.

Korean: 간호 학원인데 그 요양 보호사 관련 업종은 아니에요
English: It's a nursing school, but it's not a nursing care related industry.

Korean: 그런데 거기 요양 보호사 교육을 그냥 시키더라고요
English: But they just gave them nursing assistant training there.

Korean: 그래서 확실히 전문 학원보다는 신경을 덜 쓰더라고요
English: So, I definitely felt less nervous than at a professional academy.
I'm sure you were worried

Korean: 학원의 다른 수강생들도 아직 미발급 상태인가요
English: Are other students at the academy still not receiving their certificates?
Yes, they are all unissued

Korean: 고객님 자격증 발급에 필요한 서류는 모두 구비하셨나요
English: Customer, do you have all the documents required for issuing your certificate?
Yes, I have all the necessary documents.

Korean: 그런데 이 학과는 왜 도청에 안 갖다 줄까요
English: But why doesn't this department go to the wiretapping department?

Korean: 그건 혼자 서류를 준비를 하시기에는 어려움이 있어서 그럴 거예요
English: That's probably because it's difficult to prepare the documents on your own.

Korean: 그런데 제가 서류를 다 학원에 제출했거든요
English: But I submitted all the documents to the academy.
Have you already submitted everything to the academy?

Korean: 네 말씀 하신 자료들 모두 제출했어요
English: Yes, I submitted all the materials you mentioned.
All materials will be at the academy.
Yes, the academy probably keeps them all.

Korean: 학원에서는 왜 제출 안 했다고 하던가요
English: Why did the academy say I didn't submit it?

Korean: 어떤 인증 과정을 거쳐야 한다고 하더라고요
English: They said I had to go through some kind of certification process

Korean: 그래서 서류를 모두 가져다줬는데 신경을 안 쓰는 거 같아요
English: So I brought all the documents to him, but he didn't seem to care.

Korean: 그 인증 과정이라는게 어떤 건진 설명이 없던가요
English: Wasn't there any explanation of what that certification process was?

Korean: 네 설명은 해 줬는데 들어도 모르겠더라구요
English: I gave you an explanation, but you still didn't understand.

Korean: 선생님 교육 받으셨던 기관으로 위임하여 신청하셨나요
English: Did you apply through the institution where you received training?

Korean: 네 학원에서 신청 하라고 해서 건강 검진까지 다 받았어요
English: Yes, I even got a health checkup because my school told me to.

Korean: 그런대 아직도 학원에서 도청에 가져다주지 않았더라고요
English: But the academy hasn't brought it to the wiretapping yet
Teacher, you must have been very uncomfortable.

Korean: 그래서 제가 개인적으로 원하는 거 가지고 가려고요
English: So I'm going to take what I personally want
How much is the certificate recognition fee?

Korean: 네 선생님 발급 수수료는 만 원입니다
English: Yes, teacher, the issuance fee is ten thousand won.
Is the certificate recognition fee ten thousand won?

Korean: 네 수수료 준비하시고 그 외에 시스템 등록하는 부분이 있습니다
English: Yes, please prepare the fee and there is a part where you register with the system.

Korean: 등록을 하기 위한 파일을 교육 기관을 통해서 협조를 해야 합니다
English: You must cooperate with the educational institution to submit the files for registration.
Cooperation from educational institutions is also needed.
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# Call Center#@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 요양 보호사 자격증 거기서 발급해주나요
English: Yes, hello. Do they issue nursing assistant certificates there?
Did you receive your first award from #@affiliation#?
I received my first teaching from #@affiliation#
Is the first region you received the grant in Chungnam?
Yes, I passed the first teaching exam in Chungnam.
I heard that they issue certificates there.
So is the issuance of the certificate new?

Korean: 네 요양 보호사 자격증 신규 발급입니다
English: Yes, this is a new issuance of a nursing assistant certificate.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 다름이 아니고요 협동 조합 설립 신청을 할려고 하는데요
English: It's nothing else. I'm trying to apply for the establishment of a cooperative.

Korean: 필요한 서류를 다운 받으려는데 어떻게 해야 되죠
English: How do I download the necessary documents?

Korean: 선생님 문의 주신 부분 제가 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: I will check the part you asked about and give you an answer.

Korean: 문의주신 협동 조합 설립 요건을 인터넷 검색해봤습니다
English: I searched the Internet for the requirements for establishing a cooperative you asked about.

Korean: 다섯 명 이상 시 설립 가능하나 제한된 사업 분야가 있을 수 있습니다
English: It can be established by five or more people, but there may be restrictions on the business areas.

Korean: 문의 하실 수 있는 기관 확인 후 안내해드리겠습니다
English: We will guide you after confirming the institution you can inquire about.
Yes, I see. I understand. Please help.

Korean: 도청 내에 경제 정책과에 협동 조합 관련 담당자 확인됩니다
English: The person in charge of the cooperative is identified in the economic policy department within the city hall.
I'll connect you right away.
Yes, please connect me to that side.
Teacher, I am truly sorry for the inconvenience.

Korean: 현재 협동조합 관련 담당자 연결 지연으로 확인됩니다
English: We are currently experiencing delays in connecting with the person in charge of the cooperative.

Korean: 한 시 이후에 선생님께 연락드릴 수 있도록 메모 전달해 드리겠습니다
English: I'll send you a note so you can contact your teacher after one o'clock.

Korean: 선생님 성함과 연락 받으실 수 있는 연락처 말씀 부탁드립니다
English: Please tell me your name and contact information.

Korean: #@소속# 홈페이지에 민원 자격증 신청서에서 다운로드 가능하십니다
English: #@Affiliation# You can download the application form for civil petition qualification from the homepage.
There are a lot of documents required. Can you take notes?
Yes, I can, but my phone battery is dead.
Then, would you please contact me again?
Yes, I will. Thank you.
Yes, teacher, this is #@affiliation#. Can I still talk?
Yes, please speak. I'm listening.

Korean: 네 확인 결과 본인이 가능하다고 확인됩니다
English: Yes, I have verified that you are eligible.

Korean: 다만 정확한 확인은 가까운 주민 센터에서만 가능하십니다
English: However, accurate confirmation is only possible at a nearby community center.

Korean: 해당 기관에서 정확히 문의해 보셔야 할 것 같습니다
English: I think you should inquire directly with the relevant agency.
I understand that only I can do this.

Korean: 네 본인이 직접 신청하는 부분으로 확인됩니다
English: Yes, it is confirmed through the application you made yourself.
Well, as long as I don't die

Korean: 말소된 주민등록증을 되살릴 방법도 본인이라는 거죠
English: The only way to restore a cancelled resident registration card is to do it yourself.
Your agent cannot act on your behalf.

Korean: 선생님 다만 인터넷 검색이 정확하지 않을 수 있습니다
English: Teacher, but internet search may not be accurate

Korean: 주민 등록관 련 신고는 인터넷으로 신청하실 경우에도요
English: Even if you apply for resident registration-related reports online,
This requires public certification.

Korean: 읍면동 주민센터로 방문 접수를 해 주시기 바랍니다
English: Please visit your local town/village/dong community center to register.
Is it really not possible?

Korean: 선생님 정확한 문의는 읍면동 주민센터에 문의를 하셔야 합니다
English: Teacher, for exact inquiries, you should contact your local community center.
What if my resident registration card has been cancelled?

Korean: 대리인이나 공인인증서를 통해 되살렸다고 해도 말이에요
English: Even if it was revived through an agent or public certificate.

Korean: 본인이 모르면 옮겨진 주소지 변동도 모른다는 거죠
English: If you don't know, you won't know that your address has changed.

Korean: 선생님 죄송하지만 본인 여부를 확인할 수 없습니다
English: I'm sorry, teacher, but I can't verify your identity.

Korean: 그래서 전화 상으로는 더 이상의 상담이 어려우실 듯합니다
English: So, I don't think we can discuss this further over the phone.
Hello, this is #@affiliation#. How may I help you?

Korean: 주소지 변경한 거 확인하려고 하는데 좀 안 되나요
English: I'm trying to check if my address has changed, but it's not working.

Korean: 제가 어느 쪽으로 주소지를 옮겼는지 몰라요
English: I don't know which way my address has moved.

Korean: 네 선생님 혹시 예전 주소지는 모르십니까
English: Yes, sir, do you happen to know my old address?
I only know that my old address was in Chungnam.
Which city or county in South Chungcheong Province are you from?

Korean: 아니 제가 예전 주소는 경기도 수원시였고요
English: No, my old address was Suwon-si, Gyeonggi-do.
Yes, you were in Suwon, Gyeonggi-do.

Korean: 그 다음에 옮겨진 주소는 어디인지 몰라요
English: I don't know where the address was moved to next.

Korean: 그렇다면 이전 주소지로 문의를 주셔도 좋으실 듯합니다
English: In that case, I think it would be better to contact the previous address.

Korean: 이전 주소지인 수원시에 전화 상으로 답변을 들을 수 있나요
English: Can I get an answer over the phone at my previous address in Suwon City?

Korean: 상세 업무는 저희 쪽에서 도움 드리기가 어렵습니다
English: It is difficult for us to help you with detailed work.

Korean: 직접 상담해 보시는 부분이 가장 좋으실 듯합니다
English: I think it would be best to consult with them directly.

Korean: 저는 지금 수원시가 아니라는 것밖에 못 들었어요
English: All I've heard is that it's not Suwon City right now.

Korean: 등본 떼고 막 이러지 않는 한 알 수 없는 거잖아요
English: You wouldn't know unless you took a copy and did something like that.
Yes, that's right, teacher.

Korean: 그럼 혹시 주민 등록이 말소가 됐다고 하면요
English: Then what if your resident registration has been cancelled?

Korean: 어느 쪽에도 주소지가 등록되어 있지 않다는 뜻 아닌가요
English: Doesn't that mean that the address is not registered on either side?

Korean: 네 말소는 주소지가 등록되어 있지 않는 부분입니다
English: Yes, the deletion is the part where the address is not registered.

Korean: 그럼 말소된 사람의 주민등록을 이용할 수 있지 않나요
English: Then, can't I use the resident registration of a person whose registration has been deleted?

Korean: 다른 사람이 대리 신청으로 주소지 이전을 할 수 있는 건가요
English: Can someone else change my address by proxy?

Korean: 말소 신청 관련해서 대리인이 신청 가능한지 확인해 보겠습니다
English: I will check if an agent can apply for the cancellation.
Yes, please find out quickly.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 저기 뭐 좀 문의할 게 있는데요
English: I have something to ask you.

Korean: 혹시 본인 몰래 주소지가 옮겨질 수 있나요
English: Is it possible for my address to change without my knowledge?

Korean: 이럴 경우에는 어떻게 대처를 해야 되는 건가요
English: How should I deal with this situation?

Korean: 주소지의 읍면동 주민 센터로 문의 부탁드립니다
English: Please contact the local community center in your town or district.

Korean: 그러면 옮겨갈 주소지를 알 수 있나요
English: Then can you tell me the address to which I will move?

Korean: 죄송하지만 그 부분은 저희 쪽에서 확인이 어렵습니다
English: Sorry, but we can't confirm that part.

Korean: 해당 지역의 읍면동 주민 센터에 문의 부탁드립니다
English: Please contact the local town/village/dong community center.

Korean: 전화상으로 알아볼 수 있는 방법은 전혀 없는 건가요
English: Is there no way to find out over the phone?

Korean: 개인 정보로 인하여 저희 측에서는 전화 상으로 어렵습니다
English: Due to privacy concerns, we are unable to answer your questions over the phone.

Korean: 직접 방문 또는 해당 주민 센터로 전화 상담 부탁드립니다
English: Please visit in person or call the relevant community center for consultation.

Korean: 아니 제가 알 수도 없는 데다가 지금 갇혀 있는 쪽이라서요
English: No, I don't know and I'm the one who's stuck right now.

Korean: 밖에 나갈 수 없고 병원에 입원 중이거든요
English: I can't go out and I'm in the hospital.
Yes, that must be hard.

Korean: 예 그래서 혹시 이런 경우에는 어떻게 대처해야 하나요
English: Yes, so how should I deal with this situation?

Korean: 입원해 있는 환자가 할 수 있는 방법이 없을까요
English: Is there anything that a hospitalized patient can do?

Korean: 네 죄송합니다 주민 센터로 문의해 주시는 부분이 좋으실 듯합니다
English: Yes, I'm sorry. I think it would be better to contact the community center.
Okay, I'll call you back.
Hello, this is #@affiliation# counseling center.
I'm moving and waiting for a daycare center.

Korean: 읍면동 주민 센터 말씀해 주시면 연결 도와드리겠습니다
English: If you tell us at your local community center, we will help you connect.
Do you also accept applications for this at the community center?

Korean: 네 다만 해당 주민 센터에 신고를 해 주셔야 합니다

Korean: 아이들의 주민 번호나 이런 걸 알려 주고 신고를 해야 되나요

Korean: 네 맞습니다 어린이집 입소 대기 신청을 위해서는요

Please report to the community center first.

Korean: 담당자와 따로 상담을 해 보시는 부분이 좋으실 듯합니다

Yes, then I will move to #@address#

#@Address# Is this the correct address?

English: Yes, as of August 1st, it has been upgraded to #@Address#
I will connect you directly to the main number.

Korean: 혹시 대표 번호도 알 수 있을까요
English: Could you please tell me your representative number?
Yes, can you take notes now?
Yes, you can take notes now
Yes, this is #@phone number#. I will connect you.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 두 달 뒤에 충청남도 홍성으로 이사를 가거든요

Korean: 그곳은 어린이집 대기를 어떻게 해야 되는지 궁금해서요
English: I'm curious about how the waiting list for daycare is there.

English: Yes, that's right. You can apply at the community center of the town or district you are moving to.

Korean: 제가 신청 가능한 부분이 있는지도 확인해 보겠습니다
English: I will also check if there is any part I can apply for.
Could you please wait a moment?
Yes, please check and let me know.

Korean: 선생님 오래 기다리게 해 드려 죄송합니다

Korean: 지역 내 어린이집 입소 대기 신청으로 확인해 보았는데요

Korean: 충남만 따로 입소 대기 신청 가능한 홈페이지는 확인이 어렵습니다

Korean: 네 메인 화면에 어린이집 입소 대기 신청 배너가 확인됩니다
English: Yes, you will see a banner for applying for daycare center admission on your main screen.
Teacher, have you checked?

Korean: 네 확인했어요 여기서 하면 될 것 같아요

Korean: 네 다행입니다 문의 사항 더 있으십니까
English: Yes, that's great. Do you have any further questions?
It's okay, thank you. Have a nice day.
Hello, this is #@affiliation#
Yes, thank you #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Hello, how may I help you?

Korean: 담당자 뒷번호가 #@전번#이고요 다시 한 번 연락 주시겠어요
English: The last number of the person in charge is #@phone number#. Please call me again.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
I'm really sorry I couldn't help you.

Korean: 제가 확인해 보니 담당자가 다른 분으로 확인되었습니다
English: I checked and it turned out that the person in charge was someone else

Korean: 그렇군요 제가 다시 한 번 해당 민원인께 연결을 시도하겠습니다
English: Okay, I'll try to connect with the complainant again.
Yes, please connect me with the person in charge.

Korean: 말씀 드리지만 민원인의 어린이집 공기청정기 지원 관련 문의입니다
English: I would like to ask you about the request for support for air purifiers at the daycare center.

Korean: 같이 확인할게요 #@소속#에서 공기청정기 사업을 병행하고 있어요

Korean: 하지만 지금은 어린이집 공기청정기를 시행하지 않습니다

Korean: 민원인께서 현재 관련 문의로 기다리고 계셔서요
English: The complainant is currently waiting for a related inquiry.
Sir, can you give me an answer right away?
You're waiting for a call right now
Yes, can you return my call?
Yes, you can call me right away.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
I would like to ask you about the daycare department.

Korean: 선생님 실례지만 어린이집 어떤 어떤 문의이십니까

Korean: 이번에 어린이집에 공기청정기 지원하는 게 있다고 들어서요

Korean: 다른 쪽에 다 시행이 됐다고 하는데 여기는 어떤지 궁금해서요

Korean: 지난 번에 일괄적으로 모두 받았다고 얘기를 하시더라고요

Korean: 이번 달에 시행이 이미 된 겁니까
English: Has it already been implemented this month?

Korean: 아니면 확정된 날짜가 혹시 있는 겁니까

Korean: 언제 공문이 내려오는 건지 알고 싶어서 전화했습니다
English: I called to find out when the official document would be released.

Korean: 선생님 실례지만 해당 지역에 시군청에는 문의를 해 보셨습니까
English: Excuse me, teacher, but have you tried contacting the city or county office in that area?

Korean: 아니요 안 했습니다 제가 여기 서산이고 #@소속#에 문의를 했거든요
English: No, I didn't. I'm here in Seosan and I contacted #@affiliation#.

Korean: 근데 도청에서 시행돼야 시로 내려온다 그러더라고요
English: But they said that it has to be implemented in the city hall before it can be passed down to the city.

Korean: 빠른 데가 도청이라고 얘기를 하셔서 연락드렸어요
English: I contacted you because you said that the quick one was wiretapping.

Korean: 네 그러시군요 제가 도청 담당자 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다

Could you please wait a moment?
Yes, I understand. Please check and contact me.

Korean: 선생님 오래 기다리게 해 드려 정말 죄송합니다

Korean: 현재 정확한 담당자 확인이 어려운 상태입니다

Korean: #@소속#에 관련 담당자에게 문의 후 연결해 드리겠습니다
English: #@Affiliation# We will contact you after contacting the relevant person in charge.
Sorry for keeping you waiting. This is counselor #@Affiliation#, #@Name#

English: The individual notice branch office is confirmed to be 3,610,000 won

Korean: 그게 아니라 토지하고 주택하고 가격 합계가 얼마가 되나요

Korean: 토지 소재지에 개별 공시 지가로 안내해 드렸습니다

The price of the house is the announced price

Korean: 해당 부분은 서울 부동산 정보 조회 시스템에서 가능합니다
English: This section is available in the Seoul Real Estate Information Inquiry System.
Okay, I understand. Thank you.

Korean: 제가 더 감사합니다 다른 문의 사항 있으십니까
English: I appreciate it more. Do you have any other questions?
No other inquiries

Korean: 네 업무 처리 잘 되시길 바랍니다 #소속# #@이름#였습니다
English: I hope your work goes well #affiliation# #@name#
#@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
#@Address# I want to find out the public housing price.

Korean: 해당 지역의 주택 공시 가격이십니까 혹은 주택 공시 지가이십니까
English: Is this the assessed value of the house in the area or the assessed land price of the house?
This is the public housing price.
Excuse me, which city or county are you from?
This is #@Address# in Songpa-gu, Seoul

Korean: 네 선생님 그러시면 해당 시청 #@전번#으로 문의 부탁드립니다

Korean: 그게 아니고요 간단한 건데 컴퓨터로 잠깐만 조회 한 번 해 주세요
English: No, it's simple. Please check it out on your computer for a moment.
Yes, then please tell me your address.
#@Address# Please check this.
Yes sir, is #@address# correct?
Yes, that's right. Please check.

Korean: 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려 주시겠습니까
English: I will check and inform you. Could you please wait a moment?
Okay, I understand. Take your time.
#@Affiliation# I am a counselor. Thank you for waiting.
Do you have an IRS representative?

Korean: 해당 부분은 국세청으로 직접 문의 부탁드리겠습니다
English: Please contact the National Tax Service directly for this matter.

Korean: 예 그러면 그 부서와 국세청 정보를 좀 알려주세요

Korean: 선생님 죄송하지만 저희 쪽에서 부서 확인은 어렵습니다

Please contact #@phone number#

Korean: 제가 #@전번#으로 전화를 했더니 다른 곳이 받더라고요

Korean: 그러시면 제가 지역에 세무서 번호 안내해 드리겠습니다

Korean: 해당 용량 관련하여 도청에서 담당하는 담당자가 있습니다
English: There is a person in charge of wiretapping in relation to that capacity.
Could you please connect me to the wiretapping officer?
Yes, I will connect you directly to the person in charge.
Thank you. I will wait.
Hello, this is #@affiliation#call center. How may I help you?

Korean: 다름이 아니고 도지사 상 관련해서 문의인데요
English: It's nothing else, but I have a question regarding the governor's award.

Korean: 저희가 만약 상신을 할려면은 결격 사유가 어떻게 되는지 알아볼려구요
English: If we were to submit a complaint, we would like to find out what the disqualification reasons are.

Korean: 죄송합니다 어떤 결격 사유인지 다시 한 번만 말씀해 주시겠습니까
English: Sorry, can you tell me again what the disqualification is?
Yes, I have a question about the governor's award.

Korean: 도지사 표창 관련 맞으십니까 실례지만 어떤 상에 의한 것이십니까
English: Is this about the Governor's Award? Excuse me, but what award is it?

Korean: 그냥 정의가 무슨 상이라고 지금 딱히 이렇게는 안 돼 있고요
English: It's just that justice is not like this right now.

Korean: 만약에 상신을 알려고 할 때 결격적인 그니까 공통적인 것들요
English: If you want to know the disqualification, then these are common things.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 제가 말씀 하신 도지사 표창 결격 사유 관련으로요
English: Yes, I understand. Regarding the disqualification for the governor's award that I mentioned,

Korean: 답변 가능한 담당자 확인 후 연결해 드리겠습니다
English: We will connect you after confirming the person in charge who can answer.
Could you please wait a moment?
Okay, please find out and let me know.
Thank you for waiting
Excuse me, but regarding the governor's award

Korean: 민간인 또는 공무원 표창인지에 따라 담당 부서가 나뉘어져 있습니다
English: The departments in charge are divided depending on whether it is a civilian or public official award.

Korean: #@소속#에 도지사 표창 관련으로 담당자 확인해 전화 요청 드릴까요
English: #@Affiliation# Shall I ask you to call the person in charge regarding the governor's award?

Korean: 아니요 번호를 알려 주세요 제가 그 쪽으로 전화 나중에 해도 되는데
English: No, please give me your number so I can call you later.

Korean: 네 제가 직통 전화 번호 안내해 드리겠습니다 혹시 메모 가능하십니까
English: Yes, I will give you the direct phone number. Can you make a note of it?

Korean: 네 가능해요 메모 할게요 불러 주세요
English: Yes, I can. I'll make a note of it. Please call me.
My phone number is #@phone number#. Did you make a note of it?
Yes, I made a good note, thank you

Korean: 네 감사합니다 다른 문의 사항 있으십니까
English: Yes, thank you. Do you have any other questions?
No, there isn't. Thank you for your advice.
I hope your work goes smoothly. #@Affiliation#Call Center#@Name#
Hello, this is #@Affiliation#Call Center#@Name#. How may I help you?
Yes, thank you for your hard work. It's nothing else.

Korean: 건설 산업 기본법에 관련되서 좀 여쭤볼려 그러는데요
English: I would like to ask you something about the Construction Industry Basic Law.
Are you talking about the Construction Industry Basic Law?

Korean: 제가 논의 하실 수 있는 부서 확인 후 연결해 드리겠습니다
English: I will connect you with the department you can discuss with.
Yes, please connect me, counselor.
Yes, thank you for waiting.

Korean: 제가 건설 정책과에 문의 후 연결해 드리겠습니다
English: I will contact the Construction Policy Department and connect you with them.
Yes, I would appreciate it if you could do that.
I'm really sorry, teacher.

Korean: 건설 정책과에 답변 가능한 직원이 모두 자리비움으로 확인이 됩니다
English: All staff members who can answer questions in the Construction Policy Division are confirmed to be absent

Korean: 제가 담당 부서 담당자가 자리에 돌아오는 대로요
English: As soon as the person in charge of the department returns to his/her seat

Korean: 선생님께 연락드릴 수 있도록 메모 전달해 드리겠습니다
English: I will pass on a note to you so you can contact your teacher.

Korean: 연락 주신 번호로 메모 전달을 해 드리면 되겠습니까
English: Could you please send me a note to the number you provided?

Korean: 아니 건설 정책과에 지금 한 명도 없다는 거예요
English: No, there's no one in the construction policy department right now.

Korean: 네 선생님 답변 가능한 직원이 전부 자리 비움으로 확인이 되었습니다
English: Yes, sir. We have confirmed that all staff members who can answer are out of their seats.
I'm really sorry for the inconvenience.

Korean: 참 나 뭐 하느라 그래서 한 명두 읍댜
English: What am I doing that's why I'm crying

Korean: 네 죄송합니다 선생님 한 시 이후에 연락드릴 수 있도록요
English: Yes, sorry, sir. I will contact you after one o'clock.
I'll pass the note on to you.

Korean: 진짜 벌써 밥 먹으러 나간 것도 아닐테고 열 두 시가 안 됐는데요
English: It's not like you've even gone out to eat yet, and it's not even twelve o'clock yet.

Korean: 전화 받는 사람이 한 명도 없다는 게 말이 돼요
English: It makes sense that no one would answer the phone.

Korean: 네 불편 드려 죄송합니다 저희 쪽에서는 정확한 확인이 어렵습니다
English: Yes, we apologize for the inconvenience. It is difficult for us to confirm this accurately.

Korean: 메모 전달하여 담당자가 연락 드릴 수 있도록 메모를 전달하겠습니다
English: I will forward your note so that the person in charge can contact you.
Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 재난안전대책본부 중에서 지역 별로 총괄 담당하는 부서가 어디예요
English: Which department in the disaster safety headquarters is in charge of each region?

Korean: 재난 안전 대책 본부 총괄 부서 문의십니까
English: Are you inquiring about the Disaster and Safety Countermeasures Headquarters General Department?

Korean: 말씀 하신 재난 안전 대책 본부의 운영 및 관리 담당자가요
English: Are you the person in charge of operations and management of the disaster safety headquarters that you mentioned?
Located in the Disaster Response Division of the Wiretapping Department

Korean: 재난 대응과 번호 좀 알려 주세요
English: Could you please tell me the disaster response number?
Excuse me, but what kind of disaster is it?
It's a flood, like a flood during the monsoon season.

Korean: 수해 관련 어떤 업무이신지 자세히 말씀을 해 주시겠습니까
English: Could you please tell me more about your flood-related work?

Korean: 수리 봉사를 하는 사람을 주제로 휴먼 다큐멘터리 촬영을 하고 있어요
English: I'm filming a human documentary on people who do repair service.
Are you filming a documentary on an individual subject?

Korean: 네 이분이 장애인 가정집만 대상으로 집수리를 해 주시는데요
English: Yes, this person only does home repairs for the homes of disabled people.

Korean: 촬영이 다양한 동선이 필요해서 지역 근처에 수해민을 섭외하려고요
English: Since filming requires a variety of routes, we plan to recruit flood victims from nearby areas.
Yeah, you're doing a good job, that's why

Korean: 네 이런 것들을 촬영 가능하신 분들 섭외가 가능할까 싶어 가지고요
English: Yes, I was wondering if it would be possible to recruit people who can film these things.

Korean: 관련으로 도청에 정확한 담당 부서 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: In relation to this, we will confirm with the wiretapping department and inform you of the exact department in charge.

Korean: 휴먼 다큐멘터리 촬영 위해서 수해입은 분들을 섭외하여서요
English: We recruited flood victims to film a human documentary.

Korean: 무료로 수리해 주시면서 촬영 협조 요청하는 부분 맞으십니까
English: Is this the part where you ask for cooperation in filming while repairing it for free?

Korean: 네 침수가 된 집이라든가 농기계라든가 다 하실 수 있는 분이에요
English: Yes, you can do everything from flooded houses to farm machinery.

Korean: 알겠습니다 담당 부서 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: Okay, I will check with the department in charge and let you know.

Korean: 재난 대응과에 자연 재해 피해 복구 관련담당자에게 문의를 했습니다
English: I contacted the disaster response team and the person in charge of natural disaster recovery.

Korean: 그런데 문의 주신 부분이 촬영을 위한 부분이셔서요
English: But the part you asked about was for filming.

Korean: 따로 수해 피해 입은 분들은 안내를 할 수 없다고 전달을 받았습니다
English: We were told that we cannot provide guidance to those who suffered flood damage separately.
Is there any other way?

Korean: 네 그래서 현재 수해 피해가 충남 지역 중에는요
English: Yes, so the current flood damage is in the Chungnam region.

Korean: 천안 아산 지역이 피해를 많이 입은 부분으로 확인됩니다
English: Cheonan Asan area is confirmed to have suffered the most damage

Korean: 그러니 천안 신창이나 아산 시청으로 촬영 관련으로 확인이 가능한지요
English: So, is it possible to check with Cheonan Sinchang or Asan City Hall regarding filming?
I think it would be a good idea to inquire

Korean: 저희가 촬영할 수 있는 지역이 정해져 있었던 권역이라고 하는데요
English: They say that there is a designated area where we can film.

Korean: 서산 간진 태안 청양 홍성 예산 중에서 신고가 들어왔거나 하는 거요
English: There are reports coming in from Seosan, Ganjin, Taean, Cheongyang, Hongseong, and Yesan.

Korean: 이런 거는 거기서 확인이 안 될까요
English: Can't this be confirmed there?

Korean: 신고가 들어왔다는 말씀이 신고를 한 사람의 정보이십니까
English: When you say a report has been received, does that mean you have information about the person who made the report?

Korean: 아니면 많은 피해를 입은 지역 확인이십니까
English: Or is it a check of the areas that have suffered a lot of damage?

Korean: 피해가 어느 정도인지 만약에 한 건도 안 들어왔다고 하면
English: If we don't hear anything about the extent of the damage,

Korean: 저희가 알아볼 필요가 없는데 좀 들어왔다고 하면요
English: If you come in, we don't need to know, but

Korean: 동사무소 쪽으로도 전화를 해서 신청을 받을 수 있는 부분이니까요
English: You can also call the local office to apply.

Korean: 그러시면 선생님 조금 전 말씀하신 지역이요
English: Then, the area you mentioned a little while ago, teacher

Korean: 서산 당진 예산 태안 청양 홍성에 해당하는 시 군으로 해서요
English: The cities and counties corresponding to Seosan, Dangjin, Yesan, Taean, Cheongyang, and Hongseong

Korean: 현재 담당자에게 한번 더 문의 후에 안내를 해 드리겠습니다
English: I will contact the person in charge again and then give you further information.
Yes, please do that once.

Korean: 제가 도청의 행정 도지사님 면담 요청서라고 해 가지고요
English: I have a request for an interview with the administrative governor of the wiretapping department.

Korean: 네 행정 도지사님 면담 요청서를 공문으로 보내셨습니까
English: Have you sent an official letter requesting an interview with your provincial governor?

Korean: 산림 계장하고 면담 신청을 같이 조사받는 것으로 해 준다고 하더군요
English: They said that they would investigate the request for an interview with the forestry chief together.
Yes sir, are you the forest chief of the wiretapping department?
There's a guy called Chief in the forest.

Korean: 좌담회식으로 장소를 만들어주고 그것으로 끝나겠다 얘기를 하길래요
English: He said he would set up a place for a discussion and end it there.

Korean: 아니다 조사관이라는 게 양쪽 얘기를 듣고 문제를 알아야 한다고요
English: No, the investigator has to hear both sides and figure out the problem.

Korean: 가려 주는 것이 조사관이 할 일 아니냐 그렇게 해 달라 해서요
English: I asked them to do so because it is the investigator's job to cover it up.

Korean: 답변 기다리고 있습니다 이 답변을 꼭 요합니다
English: I am waiting for your reply. I really need this reply.

Korean: 네 지금 선생님께서 문서대로 판단을 해 달라고 요청을 하셨고요
English: Yes, the teacher just asked me to make a judgment according to the document.
Are you waiting for a reply now?

Korean: 그렇습니다 그리고 과장님도 그때 본 적이있어요
English: Yes, and I saw it too, sir.

Korean: 과장님도 계장 편 공무원 편 #@소속# 군청 계장 편을 들어서요
English: The manager is also on the side of the section chief and the civil servants. #@Affiliation# The county office section chief is on the side of the civil servants.

Korean: 그렇게 하면 안 되고 행정에 대한 잘못을 가려 달라고 그랬는데요
English: I told them not to do that and to cover up the administrative errors.

Korean: 행정을 잘못한 적이 있으면 가려 줘야 되는 것이지요
English: If there has been an administrative error, it should be covered up.

Korean: 분명히 제가 가져다 준 서류를 검토하고 상대방 서류를 달라고 해서요
English: Obviously, I reviewed the documents I brought and asked for the other party's documents.

Korean: 조사관이 그러면 그거에 대한 답변을 요하는 거라는 얘기입니다
English: The investigator then asks for an answer to that.

Korean: 네 그러면 제가 조사관에게 답변이 현재 진행 중인지 확인하겠습니다
English: Okay, then I will check with the investigator to see if the response is currently in progress.

Korean: 안녕하세요 선생님 문의 하시는 사항이 체험 마을 관련 맞으십니까
English: Hello, teacher. Is your inquiry related to the experience village?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 버섯 단지 때문에 전화 했는데요
English: Yes, hello, I'm calling about the mushroom complex.

Korean: 정부가 주도적으로 버섯 사업 건설을 지원을 해 주는데요
English: The government is taking the lead in supporting the construction of mushroom businesses.

Korean: 거기로 귀농을 할려고 왔는데 그거를 분양 받을려면 사 억을 내래요
English: I came there to do farming, but they want to allocate it to me for 400 million won.

Korean: 거기 그분이 그래서 분명히 저는 정부에서 지원해서 하는 건데요
English: That's why I'm doing it with support from the government.

Korean: 정말로 그 사람 말이 맞나 해서요
English: I really wonder if what he said is true

Korean: 네 선생님 그러십니까 한번 알아봐 드리겠습니다
English: Yes, sir. I will look into it for you.

Korean: 예 정확하게 정부 지원금도 들어 갔기 때문에요
English: Yes, that's right, because government subsidies were also included.

Korean: 일반인한테 사 억이라는 돈을 내고 분양을 받을래면 받아라 하는데요
English: They say that if you want to pay 400 million won to receive an allotment, you should do so.

Korean: 그럴 일은 없을 것 같아 가지고 한번 자세하게 물어볼려고요
English: I don't think that will happen, so I wanted to ask in detail.

Korean: 제가 정확한 담당자 확인 후에 선생님께 연락을 드리도록 하겠습니다
English: I will contact you after confirming the exact person in charge.
Yes, my name is #@name# and my contact number is #@phone number#

Korean: #@전번#이요 현재 공무원들 점심 시간이 한 시까지여서요
English: #@This is my number#. Currently, civil servants have lunch until 1 o'clock.

Korean: 한 시 이후에 혹시 연락을 드려도 괜찮으시겠습니까 선생님
English: Would it be okay if I contact you after one o'clock, sir?

Korean: 네 그렇게 해 주셔도 됩니다 여기 전화 받은 데가 #@소속#이잖아요
English: Yes, you can do that. The place I received the call from is #@affiliation#.
Yes, that's right, you called #@Affiliation#

Korean: 저희 군에서 제일 큰 정부 조직이 뭐죠
English: What is the largest government organization in our military?
The biggest organization is the county office, sir.

Korean: 그러시면 제가 군청 대표 번호로 연결을 해 드리겠습니다 선생님
English: Then I will connect you to the county office representative number.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 고맙습니다 전화는 또 주시겠어요
English: Okay, I understand. Thank you. Please call me again.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'll talk next.

Korean: 말씀대로 구비 서류 지참하시어 토지 관리과로 내방해 주시면 됩니다
English: As instructed, please bring the required documents and visit the Land Management Department.

Korean: 혹시 방문하면은 바로 발급이 되나요 아니면은 다른 경우가 있나요
English: If I visit, will it be issued immediately or are there other cases?

Korean: 네 방문 시 즉시 발급 가능하십니다
English: Yes, you can get it issued immediately upon your visit.
It can be issued immediately.

Korean: 혹시 우편이나 인터넷 같은 경우는 어느 정도 기간이 걸리죠
English: How long does it take for things like mail or the internet?

Korean: 우편 접수 시에는 저희 쪽에서 정확한 소요 기간은 확인이 어렵습니다
English: When receiving mail, it is difficult for us to confirm the exact time required.

Korean: 우편 접수 시엔 담당자분에게 문의를 해 보시는 게 좋으실 듯합니다
English: When receiving mail, it would be better to ask the person in charge.

Korean: 그래요 그럼 담당자 번호 좀 알 수 있을까요
English: Okay, then can I have the person in charge's number?

Korean: 네 제가 번호 안내해 드리겠습니다 메모 가능하십니까
English: Yes, I will give you the number. Can you take a note?
Yes, please tell me.
Your area code is #@phone number#

Korean: 그 인터넷 접수할려면은 어디로 들어가야 되는 거죠
English: Where do I go to sign up for the internet?

Korean: 네 #@기타# 부동산 정보 사이트에 접속을 해 주셔야 합니다
English: Yes, you need to access the #@Other# real estate information site.

Korean: #@기타# 부동산 그쪽 사이트 들어가서 신청을 하면 되는 건가요
English: #@Other# Can I apply by going to the real estate website?

Yes, I understand. Thank you.

English: Yes, thank you very much. Do you have any other questions?
No, not anymore

Korean: 네 업무 처리 잘 되시길 바랍니다 #@소속#였습니다
English: I hope your work goes well #@Affiliation#
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'll talk next.
Yes, thank you for waiting, teacher.

Korean: 확인해 보니 도청으로 방문을 해 주셔야 되는 부분으로 확인됩니다
English: After checking, I found out that you need to visit the wiretapping office.
Yes, you can do it by going to the wiretapping office.

Korean: 네 방문 접수 구비 서류 좀 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: Yes, I will give you some information on the documents required for your visit.
Yes, please tell me the required documents.

Korean: 방문 접수하실 시에는 #@소속# 토지 관리과로 방문해 주셔야 합니다

And you will need identification when you visit.
This is a changed name ID card.

Korean: 네 신분증과 반명함 사진 한 장 그리고 수수료 팔백 원이 필요합니다
English: Yes, I need your ID, a half-card photo, and a fee of 800 won.
Yes, a photo of your business card and a fee.

Korean: 네 그리고 재발급 신청서는 토지 관리과에 비치되어 있습니다
English: Yes, and the reissue application form is available at the Land Management Department.

Korean: 신청서 내방 하시고 작성 하시면 됩니다
English: You can come to the application center and fill it out.

Korean: 주민 등록 초본 한 장도 준비를 해 주셔야 합니다
English: You must also prepare a copy of your resident registration certificate.

Korean: 주민 등록 초본이요 이렇게만 있으면 되나요
English: Is this all I need for my resident registration copy?

Korean: 네 확인해 안내해 드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려 주시겠습니까
English: Yes, I will check and guide you. Could you please wait a moment?
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'll talk next.

Korean: 장애인 복지과에 문의 후 연결해 드리겠습니다
English: I will connect you after contacting the Department of Welfare for the Disabled.
Yes, please connect me, counselor.

I contacted the Department of Welfare for the Disabled

Korean: 네 확인해서 안내해 드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려 주시겠습니까

Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 제가 팀으로 문의 후 선생님께 전화를 드리겠습니다

Korean: 네 확인해 안내해 드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려 주시겠습니까

Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

#@Affiliation# There is a free legal consultation center run by the industrial complex.

Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 제가 구비서류 안내해 드리기 전에 한 가지 여쭤보겠습니다
English: Before I guide you through the required documents, I would like to ask you one thing.
Is the region you first received the grant from #@affiliation#?
Yes, #@affiliation# is correct

Korean: 네 선생님 그리고 실례지만 재발급 사유를 여쭤봐도 되겠습니까
English: Yes, sir, and may I ask you the reason for the reissue?
I'm trying to work as a caregiver, but I lost my license.

Korean: 분실이시군요 제가 구비서류 안내 해 드리겠습니다
English: I see you lost it. I will guide you through the required documents.
Yes, please guide me.

Korean: 접수 방법으로는 방문 접수와 우편 접수가 있습니다
English: There are two methods of application: in person application and mail application.
How can I guide you?
I would like to request that you submit it by mail.

Korean: 네 우편 접수 구비서류 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: Yes, I will guide you through the required documents for mail reception.
Yes, please do so.

Korean: 네 선생님 먼저 신분증과 재발급 신청서가 필요하시고요
English: Yes, sir, first I need your ID and a reissue application form.

Korean: 신청서 양식은 #@소속# 홈페이지 민원서식에서 다운로드 가능하십니다
English: The application form can be downloaded from the civil complaint form on the #@affiliation# website.
Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?

Korean: 제가 딸아이 여권을 만들고 싶어서요 어떤 게 필요하죠
English: I want to make a passport for my daughter. What do I need?

Korean: 먼저 법적대리인 친권자가 신분증 지참하여 방문해 주셔야 하고요
English: First, the legal representative or parent must visit with an ID card.

Korean: 신청서는 방문하셔서 작성을 해 주시면 됩니다
English: You can fill out the application form by visiting us.

Korean: 그리고 최근 육 개월 이내 촬영한 여권용 사진 두 매가 필요합니다
English: And you will need two passport photos taken within the last six months.

Korean: 사진은 여유분 준비해 주시면 원활한 업무 처리가 가능하고요
English: If you prepare some extra photos, we can process your work more smoothly.

Korean: 아이의 영어명이 필요하고 등록기준지 주소 확인이 필요합니다
English: We need your child's English name and proof of address for registration.
You don't need a family relationship certificate or anything like that.

Korean: 네 주소만 확인해서 방문해 주시면 됩니다
English: Just check your address and come visit us.
Fees vary depending on the child's age.

Korean: 혹시 자녀 분이 몇 세 아동이십니까
English: How old is your child?

Korean: 팔 세요 초등학교 일 학년인데 팔 세로 들어가나요
English: I'm in the first grade of elementary school. Can I get 8 inches?
Or do you only go to six?

Korean: 생일에 따라 달라질 수 있는데 혹시 몇 년생일까요
English: It may depend on your birthday, but what year are you born in?
#@Identity# Please confirm with this
Yes, I will check.

Korean: 선생님 팔 세 미만으로 확인되며 팔 세 미만인 경우에는요
English: Teacher, if you are under 8 years old, please confirm that you are under 8 years old.

Korean: 삼십 팔 면은 삼만 삼천 원이고 이십 사 면은 삼만 원입니다
English: Thirty-eight sides are thirty-three thousand won, and twenty-four sides are thirty thousand won.

Korean: 그리고 일 년에 한 번 사용 가능한 단수 여권은 이만 원입니다
English: And a single-entry passport that can be used once a year costs this much
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Do you have any other questions?
Yes, it's okay, thank you
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 네 여권 재발급을 받으려고요 방문처를 알고 싶어요
English: I would like to get my passport reissued. I would like to know where to go.

Korean: 찾아보니 매포에서는 #@소속# 도청 가는 걸로 나오더라고요
English: I looked it up and it says that the store is going to #@affiliation# wiretapping

Korean: 네 맞습니다 군청 또는 도청으로 방문하시면 됩니다
English: Yes, that's right. You can visit the county or provincial government offices.

Korean: 그러면 매포 신도시는 둘 중 어디로 가면 될까요
English: Then, which of the two should Maepo New Towns go to?
Yes, you can visit the wiretapping office.
The wiretapping is in the store, right?
Yes, that's right, teacher.

Korean: 그럼 몇 층인지 위치 좀 알 수 있을까요
English: Then, can you tell me which floor it is?

Korean: 본관 일 층 안내데스크로 방문하시면 됩니다
English: Please visit the information desk on the first floor of the main building.

Korean: 그러면 여기 나와 있는 민원실은 그 업무를 볼 수가 없는 거죠
English: Then, the civil affairs office listed here cannot handle that work.

Korean: 네 민원실은 어렵고 도청으로 방문해 주셔야 합니다
English: Yes, the civil affairs office is difficult, so you have to visit the city hall.
Then let me ask you one more question.
Yes, please tell me

Korean: 여권 발급하는데 여권 사진도 다시 찍을 수 있는 공간이 있나요
English: Is there a place where I can take a new passport photo when issuing a passport?
Yes, you can take pictures, sir.
Yes, I understand. Thank you for your guidance.

Korean: 선생님 기간이 남은 여권과 신분증도 꼭 지참해 주셔야 합니다
English: Teacher, please make sure to bring your passport and ID card with you.

Korean: 혹시 자녀 것을 처음 발급받는데 자녀는 따로 뭐가 있나요
English: If this is your first time receiving something for your child, is there anything special for children?
I will guide you through the documents, sir.
Yes, thank you. Please tell me.
Instead, I received #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Yeah, what's going on?
Excuse me, but isn't #@Name# in charge?

Korean: 지금 타 부서 업무 회의 들어갔는데 메모 필요하신가요
English: I'm in a meeting with another department right now. Do you need notes?
Yes, please pass on the note.
Yes, please tell me.

Korean: 민원인께서 종합 건설업 등록 문의하셨고 담당자 연락 부탁하셨습니다
English: The petitioner inquired about registering a general construction business and asked to be contacted by the person in charge.
I will tell you the complainant's phone number. It is #@phone number#.
I'll check #@Phone#, is it correct?
Yes, that number is correct
What is the name of the complainant?
#@Name# is here. Do you need anything else?
No, I don't need anything else
Yes, please pass it on. Thank you for your hard work.
Yes, hello, this is #@Affiliation# #@Name#
This is #@Affiliation# #@Name# who contacted you a little while ago.
Yes, what kind of work is this that is causing you to contact me?

Korean: 방금 통화에서 담당 주무관님께서 부재중이신 부분 전달받았고요
English: I just got a call from the person in charge saying he was out of the office.
We have informed the complainant of the matter.

Korean: 민원님께서 담당자가 연락 관련 메모 전달을 부탁하셨는데요
English: The person in charge requested that the complainant deliver a note regarding contact.
Could you please take a note?
Yes, please call me right away.
Your name is #@Name# and your phone number is #@Phone#

Korean: 문의사항은 장애인 기업 등록 업무 문의였습니다
English: The inquiry was about registering a business for the disabled.
Okay, I understand. I'll pass it on to you.
Yes, thank you. Have a nice day.
Hello, this is #@affiliation#. How may I help you?
Hello, I am from #@affiliation#. The person filing the complaint is looking for the person in charge.
Yes, what's going on?
When will you be able to speak to the manager?

Korean: 지금 잠시 나가셨는데 아마 십오 분 정도면 될 것 같습니다
English: He's gone out for a moment now, but I think it'll take about fifteen minutes.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 민원인께 연결이 지연된다고 전달하겠습니다
English: Okay, I understand. I will inform the complainant that the connection is delayed.

Korean: 여보세요 주무관님이 다른 전화를 해결하는 중이여서요
English: Hello, the manager is currently handling another call.

Korean: 민원인께 일이 지연된다고 말하고 담당자님 연락처를 전달하겠습니다
English: I will tell the complainant that the work is delayed and give him/her the contact information of the person in charge.
Your supervisor's phone number is #@phone#
Excuse me, but could you tell me your name as well?
#@Name# This is the chief officer. Is it okay?

Korean: 네 민원인께 해당 내용이 적힌 메모 전달하겠습니다
English: Yes, I will forward a note containing the relevant information to the complainant.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Thank you for your guidance, it was helpful
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
Please connect to #@affiliation#
#@Affiliation# has #@Affiliation#. What kind of work do you do?

Korean: 예 장애인 기업을 등록 하려고 하는데요
English: Yes, I'm trying to register a disabled person's business.

Korean: 장애인 기업 등록 업무 관련 담당자 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: We will provide guidance after confirming with the person in charge of registration of disabled business.
Could you please wait a moment?

Korean: 죄송하지만 현재 #@소속#에 관련 업무 담당자 확인이 어렵습니다
English: Sorry, but it is currently difficult to confirm the person in charge of the relevant work at #@Affiliation#

Korean: 지원 담당자만 확인되는데 제가 문의 후에 연결하겠습니다
English: Only the support person can check, but I will connect after I inquire.
Hello, I am a counselor from #@affiliation#
Yes, how did you confirm it?

Korean: 민원님께서 장애인 기업으로 등록 관련 연결 요청 하셨잖아요
English: You requested a connection regarding registration as a disabled person's business.

Korean: 네 제가 알아봐 달라고 했죠 무슨 일이 있나요
English: Yeah I asked you to find out what's going on.

Korean: 해당 담당자가 자리를 비워서 연결이 지연되고 있습니다
English: The person in charge is away, so there is a delay in connecting.
I see, that could be the case.
Hello, I am #@Affiliation#Counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?
Yes, I am the president of #@name#

Korean: 네 확인 감사합니다 실례지만 어떤 법인이십니까
English: Yes, thank you for checking. Excuse me, what corporation are you?

Korean: 저희 설치 장비 제작하는 제조 회사예요
English: We are a manufacturing company that manufactures our installation equipment.
Are you construction equipment?
No, it's a display device.
Yes, thank you for your confirmation, sir.

Korean: 제가 도청 부서로 확인 후 선생님께 전화를 드리겠습니다
English: I will check with the wiretapping department and call you back.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.

Korean: 네 저도 감사합니다 다른 문의 사항 있으십니까
English: Yes, thank you too. Do you have any other questions?
No, there is no more

Korean: 네 업무 처리 잘 되시기 바랍니다 #@소속# #@이름#였습니다
English: I hope your work goes well #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Nice to meet you. I am #@Affiliation# #@Name#. How may I help you?
Thank you for your hard work. I called to ask you something.

Korean: 저희는 지금 충북 아산에 있는 법인이고요
English: We are a corporation currently located in Asan, Chungcheongbuk-do.

Korean: 저희가 사원 복지 차원에서 사택을 지으려고 하는데요
English: We are planning to build a house for our employees' welfare.

Korean: 근데 주택조합 관련된 행정 절차를 알고 싶어서 연락 드렸어요
English: But I contacted you because I wanted to know about the administrative procedures related to housing cooperatives.

Korean: 네 선생님 아산에 있는 법인이시고 사원 복지 차원으로요
English: Yes, sir, it is a corporation located in Asan and it is for employee welfare.

Korean: 사택을 건립하려 하시는데 주택조합 부분의 행정절차 문의이십니까
English: Are you planning to build a house and have questions about the administrative procedures for the housing cooperative?
Yes, that's right, I have a question for you.
Excuse me, but have you tried contacting #@affiliation#?
No, I called you first here at #@Affiliation#

Korean: 그러시면 제가 부서 확인 후 선생님께 전화를 드리도록 하겠습니다
English: Then I will check with the department and call you back.

Korean: 네 제 핸드폰 번호 남겨도 될까요
English: Yes, can I leave my cell phone number?
Yes, teacher, please tell me what you want to say.
Yes, #@phone number# is fine.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
Yes, I would like to ask you about your move-in report.

Korean: 네 전입신고 관련 말씀이십니까 필요한 것들을 말씀드리겠습니다
English: Yes, are you talking about the move-in report? I will tell you what is required.
Yeah what do you need
First of all, you need your teacher's personal stamp.
Any of my stamps are fine
Any personal stamp is possible
That's different from a seal stamp.
Yes, that's right, teacher.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 더 다른 건 없나요
English: Okay, I understand. Is there anything else?
And if you report a change of address, your household will be separated.
So, are there any problems that arise?

Korean: 예를 들어서 지금 부모님께서 다 퇴임하셨는데요
English: For example, my parents are both retired now.
I don't know how health insurance works

Korean: 같이 거주해야지만 의료보험 혜택이 적용되는 건 아니죠
English: You don't have to live together to get health insurance benefits.
For inquiries regarding health insurance benefits, please contact #@affiliation#
Okay, I understand.

Korean: 네 혹시 더 다른 문의사항 있으십니까
English: Yes, do you have any other questions?
No, it's okay, thank you
Yes, have a relaxing afternoon #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 네 전입신고랑 관련해서 몇 가지 여쭤보려고요
English: Yes, I have a few questions regarding your move-in report.

Korean: 제가 부모님이랑 같이 등록이 돼 있거든요
English: I am registered with my parents.

Korean: 그럼 전입 신고를 하면은 뭐가 달라지는 건가요
English: So what changes if I report my move?

Korean: 본인 명의로 전입 신고를 하시게 되는 부분 말씀하시는 거죠
English: Are you talking about the part where you report the move in your own name?

Korean: 혹시 혼자 거주하시고 세대주로 전입하는 부분이십니까
English: Are you living alone and moving in as the head of household?

Korean: 그런데 지금은 제가 회사 기숙사에 살아서요
English: But now I live in the company dormitory

Korean: 다른 사람 명의의 집인데 혹시 가능한가요
English: Is it possible to have a house in someone else's name?

Korean: 죄송하지만 기숙사로 전입 신고 관련해서 가능 여부는
English: I'm sorry, but I'm not sure if it's possible to report moving into the dormitory.

Korean: 해당 기숙사 관리자께 직접 문의를 해 보셔야 할 듯합니다
English: You may need to contact the dormitory manager directly.

Korean: 그렇군요 그럼 전입 신고는 주민등록증만 가져가서 하면 되나요
English: Okay, so can I just bring my resident registration card to report my move?

Korean: 선생님 본인이 직접 방문하실 경우 신분증 지참하셔야 합니다
English: If you visit in person, you must bring your ID.

Korean: 도장이 함께 필요한지 여부는 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: We will check and inform you whether a stamp is required.
Could you please wait a moment?
Yes, thank you. I'll wait.
Yes, thank you for waiting, teacher.

Korean: 세대주 본인이 직접 신청할 경우에는 신분증과 도장이 필요합니다
English: If the head of household applies in person, an ID card and seal are required.

Korean: 방문한 주소지에서 상이한 서류 지참을 원할 수 있어서요
English: Because the address you visit may require you to bring different documents.

Korean: 신고할 동주민센터에 전화상으로 한 번 더 문의하시고요
English: Please call the local community center you are reporting to and ask again.
Please visit us in person
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
I would like to inquire about reporting my move.
Yes, how can I help you?

Korean: 제가 인감등록을 하려고 하는데 원래 주소지는 서울이고요
English: I'm trying to register my seal, but my original address is in Seoul.

Korean: 현재는 회사 기숙사에서 살아서 지방에 내려와 있거든요
English: I'm currently living in a company dormitory in the countryside.

Korean: 근데 인감등록은 실제 거주지에서만 할 수 있다고 해서요
English: But they said that seal registration can only be done at the actual place of residence.

Korean: 혹시 주소지를 지금 기숙사로 변경해도 되는지 궁금하고요
English: I was wondering if I could change my address to the dormitory now.

Korean: 인감등록을 여기서 진행할 수 있는지도 알고 싶어서요
English: I also want to know if I can register my seal here.

Korean: 현재 계신 지역 거주지 동주민센터에 전입 신고를 하시면요
English: If you report your move to the local community center where you currently reside,
Seal registration is available in the area where the teacher is located.

Korean: 그럼 혹시 전입신고는 제가 지금 살고 있는 집 말고요
English: Then, should I report my change of address to a place other than the one I'm currently living in?
Can I do it nearby?
If the area you are moving to is #@Address#

Korean: 주소지 기준 #@소속# 에서 전입신고를 꼭 해 주셔야 하고요
English: You must report your change of address at #@Affiliation#
You can also register your seal at a nearby address #@affiliation#
Okay, thank you for the guidance.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
Yes, I would like to reissue my nursing assistant certificate.
First, go to the #@affiliation# homepage and fill out the complaint form.
Download the reissue application form

Korean: 신청서 빈 곳에 받으실 주소와 전화번호 기재하시면 되십니다
English: Please write your address and phone number in the blank space on the application form.

Korean: 그리고 같이 동봉해 주실 서류로는 신분증 사본 한 부가 있고요
English: And the documents you need to enclose are a copy of your ID.

Korean: 반명함 사진 한 장이 있고 재발급 비용과 등기료가 있습니다
English: There is one photo of the business card and there is a reissue fee and registration fee.

Korean: 재발급 비용 이천 원 등기료는 이천오십 원으로 총 사천오십 원입니다
English: The reissue fee is 2,000 won and the registration fee is 2,500 won, so the total is 4,500 won.

Korean: 비용은 우체국 방문하셔서 통상 환으로 교환해서 보내 주시면 됩니다
English: You can exchange the money for cash by visiting the post office and sending it to us.
Where should I send this?
You can send it to #@affiliation# via the post office.

Korean: 그러면 민원실 가서 신청서 양식을 갖다가 쓰고요
English: Then, go to the civil affairs office and fill out the application form.
