Korean: 등기로 하셔도 되고 일반우편으로 하셔도 됩니다
English: You can send it by registered mail or regular mail.
Yes, I understand. Thank you for your hard work.

Korean: 네 감사합니다 선생님 행복한 하루 보내세요
English: Yes, thank you, teacher. Have a nice day.
Hello, I am a counselor from #@Affiliation# Counseling Center #@Name#

Korean: 안녕하세요 담배 수입업 신고 절차가 어떻게 되나요
English: Hello, what is the procedure for reporting a cigarette import business?
Yes, teacher, have you prepared all the documents?

Korean: 네 홈페이지에 서류 나와있는 거 준비는 다 했어요
English: Yes, I have prepared all the documents listed on your homepage.

Korean: 서류는 있는데 직접 가서 접수 하나요
English: I have the documents, but should I go and submit them in person?
Yes, you can visit the teacher in person.

Korean: 만약 시간이 안되시면 우편으로도 접수하실 수 있습니다
English: If you don't have time, you can also apply by mail.

Korean: 네 그러면 접수 후 처리기간은 얼마나 걸리나요
English: Yes, then how long does it take to process after application?

Korean: 지금 접수일 기준 약 오일 정도 보시면 됩니다
English: As of the date of application, you can expect about five days.
Yes, you can wait about a week.

Korean: 네 선생님 주말이 겹치면 일주일 정도로 보시면 될 것 같습니다
English: Yes, teacher, if it overlaps with the weekend, I think you can think of it as about a week.
Okay, I understand. I'll have it mailed to you.
Yes, sir, do you have any other questions?
No, there isn't. Thank you for your hard work.

Korean: 추가 문의 사항 언제든지 연락 주세요 감사합니다
English: Please feel free to contact us with any further questions. Thank you.
This is Citizen Happiness Partner Counselor #@Name#

Korean: 안녕하세요 어린이 놀이시설 문의 하려고 하는데요
English: Hello, I would like to inquire about children's play facilities.

Korean: 네 선생님 놀이시설 관련 어떤 문의 이실까요
English: Yes, teacher, do you have any questions about the playground?
I'm curious about how safety training is being conducted.
Yes, are you the person in charge of the organization?
No, I am a parent.

Korean: 네 그러시군요 안전교육 주기는 이년에 한번 이상 진행되고요
English: Yes, that's right. The safety training cycle is conducted at least once every two years.
The training time is more than four hours.

Korean: 그럼 혹시 내용은 어떤 것을 교육 하나요
English: Then what kind of content do you teach?

Korean: 어린이놀이시설 안전관리에 관한 지식과 실무를 교육합니다
English: We provide knowledge and practice on safety management of children's play facilities.
Then there is a separate training manager.

Korean: 네 물론입니다 안전관리자가 별도로 자리하고 있습니다
English: Yes, of course, there is a separate safety manager.

Korean: 그렇다면 안심이네요 워낙 안전 사고가 많아서요
English: Well then, that's reassuring, because there are so many safety accidents.

Korean: 네 충분히 이해합니다 더욱 철저히 교육 하겠습니다
English: Yes, I understand. I will educate you more thoroughly.
Yes, thank you for your explanation, you are busy.

Korean: 네 선생님 좋은 오후 보내시기 바랍니다 감사합니다
English: Yes sir, have a nice afternoon thank you
This is a #@affiliation# consultation with the sea.
Thank you for your hard work. I am planning to undergo a ship security inspection.
Yes, sir, is this an inquiry regarding ship security inspection?
Yes, and I also want to get a ship security certificate.
Okay, I'll guide you through the process.
First, the general security officer and the ship security officer will receive training.
Conduct an on-site security assessment of the ship and prepare a ship security assessment report.

Korean: 취약 부분을 보완한 후 선박보안계획서를 작성하셔야 합니다
English: After remediating the vulnerable areas, you must prepare a ship security plan.
Please submit the plan to #@affiliation#

Korean: 이렇게만 접수하면 선박보안증서까지 교부 받을 수 있나요
English: If I just apply like this, can I get a ship security certificate?

Korean: 접수 후 승인 전이라도 임시보안심사과 보안증서 교부 가능합니다
English: Even after application, a temporary security review and security certificate can be issued before approval.

Korean: 교부 후 삼개월정도 보안활동을 하고 내부 심사가 시행 되고요
English: After the granting, security activities are carried out for approximately three months and an internal audit is conducted.
Lastly, you can apply for the initial ship security inspection.

Korean: 그럼 유효기간 오년의 선박보안증서를 교부 받을 수 있습니다
English: Then, you can receive a ship security certificate with a validity period of five years.
It's a lot more difficult than I thought.

Korean: 네 아무래도 안전과 보안 관련 심사라 까다롭게 진행 됩니다
English: Yes, it will be a rigorous examination related to safety and security.

Korean: 죄송한데 문자로 한번 더 받아 볼 수 있을까요
English: Excuse me, can I have it sent to you again via text?
I will send a text message to the number you provided.
Yes, I just got it. Thank you.
I hope you get good results #@Affiliation# #@Name#
This is #@affiliation# counseling that brings happiness.

Korean: 선박 등기 등록 절차 문의 하고 싶은데요
English: I would like to inquire about the ship registration process.
Yes, sir, is this the right question about ship registration procedures?

Korean: 예 선박 등기와 등록 관련해서 선박법이나 선박 등기법으로요
English: Yes, regarding ship registration and registration, under the Ship Act or Ship Registration Act.
Yes, I will guide you through the ship registration process.
Just a moment, I'll make a note.

Korean: 네 먼저 #@소속#에 현장측정 등 선박총톤수 측정 해야 하고요
English: Yes, first, you need to measure the total tonnage of the ship by measuring the field at #@affiliation#.

Korean: 등기대상 선박은 등록 전에 관할등기소에서 등기 해야 합니다
English: Vessels subject to registration must be registered at the competent registration office prior to registration.
Do you have any separate documents?
I have a ship's gross tonnage measurement certificate and a copy of the ship's registration.
I have a copy of the corporate registration and a copy of the resident registration.

Korean: 신청 다 하고 나서 교부 받는 게 있을까요
English: Will I receive anything after I complete the application?

Korean: 서류 검토 후 선박국정증서를 교부하고 있습니다
English: After reviewing the documents, we issue a ship registration certificate.
It's not easy. First of all, thank you.

Korean: 네 도움이 되셨길 바랍니다 상담사 #@이름# 이였습니다
English: I hope this helps, this was your counselor #@name#
Nice to meet you, I am counselor #@Affiliation#, #@Name#

Korean: 혹시 화물 자동차 운수사업 사무실 허가 기준이 있나요
English: Are there any criteria for licensing a cargo truck transport business office?

Korean: 네 선생님 법인 운수회사 설립 관련 이십니까
English: Yes, sir, is this related to the establishment of a corporate transport company?

Korean: 예 아파트나 단독주택을 사무실로 사용해도 되나 해서요
English: Yes, I was wondering if I could use an apartment or a single-family home as an office.

Korean: 영업소에 대한 세부 면적은 정해져 있지 않습니다
English: The detailed area of the sales office is not set.

Korean: 그럼 건축에만 문제 없으면 괜찮다는 거죠
English: So, if there are no problems with the construction, then it's okay?

Korean: 네 무허가 건물 및 가설건축물도 어려우실 것 같고요
English: Yes, unlicensed buildings and temporary structures will also be difficult.

Korean: 단독주택도 인정이 불가할 것으로 판단 됩니다
English: It is judged that single-family homes will also not be recognized.
It's more complicated than I thought. It's like that legally.

Korean: 네 선생님 건축법 등의 관련 법령에 관한 것 입니다
English: Yes, sir, it is about the Building Act and other related laws.
Oh, I know it's a bit overwhelming.
Do you have any other questions?
No, there isn't. You can hang up.
Your counselor was #@name#
Nice to meet you, I am counselor #@Affiliation#, #@Name#

Korean: 제가 전남 광양에 제조업으로 사업자등록을 신청할건데요
English: I'm going to apply for business registration as a manufacturing business in Gwangyang, Jeollanam-do.

Korean: 혹시 제조업 사업장으로 따로 등록된 건축물이 있는지 해서요
English: I was wondering if there was a building registered separately as a manufacturing business.

Korean: 제조업 사업자 등록가능 요건 문의 사항 맞으십니까
English: Are you sure you have the right questions about the requirements for registering as a manufacturing business?
Yes, you could see it that way.

Korean: 네 제조업 사업장의 범위 말씀 드리겠습니다
English: Let me tell you the scope of your manufacturing business.
It should be a place where the final product is completed.

Korean: 하지만 제품 포장과 용기에 충전만 하는 장소는 제외 됩니다
English: However, this excludes places where only product packaging and containers are filled.

Korean: 그럼 혹시 관련 세무서도 알 수 있을까요
English: Then, can you tell me the relevant tax office?
#@Affiliation# Tax Office and location is near #@Address#
I'm sorry, but I don't know the contact information for the person in charge.
Yes sir, I am investigator #@name# and my number is #@phone#
Yes, thank you very much
I am more grateful to the counselor #@name#
Hello, I am counselor #@Affiliation#, #@Name#
Hello, I would like to inquire about environmental impact assessment.

Korean: 네 선생님 환경영향평가 어떤 문의 이십니까
English: Yes, sir, what is your question about the environmental impact assessment?
Yes, I would like to ask about the omission of the re-negotiation.
Teacher, are you sure about the environmental protection and re-negotiation regulations?

Korean: 맞아요 규정 내용을 좀 알고 싶어서요
English: Yes, I would like to know the details of the regulations.

Korean: 사업자는 주변 여건 변화가 경미하다는 입증자료를 제시해야 합니다
English: The business operator must provide evidence that the change in surrounding conditions is minor.

Korean: 그럼 협의기관의 장이 검토하고 판단하게 되고요
English: Then, the head of the consultative body will review and decide.

Korean: 이를 통하여 재협의를 생략할 수 있을 것으로 확인 됩니다
English: It is confirmed that this will allow us to omit renegotiation.
Is this a legal regulation?

Korean: 네 맞습니다 환경영향평가법 제 삼십이조 제 일항 제 일호 입니다
English: Yes, that's right. It's Article 32, Paragraph 1, Item 1 of the Environmental Impact Assessment Act.

Korean: 담당 기관이나 부서가 어딘지 알 수 있나요
English: Can you tell me which agency or department is in charge?
#@Affiliation# Institution #@Affiliation# Department Teacher
Okay, that's the law.

Korean: 네 그렇습니다 혹시 다른 문의 더 있으신가요
English: Yes, that's right. Do you have any other questions?
No, not right now, thank you

Korean: 네 좋은 오후 되시기 바랍니다 감사합니다
English: Yes, good afternoon. Thank you.
I am an honest Korean counselor #@name#
Yes, I would like to report tax evasion.
I'm wondering where and how to report it.

Korean: 네 선생님 탈세 제보 신고 방법 문의 맞으십니까
English: Yes, sir, is this the right way to report tax evasion?
Yes, that's right, I want to know how.
You can report tax evasion in person or on the #@affiliation# website.
You can also contact #@Affiliation# #@Phone#
You can report in any convenient way.
So how is it handled?

Korean: 접수 후 과세에 활용할 지 세무조사에 착수할 지 판단 합니다
English: After receiving the information, we will decide whether to use it for taxation or initiate a tax investigation.
I see. It's good because it's systematic.

Korean: 네 지속적인 관심과 협조 부탁 드리겠습니다
English: Yes, I ask for your continued interest and cooperation.
Yes, I'll try the #@affiliation# site first.
Yes, thank you teacher

Korean: 민원 처리 잘 되시기 바랍니다 감사합니다
English: I hope your complaint is processed well. Thank you.
This is a consultation from the #@affiliation# responsible for the education of the citizens.

Korean: 해외 파견으로 아이 학년 배정 문의 하려고요
English: I would like to inquire about my child's grade placement due to overseas assignment.

Korean: 네 선생님 해외 출국은 여행 목적이십니까
English: Yes, teacher, is your overseas travel purpose?

Korean: 아니요 부모의 해외 파견 문제 입니다
English: No, it's a matter of parents sending their children overseas.

Korean: 혹시 해외 체류기간과 출국일은 언제 이십니까
English: By the way, when is your period of stay abroad and your departure date?

Korean: 한 이 삼년 정도 해외 근무 할 것 같고 연말에 나가요
English: I think I'll be working overseas for about three years and I'll be leaving at the end of the year.

Korean: 아이의 국제학교가 구월이 첫 학기라 공백이 생겨서요
English: My child's international school has its first semester in September, so there is a gap.
Yes, because it is a case of studying abroad with a government-approved certificate
There is no subject-by-subject credit evaluation.
So how is the allocation done?

Korean: 먼저 외국학교에서 국내외 재학 기간을 합산해서요
English: First, add up the period of study at a foreign school, both domestically and internationally.

Korean: 우리나라 학제인 십이 년제에 맞추어 학년 배정 합니다
English: Grades are assigned according to our country's twelve-year school system.

Korean: 그럼 만약에 공백 육개월 정도 생기면 어쩌죠
English: So what if there's a gap of about six months?

Korean: 국내 초등학교에 재취학 또는 편입학 시로 말씀 드립니다
English: I would like to inform you about re-enrollment or transfer to a domestic elementary school.

Korean: 해당국 간의 학제차이로 부족하다 판단 된다면요
English: If it is judged to be insufficient due to differences in academic systems between the countries concerned
It may be permitted at the discretion of the school principal.
That's a relief, thank you

Korean: 네 문의가 잘 해결 되셨길 바랍니다
English: I hope your inquiry has been resolved.
I was counselor #@name#
Warm education start counselor #@name#
Hello, are there any standards for outdoor activities in kindergartens?
Teacher, what criteria are you asking about?

Korean: 미세먼지 발생 시 유치원의 실외활동 취소 기준이 궁금해서요
English: I'm curious about the criteria for canceling outdoor activities at kindergartens when fine dust occurs.

Korean: 네 미세먼지 발생 시 실외활동 단계별 조치사항 맞으시죠
English: Yes, you are correct about the steps to take for outdoor activities when fine dust occurs.
Yes, that's right. How do you deal with it?

Korean: 먼저 나쁨일 경우 실외수업을 실내 활동으로 대체 합니다
English: First, if it is bad, replace outdoor classes with indoor activities.

Korean: 여기에는 체육활동과 바깥놀이 현장학습 모두 포함이고요
English: This includes both physical activities and field trips to outdoor play.

Korean: 주의 단계에서는 실외수업을 단축하거나 금지 하고 있습니다
English: During the caution phase, outdoor classes are being shortened or banned.

Korean: 갑자기 경보 울릴 때는 계속 진행 하나요
English: Do you continue when the alarm suddenly sounds?

Korean: 경보 단계 역시 단축 또는 금지 하고 있고요
English: The alert level is also being shortened or banned.

Korean: 수업시간과 등하원 시간을 조정하고 임시휴업도 검토합니다
English: We will adjust class times and school drop-off times and consider temporary closures.

Korean: 일단은 실외 수업을 모두 금지 한다는 거네요
English: First of all, all outdoor classes are banned.

Korean: 네 맞습니다 실내활동으로 대체하여 수업을 진행합니다
English: Yes, that's right. We will conduct classes by replacing them with indoor activities.

Korean: 요즘 미세먼지 때문에 걱정이 되서요 감사합니다
English: I'm worried about fine dust these days. Thank you.

Korean: 네 감사합니다 고객님 다른 문의 없으십니까
English: Yes, thank you. Do you have any other questions?
It's okay, everything is satisfied.
Thank you, I will finish the consultation.
I am #@Name#, a counselor at the center of warm education.

Korean: 안녕하세요 교원 연수 출장 처리 문의하려고요
English: Hello, I would like to inquire about processing a teacher training business trip.
Yes, teacher, what is it about?

Korean: 자발적 연수 시 교원에 대한 출장 처리가 가능한가요
English: Is it possible to process a business trip for teachers during voluntary training?
Yes, sir, I will check.

Korean: 먼저 공공기관에서 실시하는 연수에 참여한 교원에 대해서는요
English: First, regarding teachers who participated in training conducted by public institutions:

Korean: 소정의 출장비를 지급할 수 있도록 되어있습니다
English: It is possible to pay a certain amount of travel expenses.

Korean: 하지만 자기능력개발을 위한 것은 공무출장으로 보기 어렵습니다
English: However, it is difficult to view it as an official business trip for the purpose of developing one's own abilities.

Korean: 그럼 길게 연수를 받아도 연장근무 수당 같은 건 못 받는 거죠
English: Then, even if you receive long-term training, you won't receive overtime pay or anything like that.
Yes, sir

Korean: 연수와 근무시간을 초과하여도 시간외 근무수당 지급이 어렵습니다
English: It is difficult to pay overtime pay even if training and working hours are exceeded.
Okay, I understand. Thank you.
Do you have any other questions?
No, there isn't, it's okay

Korean: 네 오늘도 행복한 하루되시길 바랍니다 감사합니다
English: Yes, I hope you have a happy day today. Thank you.
Hello, this is #@affiliation# Operations Support Team. How may we help you?
Yes, hello, I am a #@guitar# middle school teacher.
This time, I have a schedule to visit #@affiliation#

Korean: 최근 코로나 때문에 방문이 제한된다고 하던데 맞나요
English: I heard that visits have been restricted recently due to the coronavirus. Is that true?

Korean: 네 현재 입구에서 발열체크 및 인증 절차 후 방문 가능하세요
English: Yes, you can visit after checking your temperature and going through the authentication process at the entrance.

Korean: 그러면 발열체크랑 본인인증만 하고 들어가면 되나요
English: Then, can I just go in after checking my temperature and verifying my identity?

Korean: 아니요 외부 방문인과 본청 직원 구분을 위해 확인절차를 거칩니다
English: No, we will go through a verification process to distinguish between outside visitors and head office staff.
How do visitors get verified?
Yes, there is a civil affairs office on the first floor of the #@affiliation# main building.

Korean: 거기에 선생님의 신분증을 맡기시고 방문증 받아주시면 되구요
English: You can leave your teacher's ID there and receive a visitor's pass.

Korean: 업무 보시고 나가실 때 신분증을 찾아가시면 됩니다
English: You can pick up your ID card when you leave work.

Korean: 특별히 확인절차를 강화한 건 아니네요 제가 얘기를 잘못 들었나봐요
English: I don't think there was any special strengthening of the verification process. I guess I misheard.

Korean: 아닙니다 저희도 코로나 확산 방지를 위해 조금 더 신경쓰겠습니다
English: No, we will also pay a little more attention to prevent the spread of Corona.
Do you have any other questions?

Korean: 아니요 다른 문의사항은 없고 오후 여섯시까지 하시는 거 맞죠
English: No, I have no other questions. You can do it by 6 p.m., right?
Yes, #@affiliation# is open until 6:00
Okay, I'll have to visit you before then. Thanks for your hard work.
Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. What brings you here?

Korean: 네 몇 가지 여쭤볼 게 있어서 전화드렸거든요
English: Yes, I called to ask you a few questions.
Yes, teacher, please speak comfortably.

Korean: 우선 이천이십일년 시설공사 예산단가가 어떻게 되나요
English: First of all, what is the budget unit price for the facility construction project in 2021?
For the budget price, please refer to the #@affiliation# website.

Korean: 기술자료 탑재실에서 정보 공개 하고 있습니다
English: Information is being disclosed in the technical data loading room.
Then what about the list of first-class citizens for the year 221?
You can also check that part on the #@affiliation# homepage.

Korean: 다 #@소속# 홈페이지에서 볼 수 있는 거에요
English: You can see it all on the #@affiliation# homepage

Korean: 그럼 #@소속#의 사월 주요시설 공사추진현황도 알 수 있나요
English: Then, can I also find out the status of the major facility construction of #@affiliation# in April?

Korean: 네 동일한 게시판에 정보 공개하고 있습니다
English: Yes, I am disclosing the information on the same bulletin board.
Okay, #@affiliation# What is the homepage address?
Yes, it's #@URL#. You can also search for #@affiliation# on the search portal.

Korean: 네 제가 한 번 들어가서 확인해볼게요 수고하세요
English: Yes, I will go in and check. Thank you.

Korean: 감사합니다 기쁨 가득한 하루 보내세요 상담사 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Thank you and have a wonderful day, counselor #@name#
This is #@affiliation# with citizens. How can we help you?

Korean: 대학생 멘토링 관련해서 문의드리려고 하는데요 여기다 말씀드려도 되나요
English: I would like to ask about college student mentoring. Can I ask here?

Korean: 네 대학생 멘토링 관련하여 어떤 문의십니까
English: Do you have any questions regarding college student mentoring?
I'm planning to apply for college student mentoring this time.
You are currently a college student and are participating as a mentor.

Korean: 네 맞아요 학교에서 공지를 봤는데 신청 방법은 안 나와있더라구요
English: Yes, that's right. I saw the notice at school, but it didn't say how to apply.

Korean: 공지가 다소 미흡했던 것 같습니다 죄송합니다
English: I'm sorry that the notice was somewhat lacking.

Korean: 현재 인터넷으로 신청 가능하신데 방법 안내해 드릴까요
English: You can currently apply online. Can you tell me how?
Yes, it is possible now. Can you tell me?
Yes, you can access the Ulsan After-School Support Center website.
The address is #@URL#. Did you connect by any chance?

Korean: 네 여기서 대학생 멘토링 누르면 되나요
English: Yes, can I click on college student mentoring here?

Korean: 네 대학생 멘토링 들어가시면 멘토링 정보방 있어요
English: If you go to the college student mentoring program, there is a mentoring information room.
You can check the contents there and apply.

Korean: 간단하게 신청할 수 있는 거였네요 제가 해보고 연락드릴걸 그랬네요
English: It was easy to apply. I should have tried it and contacted you.

Korean: 아니에요 조금 더 자세히 안내드리지 못한 것 같아요 감사합니다
English: No, I don't think I could have explained it in more detail. Thank you.
Do you have any other questions?
No, I have no other questions.

Korean: 네 많은 도움 되시길 바랍니다 #@소속# 이었습니다
English: Yes, I hope it helps a lot #@Affiliation#
This is #@affiliation# with citizens. How can we help you?

Korean: 네 제가 #@기타# 라는 진로프로그램이 있다는 얘기를 들었는데요
English: Yes, I heard that there is a career program called #@Other#

Korean: 그걸 학생이나 학부모가 개인적으로 신청할 수 있나요
English: Can students or parents apply for it individually?

Korean: 선생님 죄송합니다만 #@기타# 프로그램은 개인 신청은 어려우세요
English: I'm sorry, teacher, but it is difficult to apply for the #@Other# program individually.

Korean: 그러면 사람을 모아서 단체로 신청을 할 수는 있나요
English: Then, can we gather people and apply as a group?

Korean: 아니요 그렇게도 어려우시고 학교 단위로만 신청 가능합니다
English: No, it is not that difficult and you can only apply by school.

Korean: 학교에서 따로 아무 말도 없던데 그러면 못 하는 건가요
English: There was no separate statement at school, so does that mean I can't do it?

Korean: 저희가 각 학교별로 관련 내용을 전달하긴 했는데요
English: We did convey the relevant information to each school.

Korean: 학교마다 운영방침이 달라서 아직 공지가 안 됐을 수 있습니다
English: Each school has different operating policies, so it may not have been announced yet.

Korean: 그러면 #@소속# 통해서 학교에 신청할 수는 없어요
English: Then you can't apply to the school through #@affiliation#

Korean: 네 그건 조금 어려우시구요 학교에 진로전담교사가 있을 거에요
English: Yes, that's a little difficult. There will be a career guidance counselor at your school.

Korean: 그 분께 직접 문의를 해주시는 게 가장 좋으실 것 같아요
English: I think it would be best to ask him directly.

Korean: 진로전담교사요 그 명칭으로 담임선생님께 여쭤보면 아시겠죠
English: It's a career guidance teacher. If you ask your homeroom teacher about that name, you'll know.

Korean: 네 그건 #@소속# 산하 기관에 통용되는 명칭이에요
English: Yes, that is the name commonly used for #@affiliation# affiliated organizations.

Korean: 알겠습니다 그러면 학교 측에 한 번 문의드려볼게요 감사합니다
English: Okay, then I'll ask the school. Thank you.

Korean: 만족할만한 답변 드리지 못해 죄송합니다 다른 문의사항 있으신가요
English: I'm sorry I couldn't give you a satisfactory answer. Do you have any other questions?
No, I have no other questions. Thank you.
This is #@affiliation# with citizens. How can we help you?
Yes, I run a workshop at #@address#

Korean: 이번에 학생들에게 진로체험 활동을 제공하고 싶습니다
English: This time, I would like to provide career experience activities to students.

Korean: 따로 신청 절차가 별도로 있나요 있다면 안내 부탁드립니다
English: Is there a separate application process? If so, please let me know.

Korean: 선생님 우선 공방이 사업자등록이 되어 있으신가요
English: Teacher, first of all, is your workshop registered as a business?

Korean: 네 정상적으로 등록하고 영업하고 있는 공방이에요
English: Yes, it is a workshop that is registered and operating normally.

Korean: 그러시면 지금 바로 신청 방법 안내를 드릴까요
English: Then, shall I give you instructions on how to apply right now?
Yes, you can apply from your computer too.
Yes, please access the #@affiliation# site and connect to #@URL#

Korean: 네 지금 홈페이지에는 들어와 있거든요 여기서 어떻게 해야 하나요
English: Yes, I'm on the website now. What should I do from here?

Korean: 상단에 보시면 체험처 등록이 있구요 거기서 프로그램 등록 눌러주세요
English: If you look at the top, there is an experience registration page. Click on program registration there.

Korean: 네 프로그램 등록 들어왔는데 여기다가 내용 입력하면 되나요
English: Yes, I have registered for the program. Should I enter the information here?

Korean: 네 등록이 완료되면 관할 진로체험지원센터에서 확인해주실 거에요
English: Yes, once your registration is complete, the relevant career experience support center will confirm it.

Korean: 그러고 나면 학교에서 프로그램 신청을 하구요
English: Then, apply for the program at school.

Korean: 신청 승인이 되면 진로체험활동을 진행해주시면 되세요
English: Once your application is approved, you can proceed with the career experience activity.

Korean: 학교에서 신청하면 제가 승인을 하는 건가요
English: If I apply at school, will I get approval?

Korean: 아니요 관할 진로체험처나 진로체험지원센터에서 승인하게 됩니다
English: No, it will be approved by the relevant career experience center or career experience support center.

Korean: 천천히 사이트 둘러보시구요 다른 문의사항 있으신가요
English: Please take your time browsing the site and do you have any other questions?

Korean: 아니요 없어요 절차가 그렇게 복잡하지는 않네요 감사합니다
English: No, there isn't. The procedure isn't that complicated. Thank you.

Korean: 네 사이트 이용에 도움 되셨길 바랍니다 #@소속#이었습니다
English: I hope you found my site helpful #@Affiliation#
Hello, this is #@affiliation# with citizens. How can I help you?
Hello, I'm planning to use #@affiliation# with my friends this time.

Korean: 노래방 이용하려면 따로 예약을 해야 하나요
English: Do I need to make a separate reservation to use the karaoke room?

Korean: 안녕하세요 친구들이랑 이용하시려는 거세요 언제 이용하시게요
English: Hello, are you planning to use it with your friends? When will you use it?

Korean: 주말에 가려고 하는데 아마도 토요일날 갈 것 같아요
English: I'm planning to go this weekend, but I think I'll probably go on Saturday.

Korean: 네 일요일은 운영을 안해서 주말에 가시려면 토요일에 가셔야 해요
English: Yes, we are closed on Sundays, so if you want to go on the weekend, you have to go on Saturday.
If so, what time do you operate from?

Korean: 네 우선 노래방은 현장에서 접수하시고 이용하시면 되구요
English: Yes, first of all, you can register for the karaoke room on site and use it.

Korean: 주말이기 때문에 이용 인원이 많아 대기시간이 있을 수 있어요
English: Because it is the weekend, there may be a waiting time due to the large number of users.

Korean: 그리고 운영 시간은 오전 열시부터 오후 다섯시 삼십분입니다
English: And our operating hours are from 10am to 5:30pm.

Korean: 네 그러면 대기하는 동안 밑에 만화방에서 있어도 되나요
English: Okay, then can I stay in the comic book store below while I wait?

Korean: 아마도 현장에서 학생분 차례가 오면 안내를 해줄거거든요
English: Perhaps they will give guidance when it is the student's turn on the spot.
Something like a phone notification or #@affiliation# message

Korean: 그래서 휴대폰 확인만 잘해주시고 만화방 이용하셔도 될 것 같네요
English: So, I think you can just check your phone and use the comic book store.

Korean: 만화방도 똑같이 그냥 가서 신청하면 되나요
English: Can I just go to the comic book store and apply?

Korean: 네 현장 접수이고 운영시간도 같으니 편하게 이용하시면 되세요
English: Yes, it is on-site registration and the operating hours are the same, so you can use it conveniently.
Okay, thank you. I'll have fun.
Have a good time with your friends #@Affiliation#
Hello, I am #@Affiliation# Counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 예 안녕하세요 한 가지 여쭤보려고 하는데요
English: Yes, hello, I have a question.

Korean: 네 어떤 문의사항이십니까 자세히 말씀 부탁드립니다
English: Yes, what is your inquiry? Please explain in detail.

Korean: 현재 #@소속#의 건설공사 분야 포상금에 대해 여쭤보려는데요
English: I would like to ask about the current construction project award at #@Affiliation#
Do you have any system in place?

Korean: 네 #@소속# 건설공사 부실방지에 관한 조례가 마련되어 있구요
English: Yes, there is a bylaw regarding the prevention of defective construction work.

Korean: 조례에 의거하여 신고포상금 제도를 운여하고 있습니다
English: We operate a reporting reward system in accordance with the ordinance.
How much is the reward if you report it?
As of 221, the reporting reward is 2 million won.
Two million won. Okay, thank you.

Korean: 네 선생님 혹시 다른 문의사항 있으십니까
English: Yes, sir, do you have any other questions?

Korean: 아니요 다른 건 없구요 신고는 전화로 해도 되는 건가요
English: No, there is nothing else. Can I report it by phone?

Korean: 네 전화 상으로 충분하지 않을 경우 기관 방문해주셔야 합니다
English: If your phone call is not sufficient, you will need to visit the institution.
Okay, I'll think about it and call you back.

Korean: 네 추후에 전화주셔서 업무 협조 받으시길 바랍니다 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Yes, please call me later to ask for my cooperation. #@Name#
Hello, this is counselor #@Affiliation#, #@Name#. How may I help you?
Hello, we are holding a school management committee meeting this time.
Yes, are you a school faculty member?

Korean: 예 맞아요 근데 제가 이번에 처음 위원회를 담당하게 됐거든요
English: Yes, that's right, but this is my first time being in charge of a committee.

Korean: 아무튼 이번에 학교운영위원회 위원장과 부위원장을 선출해야 하는데
English: Anyway, this time we need to elect the school management committee chairman and vice chairman.

Korean: 교원위원의 투표권 여부가 어떻게 되는지 궁금해서요
English: I'm curious about whether or not the faculty members have voting rights.

Korean: 네 학교운영위원회 투표권 관련 문의시구요 교원위원이요
English: Yes, I have a question about voting rights for the school management committee and the faculty committee.

Korean: 제가 관련 내용 확인 후에 말씀드리도록 하겠습니다 잠시만 기다려주세요
English: I will check the relevant information and let you know. Please wait a moment.
Yes, he asked if the faculty committee also had voting rights.

Korean: 네 선생님 초중등교육법 시행령 제 오십구조 제 육항 확인했구요
English: Yes, teacher, I have checked Article 50, Section 6 of the Enforcement Decree of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act.
It is said that faculty members also have voting rights.

Korean: 다만 위원장 및 부위원장에 직접 선출될수는 없구요
English: However, they cannot be directly elected as chairman or vice chairman.

Korean: 교원위원이 아닌 위원 중 무기명투표로 선출하도록 규정되어 있습니다
English: It is stipulated that members other than faculty members be elected by anonymous vote.

Korean: 교원위원도 투표권 행사는 가능하고 직접 선출될 수는 없다는 거죠
English: Teachers' committee members can also vote, but they cannot be directly elected.

Korean: 맞습니다 그렇게 이해하시면 될 것 같습니다 다른 문의사항 있으세요
English: Yes, I think you can understand it that way. Do you have any other questions?

Korean: 알겠습니다 답변 감사해요 다른 문의사항은 없어요
English: Okay, thanks for the answer. I have no other questions.

Korean: 네 감사합니다 행복한 하루 보내세요 상담사 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Yes, thank you. Have a nice day. This was counselor #@name#
Hello, this is counselor #@Affiliation#, #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 안녕하세요 이번에 아파트 게시판에서 우리교육과정이란걸 봤는데요
English: Hello, I recently saw something called our education program on the apartment bulletin board.
Yes, teacher #@guitar# Is the curriculum correct?

Korean: 네 누리요 유치원 교육과정이라는데 그게 뭔가요
English: Yes, it's called Nuriyo Kindergarten Curriculum. What is that?

Korean: 네 #@기타# 교육과정은 만 삼세에서 오세 유아를 대상으로 하구요
English: Yes, the #@Other# curriculum is for children aged three to five.

Korean: 심심 건강과 조화로운 발달을 도와주는데 그 의의가 있습니다
English: Its significance lies in helping to promote healthy and harmonious development.

Korean: 궁극적으로는 민주시민 기초를 형성하는 것을 목적으로 하고 있어요
English: Ultimately, the goal is to form a foundation for democratic citizenship.

Korean: 그러면 무슨 정신교육 같은 걸 말하는 건가요
English: Then are you talking about some kind of mental education?

Korean: 아니요 그런 건 아니구요 표준교육과정이라고 이해해주시면 되세요
English: No, that's not it. Please understand it as a standard curriculum.

Korean: 그러면 어린이집이나 유치원 유아들 대상으로 하는 교육이에요
English: Then, it is education for children in daycare centers or kindergartens.

Korean: 맞습니다 유치원 교육과정과 어린이집 표준보육과정 통합 공통과정이에요
English: Yes, it is a common curriculum that integrates the kindergarten curriculum and the standard childcare curriculum for daycare centers.

Korean: 알겠습니다 이게 올해 처음 시행하는 건가요
English: Okay, is this the first time this is being done this year?

Korean: 아니요 만 오세 과정은 이천십이년 삼월부터 시행되었구요
English: No, the five-year course was implemented starting in March 2012.

Korean: 만 삼에서 사세 과정은 이천십삼년 삼월부터 시행되었습니다
English: The course of the three thousand and four thousand years was implemented from March 2013.

Korean: 네 말씀 감사합니다 우리 아이도 받고 있는건지 확인해봐야겠네요
English: Thank you for your advice. I'll have to check to see if my child is receiving it too.

Korean: 네 아마도 공통적으로 다 받고 있을 겁니다 다른 문의사항 있으세요
English: Yes, I think you all have it in common. Do you have any other questions?

Korean: 아니요 다른 건 없습니다 답변 고마워요 좋은 하루 되세요
English: No, nothing else. Thanks for the answer. Have a nice day.

Korean: 네 선생님께서도 행복 가득한 하루 되시길 바랍니다 감사합니다
English: Yes, I hope you have a happy day too, teacher. Thank you.
Hello, this is counselor #@Affiliation#, #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 예 제가 초등학생 아이를 키우고 있습니다
English: Yes, I am raising an elementary school child.
But I'm scared to send my child to school.

Korean: 네 선생님 어떤 부분으로 아이 통학에 어려움을 느끼시나요
English: Yes, teacher, what part of your child's commute to school do you find difficult?

Korean: 아니 동네에 통학 구역이 정해지지가 않았어요
English: No, there is no designated school district in the neighborhood.

Korean: 그래서 매번 아이 학교 보낼때마다 사고나지는 않을지 겁이 난다니까요
English: So every time I send my child to school, I'm afraid that something might happen.

Korean: 선생님 그러시면 혹시 근처 주민센터에 민원제기 해보셨나요
English: Teacher, if that's the case, have you tried filing a complaint at the local community center?

Korean: 여러차례 했죠 도저히 개선이 안 돼서 전화했거든요
English: I tried several times, but there was no improvement, so I called.

Korean: 근데 통학구역을 확정하는 절차가 별도로 있나요
English: But is there a separate procedure for determining the school district?

Korean: 네 통학구역은 초중등교육법 시행령 제 십육조에 의거하고 있구요
English: Yes, your school district is based on Article 16 of the Enforcement Decree of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act.

Korean: 학교 편제와 학생들 통학편의를 고려하여 결정하게 되어 있습니다
English: It is decided by considering the school organization and students' convenience in commuting.

Korean: 통상적으로 당해연도 십일월 말까지 관할 읍면동사무소로 통보하거든요
English: Normally, you should notify the local town/village office by the end of November of the year in question.

Korean: 그러면 결정이 되었어도 아직 통보가 안 됐겠네요
English: Then, even if the decision has been made, it hasn't been notified yet.

Korean: 네 아직은 의견 수렴도 완료되지 않으셨을 거여서요
English: Yes, I think you haven't even finished gathering opinions yet.

Korean: 그러면 그렇게 안내를 해줘야지 주민센터도 이상하네요 운영이
English: Then, you should provide guidance like that. The community center is also operating strangely.

Korean: 아무래도 혼선이 생겼던 부분이라 생각이 듭니다
English: I think this is where the confusion arose.

Korean: 조금만 더 기다려주시면 긍정적인 결과 받아보실 수 있으실 거에요
English: If you wait a little longer, you will see positive results.

Korean: 예 답변 감사합니다 조금 더 기다려볼게요
English: Yes, thank you for your answer. I will wait a little longer.
Yes thank you counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# Call Center #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 네 유아학비 지원 제도 신청하려고 하는데 신청대상이 어떻게 되요
English: Yes, I'm trying to apply for the childcare support program. Who are the application criteria?

Korean: 네 우선 이천이십일년 일월 일일 기준으로 말씀드릴게요
English: Yes, first of all, I will tell you based on the date of January 1, 2021.

Korean: 만 삼세에서 만 오세 아동은 3월부터 지원받을 수 있으시네요
English: Children between the ages of three and five can receive support starting in March.

Korean: 혹시 받을 수 있는 별도의 조건이 있나요
English: Are there any special conditions for receiving it?

Korean: 아니요 소득 수준에 관계없이 유치원 재원아동은 모두 대상입니다
English: No, all children enrolled in kindergarten are eligible, regardless of income level.

Korean: 감사합니다 혹시 그 외에 지원항목도 있나요
English: Thank you. Are there any other support items?

Korean: 네 방과후과정비나 저소득층 또는 다자녀 유아학비 추가지원이 있습니다
English: Yes, there is additional support for after-school program fees and tuition for low-income families or families with multiple children.

Korean: 방과후과정비는 누가 받을 수 있는 거에요
English: Who can receive after-school program fees?

Korean: 네 유아학비 지원대상자 중 방과후 과정 이용자 대상이구요
English: Yes, this is for those who are eligible for after-school program support.

Korean: 방과후 과정은 일일 교육과정 포함 여덟시간 이상 참여하셔야 합니다
English: After-school programs require participation for at least eight hours, including daily instruction.
Okay, thanks for the answer. Thanks for your hard work.

Korean: 네 혹시 유아학비 추가지원에 대한 안내는 필요 없으신가요
English: Yes, do you need any guidance on additional support for childcare expenses?

Korean: 네 저희는 해당사항이 없을 것 같아서요 수고하세요
English: Yes, I don't think that will apply to us. Thank you for your effort.
Thank you, I hope you have a great day #@Name#

Korean: 반갑습니다 따듯한 교육의 중심 #@소속#입니다 무엇을 도와드릴까요
English: Nice to meet you, this is #@affiliation#, the center of warm education. How can I help you?

Korean: 예 수고하십니더 우리 아이 전학 문제로 전화드렸는데예
English: Yes, I'm sorry for your hard work. I'm calling to tell you about my child's transfer issue.
Can I say it here?

Korean: 네 저희에게 문의사항 말씀해주시면 되세요 어떤 문의신가요
English: Yes, please let us know what you want to ask.

Korean: 지금 아이가 특성화고 재학중인데 일반고로 전학을 가고싶다 해서요
English: My child is currently attending a specialized high school, but he wants to transfer to a regular high school.

Korean: 자녀분이 특성화고 재학중이시라구요 학년이 어떻게 되나요
English: Your child is attending a specialized high school. What grade is he in?
Yes, I'm a first year student now. I entered school this year.

Korean: 네 그러시면 성적기준이 충족된다면 전학을 신청하실 수 있습니다
English: Yes, if you meet the academic criteria, you can apply for a transfer.
If so, is the procedure simple or complicated?

Korean: 아니요 학교장 추천을 받아서 신청해주시면 되구요
English: No, you can apply after receiving a recommendation from the school principal.

Korean: 실례가 안된다면 자녀분 내신 등급이 몇 등급인지 아시나요
English: If you don't mind, do you know what grade your child got?

Korean: 제가 알기로는 이 등급이라고 알고 있거든요 등급도 제한이 있습니꺼
English: As far as I know, this is the level. There are also limits to the level.

Korean: 네 신청대상이 삼 등급 이내시거든요 충분히 가능하시겠네요
English: Yes, if you are within the third grade, it is possible.

Korean: 우선 현재는 일학기 중이니 팔월 말까지 신청 가능하실 것 같아요
English: First of all, since it is currently the first semester, I think you can apply until the end of August.

Korean: 학교 측에 얘기하셔서 학교장 추첨배정 절차를 밟으시면 됩니다
English: You can talk to the school and go through the principal's lottery process.

Korean: 알겠습니다 그러면 학교랑 얘기하면 되는 거지예 고맙십니더
English: Okay, then you can talk to the school. Thank you.

Korean: 네 제가 더 감사합니다 따듯한 교육의 중심 #@소속#이었습니다
English: Yes, I am more grateful. It was the center of warm education #@affiliation#
Hello, I am #@affiliation#, the citizen happiness partner. How can I help you?

Korean: 네 이번에 저희 아들이 해외 유학 중 귀국하게 됐어요
English: Yes, this time my son returned to Korea after studying abroad.

Korean: 그래서 고등학교를 들어가야 하는데 편입학 절차를 알려주시겠어요
English: So I need to go to high school, can you tell me the transfer process?

Korean: 네 아드님께서 이번에 귀국하셨고 고등학교 편입하시려는 거죠
English: Your son came back to Korea this time and is planning to transfer to a high school.

Korean: 맞아요 일반 인문계로 편입학하고 싶은데 절차가 어떻게 되나요
English: Yes, I want to transfer to the general humanities department. What is the procedure?

Korean: 죄송하지만 귀국학생의 편입학은 #@소속#에서 담당하고 있지 않습니다
English: Sorry, but #@affiliation# is not in charge of transfer students returning from overseas.

Korean: 번거로우시겠지만 편입학 희망하시는 학교로 직접 문의 주셔야 합니다
English: Although it may be inconvenient, you should contact the school you wish to transfer to directly.

Korean: 그러면 저희가 원하는 학교에 요청을 드리면 되는 건가요
English: Then, can we just make a request to the school we want?

Korean: 네 요청하시면 학교장이 학칙에 따라 가능여부를 결정합니다
English: Yes, if you request, the principal will decide whether it is possible or not according to the school regulations.

Korean: 그러면 학교장이 몇 학년에 배정할지도 정해주시는 건가요
English: Then, does the principal decide which grade to assign the students to?

Korean: 아니요 학년배정은 외국 소재 정규 학교의 증명서가 있으셔야 하구요
English: No, you need a certificate from a regular school located abroad to be assigned a grade.

Korean: 성정증명서와 재학증명서를 토대로 우리나라 학제에 맞춰 배정됩니다
English: Based on the certificate of affiliation and certificate of attendance, the assignment will be made in accordance with the Korean educational system.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 증명서는 전 학년 거를 요구하나요
English: Yes, I understand. Do you require proof of previous school years?

Korean: 맞습니다 증명서 외에도 국내 최종학력증명서가 있으셔야 합니다
English: Yes, in addition to the certificate, you must also have a domestic final academic certificate.

Korean: 서류 및 절차와 관련된 자세한 문의사항은 #@URL#로 접속하셔서요
English: For detailed inquiries regarding documents and procedures, please contact #@URL#

Korean: 교육마당 게시판의 귀국학생 편입학에서 조회 가능하십니다
English: You can check it on the Education Yard bulletin board under Transfer students

Korean: 답변 감사합니다 홈페이지에도 한번 들어가 봐야겠네요 수고하세요
English: Thank you for your reply. I'll have to check out the website too. Thanks for your hard work.
Thank you, Citizen Happiness Partner Counselor #@Name#
Hello, this is #@affiliation# call center, bringing you joy.
I am counselor #@name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 저희 아이 전학문제로 상담을 좀 하려고 하는데 말씀드려도 될까요
English: Yes, I would like to ask for some advice regarding my child's transfer to another school. Can I talk to you?

Korean: 네 어떤 문제로 전학을 생각 중이신 건가요
English: Hey, what are you considering transferring for?

Korean: 아이가 학교생활에 적응을 못하는 것 같아요
English: I don't think my child is adjusting to school life.

Korean: 그래서 학교생활 부적응으로도 다른 고등학교 전학이 가능한지 해서요
English: So, I was wondering if it was possible to transfer to another high school even if I was not adjusting to school life.

Korean: 네 교육환경전환 전입학 제도를 통해 전학이 가능합니다
English: Yes, transfer is possible through the educational environment conversion transfer admission system.

Korean: 그 제도는 모든 학생들에게 가능한 건가요
English: Is that system available to all students?

Korean: 아니요 특정 사유가 있어 교육환경 변화가 필요한 학생들에 해당됩니다
English: No, this applies to students who need a change in educational environment for specific reasons.

Korean: 그러면 학교 생활 부적응도 그 사유에 포함된다는 말씀이시죠
English: So you're saying that maladjustment to school life is also a reason?

Korean: 네 맞습니다 혹시 자녀분께서 일반고에 재학중이신가요
English: Yes, that's right. Is your child currently attending a regular high school?
Yes, I'm studying general humanities.
In that case, you need to get a recommendation from the school principal.
#@Affiliation# You must be reviewed by the Admissions Committee

Korean: 여기에서 적합 판정을 받은 학생을 교육감이 다른 학교로 배정합니다
English: Here, the superintendent assigns students who are judged suitable to other schools.

Korean: 그럼 우선 아이 담임 선생님께 말씀드리면 되겠네요
English: Then, I guess I should talk to your child's homeroom teacher first.

Korean: 네 학교에 교육환경전환 전입학 제도 신청하시면 되십니다
English: Yes, you can apply for the transfer admission system for educational environment conversion at your school.
Okay, thank you so much for your answer. Thanks for your hard work.

Korean: 제가 더 감사합니다 행복한 하루 보내세요 상담사 #@이름#이었습니다
English: I am more grateful and have a happy day, counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Name#, a friendly counselor from #@Affiliation#
Hello, I'm contacting you because I have something to ask you.
Yes, what are you curious about?

Korean: 중학교 배정 관련 문의좀 드리려고 합니다
English: I would like to inquire about middle school placement.
Yes, please tell me what you are curious about.
We currently reside in Seoul at #@address#
My child is currently in the sixth grade.
Is your child currently in the sixth grade?

Korean: 네 그런데 저희가 현재 거구지는 #@주소# 에요
English: Yes, but our current address is #@address#
You are taking your child to school from far away. It must be hard.

Korean: 그래서 이번에 학교 근처로 이사를 할 예정인데요
English: So, I'm planning to move near the school this time.

Korean: 이사 하실 예정이신가요 학교 근처라면 #@주소# 쪽 말씀하시는건가요
English: Are you planning to move? If it's near the school, do you mean #@address#?

Korean: 예 중학교 입학 등록시기 이전에 이사를 하면 배정이 어떻게 되나요
English: Yes, what happens to the assignment if I move before the middle school admission registration period?
Yes, you are a student who is eligible for reassignment.

Korean: 삼 학교군에 속하는 경우 삼 학교군 내 중학교에 임시 배정 합니다
English: If you belong to a school district of three, you will be temporarily assigned to a middle school within the school district of three.

Korean: 실거주지 관할 교육지원청에 배정통지서를 교부하고 있습니다
English: The assignment notice is issued to the education support office in charge of the actual residence.
Okay, I understand. Thank you for the detailed answer.

Korean: 네 궁금하신 사항의 답변이 되셨기를 바라고요
English: Yes, I hope this answers your questions.
The weather is very cold, so take care of your health.
Hello, I am #@name# working at #@affiliation#.

Korean: 네 수고 많으십니다 여쭤볼게 있어서 전화드렸어요
English: Yes, thank you for your hard work. I called to ask you something.
Yes, what is the reason you are contacting us?

Korean: 저희 아이가 현재 서울에서 초등학교를 재학중인데요
English: My child is currently attending elementary school in Seoul.

Korean: 교실 내 공기정화 시설을 설치 해야 하지 않나 싶어서요
English: I was wondering if we should install air purification facilities in the classroom.

Korean: 예 그렇죠 요새 미세먼지들이 계절 상관없이 심각한 상황이죠
English: Yes, that's right. These days, fine dust is a serious problem regardless of the season.

Korean: 맞아요 유해한 환경에 놓여있는지 실내공기질 측정을 해 봐야 해요
English: Yes, you should measure indoor air quality to see if you are in a hazardous environment.
We also expect it to be very bad

Korean: 아이들의 교실 내 환경 개선을 위해 노력해주셔야 하는거 아닌가요
English: Shouldn't we be working to improve the classroom environment for children?

Korean: 예 현재 서울시 교육청에서 미세먼지 종합관리 대책을 마련했습니다
English: Yes, the Seoul Metropolitan Office of Education has currently prepared a comprehensive fine dust management plan.

Korean: 어떤 대책들이 있는데요 말씀 해주실 수 있나요
English: Can you tell me what countermeasures there are?

Korean: 예 우선 전문 인력으로 구성된 #@소속# 지원단을 운영할 예정입니다
English: Yes, first of all, we plan to operate a #@affiliation# support team comprised of professional personnel.

Korean: 또한 환경전문단체와 업무협약을 체결해 녹색운동을 펼칠 계획에 있습니다
English: We also plan to sign a business agreement with an environmental expert organization and carry out a green movement.
You must be working hard. Take it easy.
Okay, I understand. My questions have been answered.
Yes, have a nice day, this was counselor #@name#
Hello, this is counselor #@Name# from #@Affiliation#.
Yes, hello. I'm contacting you because I have an inquiry.
Yes, what is the reason you are contacting us?

Korean: 저희 건물 대지 안 피난 및 소화에 필요한 통로가 설치 되어야 하나요
English: Should we install evacuation and fire fighting passages within our building site?

Korean: 지금 여쭤보시는 사항이 고객님이 이용하시는 건축물에 화재가 나잖아요
English: The question you are asking now is about a fire in the building you are using.

Korean: 이용가능한 통로 및 피난 방법이 궁금하신게 맞으실까요
English: Are you curious about available routes and evacuation methods?

Korean: 네 제가 알기로 건축법상 필수라고 들었는데 되어있나 해서요
English: Yes, I heard that it is required by building code, so I was wondering if it is in place.

Korean: 네 우선 저희 #@소속#에 관심과 애정을 가져주신 점 감사드립니다
English: Yes, first of all, thank you for your interest and affection for our #@affiliation#
I will respond to your inquiry.

Korean: 건축법 시행령에 따르면 건축물 바깥쪽으로 주된 출구가 있어야 합니다
English: According to the Enforcement Decree of the Building Act, the main exit must be on the outside of the building.

Korean: 지상으로 통하는 피난계단 공지로 통하는 통로를 설치해야합니다
English: A passage leading to the fire escape notice leading to the ground level must be installed.
Is this what the law says?

Korean: 네 고객님 건축법상 모든 건물에 적용되는 내용입니다
English: Yes, sir, this applies to all buildings according to the building code.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Thank you. Please contact me if you have any questions.
#@Affiliation# Counselor #@Name# was
Hello, this is #@Name#, a friendly counselor from #@Affiliation#
Hello, I'm contacting you because I have something to ask you.
Yes, what are you curious about?

Korean: 중학교 배정 관련 문의좀 드리려고 합니다
English: I would like to inquire about middle school placement.
Yes, please tell me what you are curious about.
We currently reside in Seoul at #@address#
My child is currently in the sixth grade.
Is your child currently in the sixth grade?

Korean: 네 그런데 저희가 현재 거구지는 #@주소# 에요
English: Yes, but our current address is #@address#
You are taking your child to school from far away. It must be hard.

Korean: 그래서 이번에 학교 근처로 이사를 할 예정인데요
English: So, I'm planning to move near the school this time.

Korean: 이사 하실 예정이신가요 학교 근처라면 #@주소# 쪽 말씀하시는건가요
English: Are you planning to move? If it's near the school, do you mean #@address#?

Korean: 예 중학교 입학 등록시기 이전 이사 시 배정이 어떻게 되나요
English: Yes, what happens to the assignment if I move before the middle school admission registration period?
Yes, you are a student who is eligible for reassignment.

Korean: 그래서 3학교군에 속하는 경우 중학교에 임시 배정 합니다
English: So, if you belong to the 3rd school group, you will be temporarily assigned to a middle school.

Korean: 실거주지 관할 교육지원청에 재배정을 받을 수 있도록 교부하고 있습니다
English: We are providing the opportunity for reassignment to the local education office in charge of your actual residence.
Okay, I understand. Thank you for the detailed answer.

Korean: 네 궁금하신 사항의 답변이 되셨기를 바라고요
English: Yes, I hope this answers your questions.
The weather is very cold, so take care of your health.
Hello, this is #@Name#, a friendly counselor from #@Affiliation#
Hello, I'm contacting you because I have something to ask you.
Yes, what are you curious about?
I'm thinking of opening an academy.
You are opening a school. What are you curious about?

Korean: 예 개원시에 필요한 자격증이나 설비나 보험등이 따로 필요할까요
English: Yes, do I need any separate licenses, equipment, or insurance when opening a practice?

Korean: 음 우선 개원하실 학원의 시설과 규모에 따라 달라집니다
English: Well, first of all, it depends on the facilities and size of the academy you are opening.
Are you talking about the size of the academy?
Yes, and it also depends on the course.

Korean: 세부적인 사항은 저희가 안내문을 따로 보내드리겠습니다
English: We will send you a separate notice with detailed information.
Yes, please send me detailed instructions.

Korean: 네 고객님 핸드폰으로 안내드리는 페이지 들어가 보시면 나와있습니다
English: Yes, if you go to the page that we send you on your mobile phone, it will be there.
Yes, thank you for letting me know. I'll go in and check.

Korean: 네 궁금하신 사항의 답변이 되셨기를 바라고요
English: Yes, I hope this answers your questions.
The weather is very cold, so take care of your health.
Hello, this is #@Name#, a friendly counselor from #@Affiliation#
Hello, I'm contacting you because I have something to ask you.
Yes, what are you curious about?

Korean: 혹시 제 동생의 고등학교 생활기록부를 발급받을 수 있을까요
English: Could I possibly get my brother's high school transcript?
Are you talking about your younger sibling, not yourself?

Korean: 예 급하게 동생이 생기부를 발급받아야 하는데 시간이 안돼서요
English: Yes, my younger sibling needs to get his birth certificate issued urgently, but I don't have time.

Korean: 그러시면 대리인 제증명 발급 받으실 수 있는 제도가 있습니다
English: In that case, there is a system where you can receive a certificate of proxy.
Ah, is it possible to issue it even if it's not me?

Korean: 네 그러기 위해 구비하셔야할 서류가 몇가지 있습니다
English: Yes, there are some documents you need to prepare for that.
Yes, please tell me. I will prepare it and come to you.

Korean: 네 우선 위임장과 신분증 두매가 필요합니다
English: Yes, first of all, you need a power of attorney and two pieces of identification.

Korean: 여기서 신분증은 위임하는분과 위임받는분의 신분증을 말하는겁니다
English: Here, the identification refers to the identification of the person giving the authorization and the person receiving the authorization.

Korean: 그러면 제 신분증과 제 동생 신분증을 준비하면 되겠네요
English: Then I just need to prepare my ID and my brother's ID.

Korean: 예 그리고 그리고 위임하는 분의 도장도 필요합니다
English: Yes, and also, the stamp of the person giving the authorization is required.
You mean my brother's dojo?

Korean: 예 대리인님의 신분증과 가족관계증명서 준비해주시면 됩니다
English: Yes, please prepare your agent's ID and family relationship certificate.
Okay, I'll prepare the documents and go get them issued.

Korean: 네 궁금하신 사항의 답변이 되셨기를 바라고요
English: Yes, I hope this answers your questions.

Korean: 추가 문의 사항 언제든지 연락 주세요
English: Please contact us anytime for further inquiries
Hello, I am your friendly #@affiliation# counselor #@name#
Hello, I'm contacting you because I have something to ask you.
Yes, what are you curious about?
I have been working for over fourteen years.
Yes, you have been working there for a long time. What is the reason?

Korean: 예 장기 재직휴가를 쓰려 하는데 사용 가능 일수가 궁금합니다
English: Yes, I am planning to use my long-term leave, but I am curious about the number of days I can use.

Korean: 네 고객님 같은 경우 십년 이상 십팔년 미만 재직자에 해당되셔요
English: In your case, you are considered to have been employed for more than ten years but less than eighteen years.

Korean: 해당 재직자 분들은 해당 재직기간 중 십오일 휴가가 가능하십니다
English: The employees in question are entitled to fifteen days of vacation during their term of office.

Korean: 아 그럼 십 사년 이상 근무했을 경우에는요
English: Oh, then what if you worked for more than fourteen years?

Korean: 이십오년 이상 재직자 분들은 기간 중에 이십일 휴가가 허용됩니다
English: Employees with more than twenty-five years of service are allowed twenty days of vacation during their term.

Korean: 네 혹시 그럼 기간내 사용하지 못했을 시 휴일이 이월 되나요
English: Yes, if I don't use it within the period, will the holiday be carried over to the next period?

Korean: 죄송하지만 휴가를 사용하지 않았을 경우 해당 휴가는 소멸됩니다
English: Sorry, if you don't use your vacation time, it will be forfeited.

Korean: 네 알려주셔서 감사합니다 많은 도움이 됐습니다
English: Yes, thank you for letting me know. It helped me a lot.
I hope this answers your questions.

Korean: 추가 문의 사항 언제든지 연락 주세요
English: Please contact us anytime for further inquiries
Hello, this is #@Name#, a friendly counselor from #@Affiliation#
Hello, I'm contacting you because I have something to ask you.
Yes, what are you curious about?

Korean: 제가 원하는 부분은 비공개를 하는 방법이 없나요
English: Is there a way to make the part I want private?

Korean: 고객님 일부 정보를 비공개로 바꾸는 방법 말씀이세요
English: Can you tell me how to make some of your information private?

Korean: 네 아니면 공개에 불복시 이의신청 절차가 궁금합니다
English: Yes, or I am curious about the procedure for filing an objection if I am not satisfied with the disclosure

Korean: 예 우선 정보공개 이의신청 절차 알려드리겠습니다
English: Yes, first I will tell you about the procedure for filing an objection to information disclosure.

Korean: 이의신청은 결정 결과 통지 칠일 이내에 행정심판에 소송을 하면 됩니다
English: An objection can be filed by filing an administrative lawsuit within seven days of the decision.
I have to sue

Korean: 네 아니시면 행정 심판 결과에 불복하실 경우에는 적용되지 않습니다
English: No, if you do not agree with the result of the administrative review, it will not apply.

Korean: 아 이건 뭐 방법이 없는거나 다를 바 없네요
English: Ah, this is no different from there being no way.

Korean: 불편드려서 죄송합니다 현재 행정법 상 정보공개가 원칙이라서요
English: I apologize for the inconvenience. Currently, the principle under administrative law is to disclose information.
Oh, so that's not possible in principle.

Korean: 네 현재로서는 따로 소송을 통해서만 가능합니다
English: Yes, currently it is only possible through a separate lawsuit.

Korean: 그랬군요 알려주셔서 감사합니다 많은 도움이 됐습니다
English: I see, thanks for letting me know. That was very helpful.
I hope this answers your questions.

Korean: 추가 문의 사항 언제든지 연락 주세요
English: Please contact us anytime for further inquiries
Hello, I am a counselor from #@Affiliation# Counseling Center #@Name#
Yes, I have a question.
Yes, sir, please speak.
Yes, I lost my driver's license.
Are you inquiring about reissue application?

Korean: 예 근데 재발급 하면서 사진변경도 가능한지 궁금해서요
English: Yes, but I'm wondering if it's possible to change the photo when reissuing.
I'll change the photo and check.

Korean: 예 재발급시 신분증과 수수료 팔천 원을 준비해주시면 재발급 가능합니다
English: Yes, you can reissue it if you prepare your ID and the fee of 8,000 won.
Is it possible to bring those two?

Korean: 예 사진변경의 경우 예전 사진으로 변경은 불가능하세요
English: Yes, in case of photo change, it is not possible to change to a previous photo.
Then, is it possible to change it to only recent photos?

Korean: 네 육개월 이내 쵤영된 여권용 사이즈 사진 한 매 준비해오시면 됩니다
English: Yes, please prepare one passport-size photo taken within the last six months.

Korean: 예 그 두가지 지참해서 경찰서 민원실에서 변경 가능할까요
English: Yes, can I bring those two and change them at the police station's civil affairs office?

Korean: 예 가까운 경찰서 민원실이나 운전면서 시험장에서 변경 가능합니다
English: Yes, you can change it at the nearest police station's civil affairs office or at the driving test center.

Korean: 네 답변 감사합니다 많은 도움 되었습니다
English: Yes, thank you for your answer. It helped me a lot.
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Hello, I am a counselor from #@Affiliation@ #@Name#

Korean: 국유재산 사용허가를 받은 자가 사망하였을 경우 있잖아요
English: There are cases where a person who received permission to use national property dies.
I'm calling to inquire about the possibility of a blanket transfer of the license.

Korean: 예 국유재산을 사용허가 받으신 분이 부고하셨나요
English: Yes, did the person who received permission to use national property pass away?

Korean: 네 제 주변에 국유재산 사용허가를 받으셨던 분이 돌아가셔서요
English: Yes, someone around me who had received permission to use national property passed away.

Korean: 우선 사용허가를 받은 국유재산은 다시 사용 수익하게 할 수 없습니다
English: First of all, national property that has been granted a use permit cannot be used again for profit.
And succession of the license is also impossible.
Then is succession impossible?

Korean: 예 이전 권리자의 모든 권리나 의무를 일괄하여 승계하는 경우가 있죠
English: Yes, there are cases where all the rights and obligations of the previous right holder are inherited in bulk.

Korean: 민법 상의 포괄승계에 해당하는 경우 예외적으로 승계 가능합니다
English: Succession is possible exceptionally in cases that fall under the general succession under the Civil Act.
Is such a case possible as an exception?

Korean: 당초 사용 허가를 받은 분의 잔여기간 범위 내에서라는 조건은 있습니다
English: There is a condition that it is within the remaining period of the person who originally received permission to use it.
Oh, I see. Thank you.
No no have a nice day #@name# was
Yes, thank you for letting me know.
Good morning #@Affiliation# Counselor #@Name#
Yes hello, is this #@affiliation#?

Korean: 네 행복한 #@주소# 교육을 위해 함께 일하는 #@소속# 맞습니다
English: Yes, that's right, we are working together for your happy #@address# education.

Korean: 네 혹시 매교초등학교가 신설되도록 교육청에서 힘 써 주실 수 있나요
English: Yes, can the Office of Education help establish a new elementary school in Maegyo?
#@Address# Thank you for your interest in education.

Korean: 그 동안 #@주소# 초등학교 신설을 위해 많은 노력이 있었었는데요
English: During that time, there was a lot of effort to establish a new elementary school at #@Address#.

Korean: 재검토하게 되어 신설이 늦어지고 있는점 죄송합니다
English: We apologize for the delay in establishment due to re-examination.
Didn't it pass this time either?

Korean: 예 죄송합니다 학생들의 왕복 8차선의 대로횡단 공사차량들이 많아서요
English: Yes, sorry, there are a lot of construction vehicles crossing the 8-lane road for students.

Korean: 아 그 지역에 맞아요 엄청 큰 대로가 있었네요
English: Oh, that's right in that area. There was a huge street.

Korean: 네 원활한 배치를 위하여 학교의 재의뢰심사를 준비하고 있습니다
English: Yes, we are preparing for the school's re-review to ensure smooth placement.
Okay, I guess it'll be difficult to establish a new one this time too.

Korean: 네 아쉽게 조금 더 미뤄지게 되었습니다
English: Yes, unfortunately it has been delayed a little more.

Korean: 귀하의 질문에 만족스러운 답이 되었길 바랍니다
English: I hope this satisfactorily answers your question.

Korean: 학생의 행복한 성장을 위해 더욱 노력하는 #@소속#이 되겠습니다
English: We will become a #@affiliation# that works even harder for the happy growth of students.
Hello, I am a counselor from #@Affiliation# Counseling Center #@Name#

Korean: 고객님께서 작성 해주신 민원에 대한 검토 결과 알려드리려고 합니다
English: We would like to inform you of the results of our review of the complaint you submitted.
You said you were filing a complaint. Where are you?
We are #@affiliation#. Aren't you customer #@name#?

Korean: 아 네 저 맞습니다 예전이라 제가 기억을 못했네요
English: Oh yes, that's right. It was so long ago that I couldn't remember.

Korean: #@소속# 을 통해 신청하신 민원 검토 결과 알려드립니다
English: We will inform you of the results of the review of the complaint you submitted through #@affiliation#

Korean: 민원 내용이 요약하면 노후된 트랩과 구도심 재개발건으로 보이는데요
English: To summarize the complaint, it seems to be about old traps and downtown redevelopment.

Korean: #@주소#에 거주중인 분들이 이주 중인것으로 대책이 필요합니다
English: People living at #@Address# are moving, so countermeasures are needed.

Korean: 네 맞습니다 저희도 그래서 대책마련이 시급한데요
English: Yes, that's right. That's why we urgently need to come up with a solution.
This is something you guys also knew about.

Korean: 예 오년 간 저출산과 주력산업부진 등으로 인구감소추세입니다
English: Yes, the population has been decreasing for the past five years due to low birth rates and sluggish major industries.

Korean: 장기적으로 봤을 때 성장 잠재력을 약화 시킬 수 있다고 합니다
English: It is said that in the long term, it can weaken growth potential.

Korean: 그래서 트램을 조기 착공시키는것이 어떻겠냐는 민원을 제시 했었는데요
English: So, I made a petition suggesting that we start construction of the tram early.

Korean: 제안해주신 사항도 진작될 수 있도록 노력하고 있습니다
English: We are also working to promote the suggestions you have made.

Korean: 다만 트램의 경우 행정적 재정적 절차 등이 수반되어야 해서요
English: However, in the case of trams, administrative and financial procedures must be followed.

Korean: 저희 #@주소#의 의지와 달리 시민들께서는 느리게 체감될 수 있습니다
English: Contrary to our #@address#'s intentions, citizens may feel it slowly.
Yeah, I see. Those are long-term problems.

Korean: 관심주시는 분들 덕에 인구대책마련에 큰 도움이 될것으로 보입니다
English: Thanks to those who are interested, it seems like it will be a great help in preparing population measures.
Okay, then thank you for your hard work.

Korean: 네 감사합니다 더운 날씨 건강 조심하세요
English: Yes, thank you. Take care of your health in this hot weather.
Hello, this is counselor #@Name# from #@Affiliation#.
Yes, hello. I'm calling to ask you something.
Yes, what is the reason you are calling?

Korean: 복합자재 품질관리서와 단열재 품질관리서에 대한 판단 기준이 궁금해서요
English: I'm curious about the criteria for the composite material quality control certificate and the insulation material quality control certificate.
Are you talking about the quality control of composite materials and insulation?

Korean: 네 두가지 품질 관리서에 대한 판단 기준이요
English: Here are the criteria for judging the four quality control certificates.

Korean: 우선 복합자재들의 품질관리서 작성 대상 건축자재는 용도에 따라 달라요
English: First of all, the building materials subject to the quality control report for composite materials vary depending on their intended use.

Korean: 자재의 종류 위치 용도에 따라 작성 여부를 판단해야 합니다
English: You should decide whether to write it or not based on the type, location, and purpose of the material.

Korean: 해당 사항에 대해 관할 허가권자에게 문의해주셔야 하세요
English: You should contact your local licensing authority regarding this matter.
Then you can't tell from this side?

Korean: 네 품질관리서 작성 대항 건축자재는 관할 허가권자께 문의주셔야 합니다
English: Yes, you should contact the competent licensing authority for the construction materials for which a quality control certificate is prepared.
Okay, I understand. I'll ask them.
Yes, it was #@name# of #@affiliation#
Hello, this is counselor #@Affiliation#, #@Name#

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 제가 질문사항이 있어서 전화드렸습니다
English: Yes, hello. I'm calling because I have a question.
Yes, is there anything you would like to ask?

Korean: 유당분해 제품의 경우 속편한이나 소화가 잘 되는걸 표기할 수 있나요
English: For lactose-free products, can it be labeled as easy to digest or easy to digest?
Yes, sir, is the product you are talking about a dairy product?

Korean: 네 유당 분해 우유라고 잘 소화하지 못하는 분들을 위한 우유입니다
English: Yes, this is lactose-free milk for people who have trouble digesting lactose.

Korean: 시중에 판매되고 있는 우유들과 다른 제품인가요
English: Is this a different product from the milks sold on the market?

Korean: 예 시중에 판매되는 우유를 못드시는 분들을 위한 우유입니다
English: Yes, this is milk for people who cannot drink commercially available milk.

Korean: 그러시면 일부로 속 편한 이라던가 소화가 잘되는 표시는 가능합니다
English: In that case, it is possible to get some indications of comfort or good digestion.

Korean: 아 해당 단어가 들어가게 표기는 가능한건가요
English: Ah, is it possible to write it with that word in it?

Korean: 예 고객님 말씀하신 목적의 경우 표기 가능합니다
English: Yes, it is possible to indicate the purpose you mentioned.

Korean: 네 감사합니다 제가 #@소속# 방침들을 잘 몰라서 여쭤봤습니다
English: Yes, thank you. I asked because I don't know the #@affiliation# policies very well.

Korean: 네 추가 문의 사항 언제든지 연락 주세요
English: Yes, please contact us anytime with any further questions
Hello, I am a counselor from #@Affiliation# Counseling Center #@Name#

Korean: 예 제가 유기견 보호소 시설에 대해 여쭤보고 싶은게 있어서요
English: Yes, I have a question about the shelter facilities for abandoned dogs.
Yes, sir, are you talking about the shelter for abandoned dogs?

Korean: 예 저희 동네에 유기동물 보호소가 있는데 시설이 많이 낙후되어서요
English: Yes, there is an animal shelter in my neighborhood, but the facilities are very outdated.

Korean: 실례지만 고객님 거주하고 계신 주소 한번만 말씀해주시겠습니까
English: Excuse me, but could you please tell me your address?
Here is the address #@address#
Yes, thank you for confirming

Korean: 현재 확인된 주소지로 개설된지 오래된 시설이 하나 검색되는데요
English: Currently, one old facility is found at the confirmed address.

Korean: 네 지금 지어진지 오래되어서 개선이 필요해보입니다
English: Yes, it's been a while since it was built, so it looks like it needs some improvement.

Korean: 네 저희도 현재 지급예산이 작년에 비해 많이 증액되었습니다
English: Yes, our current payment budget has increased significantly compared to last year.

Korean: 치료 관련 예산도 추가편성해 변화를 지속적으로 시도하고있습니다
English: We are continuously trying to bring about change by additionally allocating a budget for treatment.
Oh, it's a lot better than before.

Korean: 네 관리도 이전보다 잘 되고 있는것으로 보입니다
English: Yes, it seems like your management is doing better than before.
Yes, I understand. Thank you for your guidance.
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@affiliation# with the people.
Yes, I called because I wanted to ask you something.
Do you have any questions for us?

Korean: 네 혹시 형광램프 대체형 엘이디 램프 규격에 대해 여쭤봐도 되나요
English: Yes, can I ask about the specifications of LED lamps that replace fluorescent lamps?

Korean: 네 고객님 문의 주신 사항 확인하겠습니다
English: Yes, sir. I will check the details you have inquired about.

Korean: 말씀해주신 대체형 엘이디 램프에 대해 문의주신것으로 확인됩니다
English: We have confirmed that you have inquired about the replacement LED lamp you mentioned.

Korean: 예 맞아요 현재 규격에 대체가 되는 엘이디 램프가 있나요
English: Yes, that's right. Is there a replacement LED lamp for the current standard?

Korean: 기계식 스위치 부착 여부와 관계 없이 육점 오절에 적합해야합니다
English: Must be suitable for six-point cuts, regardless of whether mechanical switches are attached

Korean: 제가 찾아봤을 때 거기에 적합한 다른 램프가 없던데
English: When I looked, I couldn't find any other lamps that would fit there.

Korean: 예 고객님 현재 이 규격은 말씀하신 형광램프가 단독 모델이세요
English: Yes sir, currently this specification is the only model of the fluorescent lamp you mentioned.
Then, does that mean it can't be replaced with another product?

Korean: 네 육점 오절에 적합하는 해당 램프 자체로만 사용이 가능합니다
English: Yes, it can only be used with the corresponding lamp itself that is suitable for the six-point five-section.
Okay, I'll have to be careful when using it.

Korean: 네 고객님 추가 문의사항 있으시면 언제든지 연락주세요
English: Yes, please contact us anytime if you have any further questions.
I will take good care of you. I am a counselor #@Affiliation# #@Name#

Korean: 안녕하세요 제가 방송을 보다가 불편한 점이 있어서요
English: Hello, I was watching the broadcast and I had some inconvenience.
Yes, I heard you had some inconveniences.
There are subtitles at the bottom of the broadcast, right?
Are you talking about the broadcast subtitles?

Korean: 네 자막에 방송을 보는데 너무 커서 방해가 되는 느낌이에요
English: I'm watching the broadcast with the subtitles on, but they're so loud that it feels like a distraction.

Korean: 방송 시청하시는데 자막이 많이 커서 불편하셨나요
English: Are you uncomfortable watching the broadcast because the subtitles are too big?
We apologize for any inconvenience caused to you, customer.

Korean: #@소속# 이나 댓글로 악플이 많이 올라오고 수신료가 비싼것 같아요
English: #@Affiliation# There are a lot of malicious comments in the comments and it seems like the subscription fee is expensive

Korean: 그에 관한 대책을 좀 마련해주셨으면 싶습니다
English: I would like you to come up with some countermeasures for that.

Korean: 네 특정 방송에 대한 불만과 경기 중계 편성 요청이시죠
English: Yes, you have a complaint about a specific broadcast and a request for game broadcasting arrangements.
The family that watched it together thought the same thing

Korean: 예 시청 요금 중계 또는 편성 여부는 사업자에 따릅니다
English: Yes, whether or not the viewing fee is relayed or organized depends on the business operator.

Korean: 사업자의 자율적인 경영행위 및 판단에 따라 결정되고 있어요 고객님
English: It is determined based on the business owner's autonomous management actions and judgment.
Oh, I guess there are separate people in charge of management.
If you have any questions, please contact @affiliation# #@phone# and we will respond.
Hello, this is counselor #@name# from #@affiliation#
Yes, hello, I am the parent of #@name#

Korean: 예 안녕하세요 어떤 사항 때문에 전화주신건가요
English: Yes, hello. Why are you calling?
I have something to ask you.
Yes, what are you curious about?
These days, a new elementary school construction project is underway at #@Address#.
Yes, that's right, it's currently in progress.

Korean: 저희 아이들이 이전보다 더 안전하게 지낼 수 있는 환경일까요
English: Is this an environment where our children can live safer than before?
I think you're very worried, Mom.

Korean: 다른 분들도 많이 문의 주시고 있어요
English: Many other people are asking questions too

Korean: 현재 사업 진행 중 인근의 개발현황 등은 홈페이지에 나와있습니다
English: Current business progress and development status in the vicinity are listed on the website.

Korean: 교육청 홈페이지 주소가 혹시 어떻게 되나요
English: What is the address of the education office website?

Korean: 네 어머님 핸드폰 번호 말씀 해주시면 그쪽으로 링크 보내드리겠습니다
English: If you tell me your mother's cell phone number, I can send you the link.
Oh yes, it's #@phone number#

Korean: 네 제가 이쪽으로 따로 링크 보내드릴게요
English: Yes, I will send you a separate link here.
If you have any questions, please refer to the website.
Yes, I understand. Please send me the address to my phone.

Korean: 네 통화 종료 후 바로 보내드리겠습니다 감사합니다
English: Yes, I will send it to you right after the call ends. Thank you.
I'll help you with anything. This is #@Affiliation# Counselor #@Name#
Yes, hello, I am a parent of #@affiliation#

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 어떤 사항 때문에 전화주셨나요
English: Hello, what is the matter with you?

Korean: 학교에 아이들이 과밀화된 환경 속에서 공부하고 있지 않은가요
English: Aren't children studying in overcrowded environments at school?

Korean: 네 학부모님들께서 많이 불안해 하시는 상황 잘 알고있습니다
English: Yes, I know very well that parents are very anxious.

Korean: 지금도 평균 많은 수의 민원이 접수되고 있는 실정인데요
English: Even now, an average number of civil complaints are being filed.

Korean: 해당 민원 처리에 있어 답변이 늦은점 죄송합니다
English: We apologize for the delay in responding to your complaint.
I see. I didn't know about those parts.

Korean: 아닙니다 학교 신설에 있어 자세한 사항은 홈페이지에 첨부되어 있습니다
English: No, details about the new school are attached to the website.
Was that posted on the bulletin board?
Please contact #@Affiliation# or #@Name#Officer #@Phone#

Korean: 예 알겠습니다 더 궁금한 사항이 있으면 그쪽으로 문의하겠습니다
English: Yes, I understand. If I have any further questions, I will contact you.
Yes, thank you, this was counselor #@name#
Hello, I am #@name# working in the #@affiliation# Educational Facility Safety Department.
Hello, is special work allowance paid when on standby?

Korean: 우선 귀하께서 말씀하신 내용은 특수업무수당에 관한 것으로 이해됩니다
English: First of all, I understand that what you said is about special work allowances.

Korean: 네 제가 지방 공무원인데 대기발령시에 특수업무수당이 지급 되나요
English: Yes, I am a local government employee. Will I be paid a special work allowance when I am on standby?
Are you talking about the allowance that comes with the standby order?

Korean: 예 제가 알기로 특수 업무수당이 나온다고 들었거든요
English: Yes, I heard that there is a special duty allowance.

Korean: 해당 수당은 육 급 이하 일반직 육 급 상당 이하 별정직 공무원이예요
English: The allowance is for general civil servants of Grade 6 or lower and special civil servants of Grade 6 or lower.
Because I am a civil servant who falls under that category.

Korean: 네 그러시면 대기 발령시 특수 업무수당 지급 되십니다
English: Yes, if you do that, you will be paid a special work allowance when you are on standby.
Is that so? Then the allowance is paid by the number of days worked.

Korean: 네 업무에 종사한 기간에 대하여 일할 계산하여 지급됩니다
English: Your salary will be calculated based on the period of time you worked.

Korean: 직무에 종사하지 않을 경우 특수업무수당 지급이 불가합니다
English: If you are not engaged in your job, you will not be eligible for special work allowance.

Korean: 네 확인 감사합니다 궁금한 점 생기면 다시 연락드리겠습니다
English: Yes, thank you for checking. I will contact you again if I have any questions.
Yes, thank you. Have a nice day.
Hello, I am #@name# working in the #@affiliation# Educational Facility Safety Department.

Korean: #@주소# 초중고 신축 공사에 철근 자제 수급 보장이 되었으면 합니다
English: #@Address# I hope that the supply of rebar for new elementary, middle, and high school construction will be guaranteed.

Korean: 네 그러셨군요 우선 저희 교육행정에 관심을 가져주셔서 감사합니다
English: Yes, I see. First of all, thank you for your interest in our educational administration.

Korean: 최근 철강 가격이 급등함으로 인해 공급 부족현상이 생겼습니다
English: The recent surge in steel prices has led to a supply shortage.

Korean: 그래서 철근이 필요한 학교 시설 공사가 지연될 수밖에 없었습니다
English: So the construction of school facilities that required steel reinforcement was inevitably delayed.
Is the construction delayed due to a shortage of rebar?

Korean: 예 고객님 조달청과의 문제가 생긴 상황입니다
English: Yes sir, we have a problem with the procurement office.

Korean: 그랬군요 그럼 지금 당장은 수급이 안되고 있겠어요
English: I see. So you're not getting any supply right now?

Korean: 그럼 언제 다시 예전처럼 수급될 수 있나요
English: So when will we be able to get supplies back like before?
It's hard to predict given the current situation.
Is this a situation that is not easy to predict?

Korean: 네 학교시설공사에 우선순위를 두고 납품될 수 있도록 노력 중입니다
English: Yes, we are working to ensure that the school facility construction is delivered with priority.

Korean: 조달청에 협조 요청을 하는  등 원활한 수급에 최선을 다하고 있습니다
English: We are doing our best to ensure smooth supply, including requesting cooperation from the Public Procurement Service.
We get a lot of complaints

Korean: 네 하루에 몇백 건씩 올라오고는 있습니다
English: Yes, hundreds of them are coming in every day.
You must be working hard. Take it easy.
Okay, I understand. My questions have been answered.
Yes, have a nice day, this was counselor #@name#
Hello, I am your friendly #@affiliation# counselor #@name#
Hello, I'm contacting you to ask you something.

Korean: 예 안녕하세요 궁금하신 사항 말씀 해주세요
English: Yes, hello. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Korean: 혹시 교통법규위반차량을 경고처분하는 것이 타당한지 궁금해서요
English: I was wondering if it is appropriate to issue a warning to a vehicle that violates traffic laws.

Korean: 질문 내용이 혹시 위반 차량에게 말씀하시는건가요
English: Are you talking about the offending vehicle?

Korean: 예 위반 차량들이 많아서 제가 많이 불편한 상황이라서요
English: Yes, I am very uncomfortable because there are many vehicles that violate the law.

Korean: 많이 불편하셨나요 저희 쪽에서 해드릴 수 있는 부분 말씀드릴게요
English: Are you very uncomfortable? Let me tell you what we can do for you.

Korean: 교통법규를 위반한 사람을 경고 처벌하기 위해하는 경찰활동을 말합니다
English: Refers to police activities to warn and punish people who violate traffic laws.

Korean: 그러면 경찰이 아닌 사람들은 할 수 있는게 없는건가요
English: So there's nothing that non-police people can do?
There are four possible cases:
Is that so? Could you please let me know?

Korean: 네 첫째로 사건 사고에 따른 조사를 위한 경우입니다
English: Yes, first of all, it is for investigations into accidents and incidents.

Korean: 두번째로는 응급 구난 등 부득이한 경우에 가능하고요
English: Secondly, it is possible in unavoidable cases such as emergency rescue.
These are cases that are hard to see normally.

Korean: 법규를 위반한 분은 위반일부터 신고일이 일주일 이상 지난 경우입니다
English: For those who violated the law, it is a case where more than one week has passed since the date of violation.

Korean: 그리고 마지막으로 교통상 소통을 저해한다고 판단되는 경우가 있고요
English: And finally, there are cases where it is judged that it impedes traffic flow.

Korean: 위험을 발생시키지 않을 것으로 판단되는 위반행위시에도 가능합니다
English: It is also possible in cases of violations that are judged not to cause danger.
Okay, I was wondering if it was possible, thanks for the explanation.
Yes, I have been a counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Name#, a friendly counselor from #@Affiliation#
Hello, I'm contacting you to ask you something.

Korean: 예 안녕하세요 궁금하신 사항 말씀 해주세요
English: Yes, hello. Please let me know if you have any questions.
There is powdered milk for children, right?

Korean: 네 젓병에 타먹는 분유 말씀하시는거 맞으세요
English: Are you talking about the powdered milk that you drink in a bottle?

Korean: 네 분유를 사용하는 경우 그 제품에 우유라교 표시하는게 가능할까요
English: If I use powdered milk, is it possible to label the product as milk powder?

Korean: 제품 명의 일부로 우유를 기재하시려는거 맞으신가요
English: Are you sure you want to list milk as part of the product name?

Korean: 네 아니면 주 표시면에 우유 함유라고 표시 할 수 있으면 싶은데
English: Yes, or I would like to be able to indicate on the main display that it contains milk.

Korean: 식품의 기준 및 규격에 따른 정의를 참고로 하시면 됩니다
English: Please refer to the definition according to food standards and specifications.
Then, can it be marked on the product?

Korean: 네 제품의 일부로 우유 표기가 가능할것이라 판단됩니다
English: I think it would be possible to label milk as part of your product.

Korean: 주 표시면에 표시하시는 경우면 십이 포인트 이상의 글씨로 표기해주세요
English: If you display it on the main display, please write it in font size of twelve points or more.
If you display it as a product name

Korean: 십사 포인트 이상의 글씨 크기를 사용해주셔야 합니다
English: You must use a font size of 14 points or larger.
Okay, I was wondering if it was possible, thanks for the explanation.
Yes, I have been a counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Name#, a friendly counselor from #@Affiliation#
Hello, I'm contacting you to ask you something.

Korean: 예 안녕하세요 궁금하신 사항 말씀 해주세요
English: Yes, hello. Please let me know if you have any questions.
Yes, I heard that #@Other# is being extended. Is that true?

Korean: 네 우선 저희 철도업무에 관심 가져주셔서 감사합니다
English: Yes, first of all, thank you for your interest in our railway business.

Korean: #@기타# 노선이 서북부 연장 #@주소#역 추가 설치 건인가요
English: #@Other# Is the line extended to the northwest? #@Address# Is it a matter of installing additional stations?
Yes, that's right. I heard that the #@Address# station is being added.

Korean: 네 현재 사업타당성 검토를 위해 예비 타당성 조사 추진중에 있어요
English: Yes, we are currently conducting a preliminary feasibility study to review the business feasibility.
So it's not confirmed yet?

Korean: 네 관리기관간의 협의와 국가 상위계획 반영등 절차를 거쳐야 해서요
English: Yes, it has to go through procedures such as consultation between management agencies and reflection in the national high-level plan.
It'll take some time

Korean: 네 아무래도 국가 사업이라 거쳐야 할 검토들이 많아요 고객님
English: Yes, it is a national project, so there are many reviews that need to be done, customer.
Okay, it's true that the business is in progress.

Korean: 네 승인 절차 밟고있는 중이고 승인되면 착공에 들어갑니다
English: Yes, we are going through the approval process and once approved, we will start construction.

Korean: 알겠습니다 어떻게 진행되는지 궁금했는데 설명 감사해요
English: Okay, I was wondering how it works, thanks for the explanation.
Yes, I have been a counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Name#, a friendly counselor from #@Affiliation#
Hello, I'm contacting you to ask you something.

Korean: 예 안녕하세요 궁금하신 사항 말씀 해주세요
English: Yes, hello. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Korean: 병원에서 사전 고지 없이 치료 진행 후 진료비 과다청구를 받아서요
English: I was overcharged for medical expenses after receiving treatment at the hospital without prior notice.
I guess you were very surprised, customer.

Korean: 위급한 상황이였다고 듣긴 했는데 어떻게 이렇게 청구된건지 알고싶어서요
English: I heard it was an emergency, but I want to know how it was billed like this.

Korean: 건강보험심사평에서는 진료비에 대해 확인하는 업무를 보고 있는데요
English: The Health Insurance Review & Assessment Service is responsible for checking medical expenses.

Korean: 그럼 저한테 청구된 진료비도 적절한건지 알 수 있나요
English: Then, can I know if the medical expenses charged to me are appropriate?

Korean: 병원이나 치료받은 기관의 진료비 계산서 등을 첨부 제출해 주세요
English: Please submit attached medical bills from the hospital or institution where you received treatment.
Okay, I understand. I'll attach it and submit it to you.
Yes, I have been a counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Name#, a friendly counselor from #@Affiliation#
Hello, I'm contacting you because I have something to ask you.
Yes, what are you curious about?

Korean: 예 혹시 폐기물 재활용업자분들의 시설이 어떻게 운영되고 있나요
English: Yes, by any chance, how are the facilities of waste recycling companies operated?

Korean: 폐기물 재활용업 허가자분들이 갖추어야 할 사항으로 이해됩니다
English: I understand that these are the requirements that waste recycling business licensees must have.

Korean: 적용 죄종에 따라 진행여부가 상이해 담당 수사관과 상담 받아보세요
English: Depending on the type of crime applied, the progress may vary, so consult with the investigator in charge.

Korean: 단순폭행 협박 등으로 입건되었을 경우 반의사불벌죄에 해당합니다
English: If a case is filed for simple assault and threats, it is considered a crime not punishable by imprisonment

Korean: 특수협박으로 입건되었다면 취하 여부와 관계없이 사건 진행됩니다
English: If a case is filed for special intimidation, the case will proceed regardless of whether it is withdrawn.

Korean: 그렇기 때문에 담당 수사관과 상담 필요합니다
English: That is why you need to consult with the investigator in charge.
Okay, I understand. Thank you.

Is it possible for a specialized high school student to transfer to a general high school?

Korean: 특성화고 학생은 일 학년 학기말 성적 기준이 충족되면 가능합니다
English: Specialized high school students can apply if they meet the grade standards at the end of the first semester.

Korean: 학교장 추천을 받아 추첨배정 일반고로 전학을 신청할 수 있습니다.
English: You can apply for a transfer to a general high school through lottery allocation with the recommendation of the school principal.

Yes, first I will tell you the grading criteria.

Korean: 직전 학기 이수한 공통과목 성적이 석차등급제로 삼 등급 이내입니다
English: The grade for common subjects completed in the previous semester is within 3 grades in the ranking system.

Korean: 학교장이 일반고 교육과정 이수 지장이 없다고 판단된 학생이어야 합니다
English: The student must be one who has been judged by the school principal to have no difficulties in completing the general high school curriculum.
What is the application period?

Korean: 일 학년 일 학기 성적산출일부터 팔 월말

Korean: 또는 이 학기 성적 산출일부터 다음 년도 삼 월말까지입니다
English: Or from the date of grade calculation for this semester to the end of March of the following year.
