English: Is it possible to transfer to another high school due to maladjustment to school life?

Korean: 교육환경을 바꿔줄 필요가 있는 학생들에게 따로 제도가 있습니다
English: There is a separate system for students who need to change their educational environment.

Korean: 학교장이 교육환경을 바꾸어 줄 필요가 있다고 인정한 경우입니다

Korean: 다른 학교로 전입학을 추천한 학생에 대하여 전입학 심사위원회를 엽니다
English: We hold a transfer review committee for students recommended for transfer to another school.

Korean: 적부 심사를 거쳐 판정을 받은 학생을 교육감이 학교로 배정합니다
English: The superintendent of education assigns students who have passed the eligibility screening to schools.

English: You must inquire about transfer directly to the school you wish to transfer to.

Korean: 이를 기준으로 우리나라 학제에 맞추어 계산합니다

Korean: 우리나라 학제에 학교급별 교육과정 상의 교육 연한 기준으로 하고요

English: I would like to inquire about whether it is possible to use food labeling that does not contain any added colorants.

Korean: 네 식육가공품의 색소 무첨가 표시에 관련 된 문의로 이해됩니다
English: I understand that your inquiry is related to the labeling of no added pigments in processed meat products.
Yes, that's right. Is it possible?

Korean: 표시 광고에 관한 법률에 따르면 식품등의 명칭 제조방법 성분이 있죠
English: According to the law on labeling and advertising, there are names, manufacturing methods, and ingredients of foods, etc.

Korean: A질병의 예방 치료에 효능이 있는 것으로 인식할 우려가 있습니다
English: There is concern that it may be perceived as effective in the prevention and treatment of disease A.

Korean: 그렇죠 그런 문제가 있을 수 있죠
English: Yes, there could be such a problem.

Korean: 식품에 표시나 광고에 대하여 실증 할 수 있어야 합니다
English: Must be able to substantiate claims or advertisements on food

Korean: 식품 등의 표시 또는 광고가 법률에 위반할 우려가 있어서요
English: There is a concern that the labeling or advertising of food, etc. may violate the law.

Korean: 해당 식품등에 대한 실증이 필요하다고 인정하는 경우가 있습니다
English: There are cases where verification of the food in question is deemed necessary.

Korean: 그러면 그 내용을 구체적으로 밝혀 해당 식품등에 표시하여야 하구요
English: Then, the details must be clearly stated and displayed on the relevant food, etc.

Korean: 해당 식품 등을 광고한 자에게 실증자료를 요청 할 수 있습니다.
English: You may request verification data from the person who advertised the food in question.

Korean: 제가 다시 한번 더 읽어 봐야겠네요

Korean: 그렇죠 그런 문제가 있을 수 있죠

Korean: 거짓 과장된 표시 또는 광고 소비자를 기만하는 표시 또는 광고
English: False or exaggerated representations or advertisements that deceive consumers

Korean: 다른 업체나 다른 업체의 제품을 비방하는 표시 또는 광고
English: Any sign or advertisement that disparages another company or its products.

Korean: 객관적인 근거없이 영업자의 식품등과 부당하게 비교하는 표시 또는 광고
English: Labeling or advertising that unfairly compares the seller's food, etc. with the seller's food without objective basis

Yes, I understand.

Korean: 그리고 증명 사진과 신청서만 같이 보내주시면됩니다
English: And you just need to send us your ID photo and application form.
Where should I send the address?
Yes, I will give you the address.
Please send it to Chungnam #@Address# #@Affiliation#
Yes, I understand. Thank you for your guidance.
#@Affiliation# This is the teacher. I checked the information you asked.

Korean: 여권은 미성년자 이촌 이내의 친족이 방문 대리발급을 하실 수 있습니다

Korean: 이에 따른 추가적인 서류가 있을 있습니다
English: There may be additional documentation required.

Korean: 그건 또 뭐예요 무슨 추가 서류요
English: What is that? What additional documents?
I will check and let you know.
Is your child planning to visit?

Korean: 아니면 이촌 이내의 친족이 대리 발급을 하실 예정이십니까

Korean: 우리 딸이 갈건데 이모가 대신 갈 수도 있어요

Korean: 그러면 우선 본인 방문 시 구비서류 안내해 드리겠습니다 메모 가능하십니까
English: Then, first, I will guide you through the documents you need to prepare when you visit. Can you take notes?
Yes, you can make a note. Please call me.

Korean: 학생증이나 주민등록증이 발급된 경우에는 주민등록증을 지참해야 합니다

Yes, that's right, that's necessary

Korean: 사진을 미리 뽑아갈 필요 없이 거기서 찍어서 가능하다는 얘기죠

Korean: 기계가 셀프 촬영 기기이기 때문에 규정상 업무가 어려울 수 있습니다

Korean: 사진을 준비해 오시는 부분이 더 좋으실 듯 합니다

Korean: 그게 그렇게 안 됐을 때는 거기서도 가능은 하다는 얘기죠
English: If that doesn't work out, then it's possible there too.
Yes, that is possible.
Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?

Korean: 시가 표준액 조정기준 관련 다운로드 가능한 부분 안내드리겠습니다

#@Affiliation# Is this the correct homepage?
Yes, that's right. On the main page of the #@affiliation# homepage.

Yes, I see the information is public
Yes, in the information disclosure, there is a standard market price for local taxes.

Korean: 이거는 그냥 기타물건시가표준액인데 이거가 맞나 모르겠네 정보감사합니다

Yes, please connect me to the investigation department.

Yes, teacher, I am truly sorry for the inconvenience.

Yes, then please

Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?

I'm calling to find out if there's any problem with #@affiliation#

Korean: 그 규정이 다를 수 있어서 해당 부서에 연락을 해보라고 해서요

Korean: 혹시 #@소속# 관할 지자체마다 서류가 다른지는 모르겠지만요

Korean: 네 에이 민원인의 부탁으로 비 민원인의 재산상의 손실이 발생하고요
English: Yes, at the request of the petitioner, a non-petitioner's property damage occurs.

Yes, I will wait. Please check and let me know.
Yes, thank you for waiting, teacher.

Yes, please hurry up

A certificate of seal from the legal representative is required.
I need a consent form for the legal representative's seal.
If you are the legal representative, are you speaking to your parents?

Could you please wait a moment?

Ah, it's military service #@affiliation#

Korean: 그러면 더 정확하실 것 같습니다 선생님

English: Yes, you can just visit us with the documents I provided.
Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?

Yes, I'm going alone
Oh, if that's the case, excuse me, but how old were you?
My name is #@Shinwon#

Yes, you can take notes. Please tell me.

You can write it after your visit.

Korean: 그러나 오염이나 훼손이 있을 시 업무 처리가 어려울 수 있어요

Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'll talk next.

Korean: 네 저희가 안내드린 서류를 동봉해서 보내주시면 됩니다

Oh, yes, I understand. Thank you.
Do you have any further questions?

#@Affiliation# Do you have internet access?
No, the internet doesn't work

I think you can ask for it by fax at #@affiliation#

Korean: 팩스번호를 알고 계시면 팩스번호로 신청서를 보내드릴 수는 있습니다
English: If you know your fax number, we can fax the application to you.
Oh, yes, I understand. Thank you.
Nice to meet you, this is #@affiliation# How may I help you?

Korean: 자격증을 잃어버려서 다시 신청하려고 전화 드렸었어요

Korean: 문자를 받았는데 이거대로 제가 준비해서 보내야 되는 거에요

Korean: 신청서와 신분증 사본 한 부 반명함 사진 한 장이 필요합니다
English: An application form and a copy of your ID and a business card photo are required.
Oh yeah, there are a lot of things
Teacher, have you filled out the application form?
Now I'm going to submit the application to the wiretapping office.

Korean: 신분증 사본 한부 반명함 사진 한 장 발급비용 이천원이랑요
English: One copy of your ID card and one photo of your business card. The issuance fee is 2,000 won.
Please prepare a total of 4,500 won, including 2,500 won for the registration fee.

Korean: 우체국에서 통상환으로 변경해서 기타서류와 함께 동봉해서 보내주시면 됩니다
English: You can change it to regular money order at the post office and send it along with other documents.
Oh, yes, I understand. Thank you.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'll talk next.
Okay, I understand. Please continue speaking.

Korean: 네 오래 기다리게 해드려서 정말 죄송합니다

Korean: 시군청으로 다시 한 번 문의를 해보셔야 한다고 전달을 받았습니다

Korean: 아 그러면 시군청에서 안 된다고 하면 안 되는 거에요
English: Oh, then if the city or county office says it can't be done, then it can't be done.
Yeah, I think that's the part.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Do you have any other questions?
No, no further questions

Please take care of your health in this hot weather.
Nice to meet you, I am #@Affiliation# #@Name#. Please continue.

Korean: 다시 한번 확인 후 안내해드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려주시겠습니까

Okay, I understand. I'll wait.
Thank you for waiting, teacher.

Korean: 조례가 상이한 부분으로 도청에서 정확히 답변 가능한지는 확인이 어렵고요
English: It is difficult to confirm whether the city hall can give an accurate answer because the ordinances are different.

Korean: 혹시 그 주소지를 이전하기 전의 지역에서는 받아보시기가 어려우신가요
English: Are you having trouble receiving it in the area before you moved to that address?

Korean: 네 거기도 전화를 했더니 거기서는 이제 주소 이전을 했잖아요
English: Yeah, I called there too, and they said they changed their address.

Korean: 그러면 다시 주소를 그쪽으로 이전해서 일년을 거주해야 된다는데요
English: Then, I have to move my address there again and live there for a year.

Korean: 저희가 이사를 했는데 그럼 또 이사를 해야 되잖아요
English: We moved, so we have to move again.

Korean: 애기가 언제 나올줄 알고 이건 좀 말이 안 되지 않나요
English: Doesn't this seem a bit ridiculous when you know when the baby will come?

Korean: #@소속#에서 상담 가능한 담당자 번호 확인 후 연결하겠습니다
English: #@Affiliation# We will connect you after confirming the number of the person in charge who can provide consultation.
Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?
Yes, I would like to ask about the childbirth incentive.

Korean: 네 실례지만 혹시 어느 지역의 출산장려금 문의십니까
English: Excuse me, but which region are you inquiring about the childbirth incentive?

Korean: 네 #@소속#인데요 거기는 육개월 이상 거주를 해야 한다고 하는데요
English: Yes, I'm from #@affiliation#, but they say I have to live there for more than six months.

Korean: 제가 애기가 칠월 십칠일 예정일이었는데 좀 일찍 나와서요
English: My baby was due on July 17th, but she came out a little early.

Korean: 육개월이 안 되거든요 그렇게 되면 방법이 따로 없나요
English: It hasn't even been six months, so is there no other way?
The local community center said it was difficult
They said it had to be over six months

Korean: 하루라도 일찍 나오면 안 된다고만 얘기를 하더라고요
English: He just told me not to come out even a day early.
I won't tell you any other way
Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?
Would you like to inquire about childbirth incentives at #@affiliation#?
Okay, I understand. I'll try.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'll talk next.

Korean: 제가 저출산고령화 정책과 담당자로 연결 시도 하겠습니다
English: I will try to connect you with the person in charge of the low birth rate and aging population policy.

Korean: 제가 이따 #@소속#에 가서 팩스로 보내달라고 하면 되겠죠
English: I can go to #@affiliation# later and ask them to send it by fax.

Korean: 아 네 그러시면 선생님 그 #@소속#에 방문하실 때요
English: Oh yes, then when you visit #@affiliation#, teacher
I will give you the contact number of the person in charge.

Korean: 아 네 알겠습니다 그렇게 하면 되겠네요
English: Oh, yes, I understand. That will work.
Can you take a note? It's #@phone number#

Korean: 혹시 모르니 방문 전에 담당자가 자리에 있는지 확인 해보시구요
English: Just in case, please check if the person in charge is present before visiting.

Korean: 이후에 #@소속# 방문하셔서 업무처리 하시면 좋으실 듯 합니다
English: I think it would be good to visit #@affiliation# later and handle business.
Oh, thank you. I will do that.
Any other questions?
No, thank you. Thank you for your hard work.
Yes, teacher, I hope your work goes smoothly.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'll talk next.

Korean: 문자 내용에 혹시 담당부서도 기재가 되어 있으신가요
English: Is the department in charge also included in the text?
I think there should be a contact number.
No, I don't have a contact number.

Korean: 확인 후 안내해드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려 주시겠습니까
English: I will check and inform you. Could you please wait a moment?

Korean: 신청서를 다시 이 팩스로 보내주면 되는 거에요
English: You can just send the application back to this fax number.

Korean: 예 그 담당자가 신청서를 선생님께 팩스로 보내드리면요
English: Yes, the person in charge will fax the application to you.
The teacher filled out the application form

Korean: 문자 받으신 구비 서류들 모두 지참하셔서요
English: Please bring all the required documents you received.

Korean: 우편등기로 담당자에게 보내주시고 담당자가 등기 받으면요
English: Please send it to the person in charge by registered mail and have the person in charge receive it.

Korean: 업무처리하여 선생님께 다시 등기로 자격증을 보내드리고 있습니다
English: I'm processing the work and sending the certificate back to you by registered mail.

Korean: 근데 저는 지가 이해를 못해서 다시 전화를 드린거에요
English: But I called again because I didn't understand.

Korean: 서류라는 거는 전체적인 서류 얘기하는 거에요
English: When I say documents, I mean the entire document.
Yes, that's right. The required documents are the required documents.

Korean: 원래 민원사무서식이라는 곳에서 재발급 신청서 다운로드가 가능합니다
English: You can download the reissue application form from the original Civil Affairs Office Forms site.

Korean: 그런데 선생님께서 컴퓨터 이용이 어렵다고 하셔서요
English: But the teacher said that it was difficult to use the computer.

Korean: 담당자에게 신청서를 팩스로 보내달라고 요청 하시면 좋으실 듯 합니다
English: I think it would be a good idea to ask the person in charge to fax the application to you.
Yes, I understand. I will do that.
Nice to meet you, this is #@affiliation# How may I help you?

Korean: 네 여보세요 아까 제가 전화드렸던 사람이에요
English: Hello, I'm the one who called you earlier.
I lost my certificate and am applying for a reissue.
They sent me the necessary documents by text message.

Korean: 근데 이 구비서류하고 민원서류서식은 어디서 해야 돼요
English: But where do I get these required documents and civil complaint forms?

Korean: 구비서류는 문자로 보내드린 부분이 모두 구비를 하셔야 하는 서류이고요
English: All of the documents that we sent you via text message are documents that you must prepare.
Do you have any questions about how to download the reissue application form?
Yes, I would like to inquire about a reissue request.

Korean: 죄송하지만 제가 전에 전화 받은 상담사가 아닌 다른 상담사입니다
English: Sorry, I'm not the counselor you called before.

Korean: 재발급 신청서를 다운로드 받으실 수 있는 경로 안내해드리면 될까요
English: Could you please tell me where I can download the reissue application form?
I got a text message

Korean: 제가 이거를 민원 사무 서식은 어디가서 서류를 보나요
English: Where can I find the civil affairs office form for this document?
Is your PC available now?
No, I can't do that.
If you have difficulty using a PC, teacher

Korean: 담당자에게 신청서를 팩스로 보내달라고 요청 하시면 좋으실 듯 합니다
English: I think it would be a good idea to ask the person in charge to fax the application to you.

Korean: 그냥 신청서만 보내달라고 하면 되는 거에요
English: All you have to do is ask them to send you an application form.
Yes, sir, you can do that.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'll talk next.
I'm really sorry for keeping you waiting for so long.
No, please tell me

Korean: 담당자가 잠시 자리를 비워 선생님께 직접 연락할 수 있을 거에요
English: The person in charge will be out of the office for a moment so that he can contact the teacher directly.
I was told that a note would be passed on
Oh, so they're contacting you?

Korean: 네 선생님 번호로 담당자가 연락할 수 있도록 메모 전달 하겠습니다
English: Yes, I will pass on a note to the person in charge so that he or she can contact you with your number.
Okay, I understand. Please do that.
Excuse me, but could you tell me your teacher's name?
Yes, my name is #@name#

Korean: 네 제가 담당 부서로 내용 전달하겠습니다 다른 문의사항 있으십니까
English: Yes, I will forward the information to the relevant department. Do you have any other questions?
No, there isn't. Thank you for your hard work.
Yes, I hope your work goes smoothly. It was #@affiliation#
Nice to meet you. This is #@Affiliation#. I'm calling to ask you something.
Yes, please tell me your #@affiliation# #@name#

Korean: 안녕하세요 실례지만 혹시 #@이름# 주무관님 자리에 안 계신가요
English: Hello, I'm sorry, but is Director #@Name# not in his/her seat?
Oh, you didn't come out today because you were on vacation.
I'm sorry, but the complainant called an ambulance.
I received the emergency medical records of the circumstances leading up to the call.

Korean: 기재된 사항과 사실이 다르다며 정정요청이 가능한지 문의를 주셨어요
English: You asked if it was possible to request a correction because the information described was different from the facts.

Korean: 아 그러세요 혹시 다시 연락드릴 수 있는 번호가 있나요
English: Oh, by the way, is there a number I can call you back at?
The complainant is currently still waiting to be called.

Korean: 아 그래요 지금 답변 하실 분이 지금 잠깐 자리에 안 계셔서요
English: Oh, right. The person who was supposed to answer is not here right now.

Korean: 아 그러시면 제가 민원인께 먼저 그 부분을 말씀드린 후에요
English: Oh, then I will tell the complainant about that part first.

Korean: 제가 다시 연락드려서 민원인 전화번호 말씀 드리겠습니다
English: I will contact you again and tell you the complainant's phone number.
Yes, that will work. Thank you.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'll talk next.
I'm really sorry, teacher.

Korean: 현재 담당자가 다른 분이 담당을 하는 부분으로 확인이 되었습니다
English: It has been confirmed that the person in charge is currently someone else.

Korean: 아 예 그런가요 혹시 확인이 어려운 문제일까요
English: Oh, yes, is that so? Is this a difficult problem to confirm?

Korean: 제가 다시 한번 더 문의 후 선생님께 연결을 해드리겠습니다
English: I will ask you again and connect you with the teacher.
Could you please wait a moment?

Korean: 네 다른 것도 있는데 다시 확인하고 할게요
English: Yes, there are other things too, I'll check again and do it.
Teacher, I am truly sorry for the inconvenience.
We are currently checking with the person in charge.
Oh, okay, then what should I do?

Korean: 제가 담당자에게 문의 후 바로 연락드릴 수 있도록 하겠습니다
English: I will contact you immediately after contacting the person in charge.
Yes, then please contact me like that
Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?
Yes, I wanted to ask you something.

Korean: 구급 활동 기록서를 받았는데 서명과 다른 경우에 정정 요청이 되나요
English: I received an emergency activity record, but if the signature is different, can I request a correction?

Korean: 어떤 구급활동 기록서인지 기관에서 발급 받으셨는지 말씀해 주시겠습니까
English: Could you please tell me what kind of emergency activity record you received from the agency?
Yes, I received it from #@affiliation#

Korean: 사고가 나서 부르게 된 경위를 기록한 구급일지를 받았는데요
English: I received an ambulance log that recorded the circumstances leading up to the accident.

Korean: 근데 그 내용이 다른 그 사실과 다른데 정정요청이 되나요
English: But the content is different from the other facts, so can a correction be requested?

Korean: 제가 관련하여 답변 가능한 담당자 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: I will check with the person in charge who can answer your question and then inform you.
Could you please wait a moment, sir?
#@Affiliation# We will contact the manager as soon as we confirm.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Hello, this is #@affiliation#. I have something to ask you.
Yes, hello, this is #@affiliation#

Korean: 예 안녕하세요 민원님께서 현재 지인분 중소기업 운영 때문에요
English: Yes, hello, Mr. Minwon, I am currently running a small business for an acquaintance.

Korean: 직원숙소를 건축하시려는데 혹시 지자체에서 지원받을 수 있는 게 있나요
English: I'm planning to build staff accommodations. Is there any support I can get from the local government?
#@Name# Mr. Injector is in charge
Oh, is that right? #@Name# Is that right?

Korean: 네 #@소속#이요 지금은 안 계시고 삼십 분 뒤쯤 전화주세요
English: Yes, #@affiliation# is not here right now, please call me in about thirty minutes.
Oh, yes, I understand. Thank you.

Korean: 네 수고하시고 궁금한 점 있으면 다시 연락주세요
English: Yes, thank you for your hard work. If you have any questions, please contact me again.
Nice to meet you, this is #@affiliation# How may I help you?
I'm calling because I have something to ask you.

Korean: 지인이 중소기업을 운영을 하시는데 지금 직원들 숙소를 만드신데요
English: A friend of mine runs a small business and is currently building dormitories for his employees.

Korean: 혹시 도지자체에서 지원금이나 나오는게 있는지 궁금해 하셔서요
English: I was wondering if there was any subsidy or something from the local government.

Korean: 아 그러십니까 지자체에서 지원금 관련 문의 문의이십니까
English: Oh, is that so? Is this an inquiry about subsidies from the local government?
Yes, regarding the construction of staff quarters.

Korean: 아 제가 확인 후 안내해드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려 주시겠습니까
English: Oh, I will check and let you know. Could you please wait a moment?
Thank you for waiting, teacher.

Korean: 현재 #@소속# 담당자 확인되어 제가 문의 후 선생님께 연결 해드리겠습니다
English: Currently, I have confirmed with the person in charge of #@affiliation# and I will contact you and connect you to the teacher.
Could you please wait a moment?
Okay, I understand. Please connect me.
Nice to meet you, I am #@Affiliation# #@Name#. Please continue.

Korean: 신청서는 구청에서 가져다 써야 되는 거에요
English: You have to pick up the application form at the district office.
It's not available at the town office.
Yes, it is available at the district office, sir.

Korean: 혹시 인감증명서는 기계에서도 발급 받을 수 있나요
English: Is it possible to get a seal certificate from a machine?
Yes, there is no separate form for the seal certificate.

Korean: 그냥 임의로 법정대리인이 작성해 주시면 됩니다
English: You can just have your legal representative write it up.
You said you also need a certificate of seal stamp.

Korean: 대리인이 갈 경우에 인감증명서를 기계로 증명서 발급받을 수 있는 건가요
English: If an agent goes, can I get a certificate of seal issued by a machine?
Are you talking about the unmanned civil service issuance machine?
Yes, that's right, that's an unmanned issuance machine

Korean: 인감증명서는 무인 민원 발급기에선 발급이 어렵습니다
English: It is difficult to issue a seal certificate at an unmanned civil service issuance machine.
Then I have to go to the community center.

Korean: 신분증 지참하시고 가까운 주민센터에서 발급하시면 됩니다
English: You can get it issued at a nearby community center by bringing your ID.
Do you have any other questions?
Yes no no

Korean: 아 네 알겠습니다 업무처리 잘 되시길 바랍니다#@소속#이었습니다
English: Oh, yes, I understand. I hope your work goes well. #@Affiliation#
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'll talk next.

Korean: 법정대리인이 작성한 위임장과 인감도장 날인된 동의서가 필요합니다
English: A power of attorney written by a legal representative and a consent form with a seal are required.
And you also need a certificate of seal from your legal representative.

Korean: 그리고 수수료는 일 년에 한 번 사용 가능한 단수여권 이 만 원이구요
English: And the fee is ten thousand won for a single-use passport that can be used once a year.

Korean: 십 년 동안 횟수제한 없이 사용 가능한 복수여권 중에는요
English: Among the multiple passports that can be used without any restrictions for ten years,

Korean: 만 팔 세 미만이신 경우 이십사 면은 삼 만 원 사십팔 면은 삼만 삼천 원입니다
English: If you are under 8 years old, 24 sides are 30,000 won and 48 sides are 33,000 won.

Korean: 예 그리고 여권 같은 경우에 동사무소 가서 만들 수 있어요
English: Yes, and for things like passports, you can go to the local office and make them.
Is this part made at the local office?

Korean: 네 구청에서 말고 주민 센터에서도 만들 수 있어요
English: Yes, you can make it at your local community center as well as at your local government office.

Korean: 선생님 시 군청에서 발급이 가능한 부분입니다
English: Teacher, this is a part that can be issued by the city hall.
Then you have to go to the branch office
Teacher, where are you from?
Yes, this is the #@address#

Korean: 아 네 #@주소#이십니까 제가 발급 기관 확인 후 안내해드리겠습니다
English: Oh yes, is this #@address#? I will check with the issuing agency and let you know.
Could you please wait a moment?
Yes, yes, I understand
Yes, thank you for waiting, teacher.
If your address is #@, you can get it from your #@affiliated# district office.
#@Affiliation# It only works at the district office

Korean: 네 그리고 기존 여권 잔여 기간이 남아있다면 꼭 지참해서 내방해 주시길 바랍니다
English: Yes, and if you still have validity remaining on your existing passport, please make sure to bring it with you when you visit.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'll tell you more.

Korean: 우선 법정대리인의 신분증과 방문자의 신분증이 필요합니다
English: First, you need the legal representative's ID and the visitor's ID.

Korean: 그리고 신청서는 민원실에 비치되어 있으니 내방하셔서 작성해 주세요
English: And the application form is available at the civil affairs office, so please visit and fill it out.
Yes, your agent ID and visitor ID.

Korean: 최근 육개월 이내에 촬영한 자녀분 여권용 사진 한 장 필요합니다
English: We require one passport photo of your child taken within the last six months.

Korean: 그리고 오염이나 훼손으로 인하여 업무처리가 어려울 수 있어요
English: And it may be difficult to process work due to contamination or damage.

Korean: 여유분으로 한 장 더 준비해 주시면 업무처리에 도움이 되실 듯 합니다
English: If you could prepare one more sheet as a spare, it would be helpful for processing the work.
Yes, a passport photo and some spare ones.

Korean: 법정 대리인의 위임장과 법정 대리인의 인감 도장 날인된 동의서가 필요합니다
English: A power of attorney from a legal representative and a consent form with the legal representative's seal are required.

Korean: 아니 서류를 부모가 다 작성하고 제출하는데도 그게 필요한가요
English: No, is it necessary even if the parents fill out and submit all the documents?

Korean: 네 이촌 이내의 친족이 방문하실 경우 법정대리인의 위임장이 필요합니다
English: If a relative within the 4th degree of kinship visits, a power of attorney from a legal representative is required.

Korean: 제출하는 것만 다른 사람이 하는 건데요 그래도 서류가 필요한가요
English: Do I still need the documents if someone else is just submitting them?

Korean: 공익목적의 벼룩시장에서 활동한 내용을 봉사활동으로 인정할 수 있나요
English: Can my work at a public flea market be recognized as volunteer work?

Korean: 제가 확인 후 말씀드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려주세요
English: I will check and let you know. Please wait a moment.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 확인 후 말씀 주세요 기다릴게요
English: Yes, I understand. Please check and let me know. I'll wait.
Thank you for waiting, teacher.

Korean: 공익을 목적으로 실시한 벼룩시장이라면 인정 가능합니다
English: If it is a flea market held for public interest, it is acceptable.

Korean: 질서유지 행사 보조 등 운영에 참여한 봉사활동은 인정합니다
English: Volunteer work that includes assisting with maintaining order and other operations is acknowledged.

Korean: 다만 물건을 사는 등의 단순 참여활동의 경우는 인정하지 않습니다
English: However, simple participation activities such as purchasing items are not recognized.
Yes, I did public service and order-keeping activities.

Korean: 물품기부 기부금 지원 등을 전제로 한 봉사활동은 인정할 수 없습니다
English: Volunteer work based on donations of goods, donation support, etc. is not recognized.

Korean: 네 그런 거 아녔어요 단순히 질서유지 봉사였습니다
English: No, it wasn't like that. It was just a service to maintain order.

Korean: 네 선생님 그럼 문제 없을 거 같습니다
English: Yes, teacher, then I think there will be no problem.
I see. Thank you for your kind guidance.
Thank you, counselor #@name#. Have a nice day.
Thank you for calling. This is counselor #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Hello, I'm calling to ask you something.

Korean: 네 선생님 말씀 주세요 어떤 일 때문이세요
English: Yes, teacher, please tell me what is the matter?

Korean: 신규교사 발령일 이전 여비 지급 가능 여부 관련해 문의드리려고요
English: I would like to inquire about whether travel expenses can be paid before the new teacher's appointment date.

Korean: 선생님 신규 교사 여비 관련 문의시죠
English: Teacher, I would like to inquire about travel expenses for new teachers.

Korean: 네 삼 월 새학기 시작전 이 월 준비기간 중에 여비 지급이 가능할까요
English: Yes, is it possible to pay for travel expenses during the preparation period this month before the start of the new semester in March?
What is the basis for payment?

Korean: 제가 확인 후 말씀드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려주세요
English: I will check and let you know. Please wait a moment.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 확인 후 말씀 주세요 기다릴게요
English: Yes, I understand. Please check and let me know. I'll wait.
Thank you for waiting, teacher.
Yes, teacher, I can pay for your travel expenses.

Korean: 공무원 여비 규정의 제삼십 조에 따라 여비 지급 가능합니다
English: Travel expenses may be paid in accordance with Article 30 of the Civil Servant Travel Expenses Regulations.
That's great, thanks for checking

Korean: 답변 내용에 대한 추가 설명이 필요하신 경우에는 연락주세요

#@Affiliation# #@Name# Have a nice day
Good morning #@Affiliation# Counselor #@Name#

Korean: 안녕하세요 뭐 좀 물어보고 싶은 게 있어서요

Yes, teacher, please speak comfortably.

Korean: 다름아니라 수능 원서접수시 필요서류 관련해 문의드리려고요
English: I would like to inquire about the documents required for applying for the CSAT.

Korean: 선생님 수능 원서접수 시 서류에 관한 문의시죠
English: Teacher, I have a question about the documents when applying for the CSAT.

Korean: 제가 확인 후 말씀드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려주세요

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 확인 후 말씀 주세요 기다릴게요

Thank you for waiting, teacher.

Korean: 응시원서 여권용 규격 사진 두 매 응시수수료 납부 영수증 한 통이구요
English: Application form, two passport-sized photos, and one receipt for the application fee

Korean: 그리고 원서접수 시 본인 확인용 신분증이 필요합니다
English: And when submitting an application, you will need to show your ID for verification.

Korean: 검정고시 합격자는요 또 뭐 준비해야 할까요
English: What else should I prepare for if I passed the civil service exam?

Korean: 검정고시 합격증명서 한 통 주소 확인 위해 주민등록 초본 준비해주세요
English: Please prepare one copy of the black belt test passing certificate and a copy of your resident registration to confirm your address.
Okay, is there any reference material I can use?

Korean: 네 평가원에서 발표한 대학수학능력시험 시행기본계획이 있습니다
English: Yes, there is a basic plan for implementing the College Scholastic Ability Test announced by the Evaluation Institute.

Korean: 이 자료 보시면 좀 더 자세히 알 수 있으실 거예요
English: If you look at this material, you will be able to learn more in detail.
I see. Thank you for your kind advice.

Korean: 답변 내용에 대한 추가 설명이 필요하신 경우에는 연락주세요

#@Affiliation# #@Name# Have a nice day
Hello, this is counselor #@name# from #@affiliation#
Hello, I'm calling to ask you something.
Yes, teacher, please tell me.
I would like to inquire about the application process for the CSAT for students with overseas education.
I have a question about the teacher.

Korean: 초등학교까지 한국에서 졸업하고 나머지 기간을 미국에서 수학했습니다
English: I graduated from elementary school in Korea and studied in the United States for the rest of my life.

Korean: 한국에서 수능을 보고 정시로 대학을 가고 싶어서요
English: I want to take the college entrance exam in Korea and go to college on time.

Korean: 제가 수능을 볼 수 있나요 필요 서류는 어떤 것이 있나요
English: Can I take the CSAT? What documents are required?

Korean: 제가 확인 후 말씀드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려주세요

Korean: 졸업장 또는 졸업증명서 전 학년 성적증명서 등 학력인정 서류 사본이구요
English: A copy of academic transcripts, diploma or graduation certificate, etc.

Korean: 또한 학교 소재국의 아포스티유 확인서를 발급받아 제출해 주세요

Korean: 모두 다 외국어로 돼 있어도 괜찮은가요

Korean: 외국어로 된 서류는 공증 받은 한글번역문으로 준비해 주세요
English: Please prepare documents in a foreign language with a notarized Korean translation.
In addition, domestic final academic transcripts are also required.

Korean: 담당자 연락처 알려드릴게요 추가 서류 문의해 보시면 될 거 같아요

Yes, please tell me. I will write it down.

I see. Thank you for your kind guidance.
Thank you, counselor #@name#. Have a nice day.
Nice to meet you, I am #@Affiliation#, counselor #@Name#

Korean: 안녕하세요 뭐 좀 물어보고 싶은 게 있어서요

Yes, teacher, please speak comfortably.

Korean: 네 이천이십이 수능 원서접수일정과 접수장소 관련해 문의드리려고요
English: Yes, I would like to inquire about the application schedule and location for the 222nd College Scholastic Ability Test.

Korean: 선생님 수능 원서접수일정과 접수장소에 관한 문의시죠

Korean: 제가 확인 후 말씀드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려주세요

English: The application period is from August 19th to September 3rd this year.
Except Saturdays and public holidays

Korean: 제가 작년에 졸업했는데요 접수는 그럼 어디서 해요

Korean: 졸업자의 경우는 출신 고등학교에서 접수하시면 됩니다
English: If you are a graduate, you can apply through your high school.

Korean: 이사 등 주소지 변경은 혹시 없으세요
English: Are there any changes to your address, such as moving?
Yes, your place of residence is the same
If so, you can do it at your high school.
I see. Thank you for your kind guidance.
Thank you, counselor #@name#. Have a nice day.
Sorry for the late response #@Affiliation# #@Name#

Korean: 안녕하세요 뭐 좀 물어보고 싶은 게 있어서요

Korean: 네 선생님 편히 말씀주세요 어떤 것 때문이시죠

Korean: 다름아니라 졸업증명서 수수료 문의 관련해 문의드리려고요

Teacher, I have a question about the graduation certificate fee.
How much is your graduation certificate fee?

Korean: 제가 확인 후 말씀드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려주세요

English: Okay, then you just need to pay the graduation certificate issuance fee.

Korean: 맞습니다 선생님 국문 영문 각각 천 원입니다 발급비만 내시면 돼요
English: Yes, sir. The Korean and English versions are 1,000 won each. You just need to pay the issuance fee.
Okay, thanks for confirming

Korean: 오늘 하루 행복한 일들만 가득하세요 상담사 #@이름#이었습니다

Thank you for your inquiry. This is counselor #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Hello, I'm calling to ask you something.
Yes, teacher, please tell me.

English: Teacher, I would like to inquire about issuing documents on behalf of my child.

Korean: 제가 확인 후 말씀드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려주세요

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 확인 후 말씀 주세요 기다릴게요
English: Yes, I understand. Please check and let me know. I'll wait.
Thank you for waiting, teacher.
I will tell you the documents you need to prepare.

Korean: 법정대리인 신분증 주민등록등본 또는 가족관계증명서를 준비해 주세요
English: Please prepare your legal representative's ID, resident registration copy, or family relationship certificate.
You must also have a copy of your family register or family relationship certificate.

Korean: 네 정당한 법정대리인임을 입증할 수 있는 서류여야 합니다
English: It must be a document that can prove that you are the rightful legal representative.

Korean: 서류 지참하셔서 가까운 교육기관을 방문하시면 발급할 수 있습니다
English: You can obtain it by visiting a nearby educational institution with the documents.
Okay, thanks for letting me know.
Thank you, counselor #@name#

Korean: 안녕하세요 뭐 좀 물어보고 싶은 게 있어서요

English: I would like to inquire about the standard for calculating the civil servant family allowance.
Teacher, I have a question about civil servant family allowance.

Korean: 예를들어 십 일에 출산하면 한달 금액 전액 지급받을 수 있을까요
English: For example, if I give birth on the 10th day, can I receive the full monthly amount?

Korean: 부양가족 수당은 만약 이십오 일에 주거지 분리하면 이미 받은 수당은요
English: If you separate from your residence on the 25th day, what about the allowance you have already received?

Korean: 제가 확인 후 말씀드리겠습니다 잠시만 기다려주세요

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 확인 후 말씀 주세요 기다릴게요

Thank you for waiting, teacher.

Korean: 월중 부양가족의 변동이 생길 경우 가족수당 전액 지급 가능 여부시죠
English: If there is a change in the number of dependents during the month, is it possible to pay the full amount of the family allowance?
Yes, I'm curious about that, as the counselor said.

Korean: 부양가족 변동이 있는 경우 해당 달분을 전액 지급합니다
English: If there is a change in dependents, the full amount for that month will be paid.

Korean: 다만 본인의 신분변동의 경우는 변동일 기준으로 월액을 일할합니다
English: However, in case of a change in your status, the monthly amount will be calculated based on the date of change.
I see. Thank you for your kind advice.

#@Affiliation# #@Name# Have a nice day

Yes, I'm contacting you about the school bathroom issue.

Korean: 그러시군요 조금 더 자세히 설명 부탁드려요

Korean: 저희가 쾌적한 화장실 조성을 위해 사업을 하고 있어요
English: We are in the business of creating comfortable restrooms.

Korean: 문화개선 사업을 통해 위생용품 구입비 예산을 확충했습니다
English: The budget for purchasing sanitary products has been expanded through the cultural improvement project.
Do you have any other business?

Korean: 예산 교부 후에 편성도 공지하게 합니다
English: After the budget is allocated, the organization will be announced.

Korean: 더 다른 건 없나 보네요 알겠습니다
English: I guess there's nothing else. Okay, I understand.
I will work harder #@Affiliation#
Hello, I am counselor #@Affiliation# and #@Name#

Korean: 중앙 시장 옆 행복로 시민광장 조경 나무가요
English: The trees are in the landscape at the Citizens' Square in Haengbok-ro next to the Central Market.

Korean: 자라면서 지지대 고정 장치로 인해 고사위험이 보여서요

Korean: 네 시민광장에 있는 소나무들을 말씀하시는 건가요
English: Are you talking about the pine trees in your city square?
Yes, by securing a water passage.

Korean: 원활히 자랄 수 있게 해줘야 할 것 같아서요
English: I think we need to let it grow smoothly

Korean: 네 현장 확인 후에 도정 장치를 바꾸거나 다른 걸로 대체하겠습니다
English: Yes, after checking the site, we will change the driving device or replace it with another one.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# #@Name#

Yes, what kind of confirmation are you talking about?
I want to file an objection under the Real Estate Special Act.

Korean: 네 부동산 소유권 이전등기 등에 관한 특별조치법에 의한 확인서요

Yes, can I view that document?

Korean: 이미 제출된 서류는 보증인 등의 개인정보와 관련된 사항이 포함되어 있습니다
English: The documents already submitted contain information related to personal information of the guarantor, etc.

Korean: 따라서 이에 대한 열람이 불가능함을 알려드립니다
English: Therefore, we inform you that it is not possible to view this.
Is it not even possible to read it?
Yes, that's impossible
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Thank you so far #@name#
Nice to meet you, I am #@name# from #@affiliation#

English: I'd like to ask you something about gift tax.
Yes, how may I help you?

Korean: 제가 직장인이고 지방에 공시가격 이 억 정도 아파트를 하나 가지고 있거든요
English: I am an office worker and I own an apartment in the province with a market price of about 200 million won.

Korean: 이걸 제 배우자 명의로 변경하고 싶은데 증여세를 내야 할까요
English: I want to change this to my spouse's name, do I have to pay gift tax?

Korean: 부부간 증여에 경우 십 년 이내에 공제 받은 금액과 합산해 육억 원까지 공제가 됩니다
English: In the case of gifts between spouses, the deduction is limited to 600 million won when combined with the amount received within ten years.

Korean: 그러니 십 년 이내에 증여가 없고 증여대상 아파트 시가가 육억 원 이하면 따로 과세는 없습니다
English: So, if there is no gift within ten years and the market value of the gifted apartment is less than 600 million won, there is no separate taxation.

Korean: 십 년 안에 육 억이 안 넘으면 된다는 거죠 네 알겠습니다
English: You're saying that it shouldn't exceed 600 million in ten years? Okay, I understand.
Yes, do you have any further questions?
No, it's okay, thank you
Yes, thank you. It was #@name# of #@affiliation#
Hello, this is your friendly #@affiliation# counselor #@name#

Yes, is there anything you would like to ask?

English: Can I apply for a change in port unloading freight rates?
I would like to apply for a change in port loading and unloading freight and rates.
They said I just have to fill out an application form

Korean: 예 저희쪽에서 신청서 작성하신 뒤 접수하시면 되는데요

English: I made a fuss last year because of this, and I'm doing it again this year.

Korean: 원래는 군청 관할이 맞으나 면사무소에서 인원 부족하다고 이야기를 했단 이야기시구요
English: Originally, it was under the jurisdiction of the county office, but the story is that the district office said they were short on personnel.

Korean: 지금 내가 지금 정부 기관에 알아봤는데 도청에 얘기해야 된데요
English: I just checked with the government agency and they said I need to talk to the wiretapping department.

Korean: 인원 부족과 관련된 문제는 군청과 통화해야 하는 부분으로 파악됩니다
English: Any issues related to staff shortages are identified as something that needs to be addressed with the county office.

Korean: 사람 부족 문제를 군청에서 통화하는 거 아니에요 도청에서 하는 거 아닌가요
English: Isn't the problem of lack of personnel something that should be discussed at the city hall or the provincial government?

Korean: 말씀하신 인원 충원 문제 관련으로 답변 가능한 도청 직원 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: We will contact the wiretapping staff who can answer your question about the personnel supplementation issue and then provide you with guidance.
Could you please wait a moment?

Korean: 예 그러면 좀 연결 좀 부탁합시다
English: Yes, then please connect me.

Korean: 혹시 실례지만 지역은 어느 지역에 쪽이십니까
English: Excuse me, but what area are you from?
Yesan-gun #@Address# is located at #@Address#
We will guide you after checking with the person in charge.

Korean: 재난대응과에 재해복구사업 담당자 확인되어 바로 연결하겠습니다
English: We will contact the disaster response team and connect you with the person in charge of disaster recovery.
Is this a rural road?

Korean: 그렇죠 인제 진입로가 없는 도로 같은 도로예요
English: Yes, it's a road like a road without an entrance.

Korean: 그걸 자꾸 도로로 사용하려고 거기 사시는 분들이 자꾸 파헤쳐요
English: The people who live there keep digging it up to use it as a road.

Korean: 도로가 아닌데 도로를 만들려고 파헤친다는 말씀이죠
English: You're saying that they're digging up a place that isn't a road to make a road.
Yes, that's right, it's not a road, it's a ditch.

Korean: 넓게 하려고 또랑을 좁히고 도로를 넓히는 거예요
English: They are narrowing the ditches and widening the roads to make them wider.

Korean: 그러면 #@소속#에서 몇 번 와서 그걸 시정 조치를 했어요
English: Then, #@affiliation# came several times and took corrective action.

Korean: 그런데도 일 년에 한 번씩 꼬박꼬박 파재끼더라구요
English: But still, once a year, without fail, they dig it up.
Even though we took corrective action, they keep digging

Korean: 네 그걸 근데 그게 일 년에 한 번씩 이게 나라 땅을 건드리고 있잖아요
English: Yeah, but that's what happens once a year when this thing touches the land of the country.

Korean: 불법인데도 아무 법적인 조치가 없는 건지 한번 물어볼라고요
English: I just wanted to ask if there is any legal action taken even though it is illegal.

Korean: 제가 그러면 도로교통과에 문의 후에 안내를 해드리겠습니다
English: Then I will contact the Road Traffic Department and give you guidance.
Could you please wait a moment?
Could you please check with the Road Traffic Department?
Yes, I will contact the road traffic department.
Yes, I will wait.
Yes, please wait a moment.

Korean: 혹시라도 그러시면 복지과에 피해 내용을 전달 가능한가요
English: If so, can you report the damage to the welfare department?

Korean: 아까 말씀해주신 수해 피해 관련 부서에 내용 전달을 부탁 좀 드려도 될까요
English: Could you please pass this information on to the flood damage department you mentioned earlier?
Yes, I will pass it on to the relevant department.

Korean: 그리고 기초수급자 관련 업무가 맞는지 한번 알아봐 주세요
English: And please check if the work related to basic welfare recipients is correct.

Korean: #@소속# 직원하고 한번 통화를 해봐야 될 것 같은데요
English: #@Affiliation# I think I need to talk to the staff.
Let's check what kind of complaint it is.

Korean: 저희 쪽에서 알 수 있는 방법이 있나요
English: Is there any way for us to find out?

Korean: 민원 내용 확인 후 다시 연락드려도 될까요
English: Can I contact you again after checking the complaint details?
Yes, please contact me again.

Korean: 민원인께서 답변이 없어서 많이 답답해 하시고 계십니다
English: The complainant is very frustrated because there is no response.
What is the phone number you should be contacted by?
We are #@phone number#
What is your name?

Korean: 제 이름은 #@이름#상담사이고 일단 전화 받으신 선생님 성함을 알 수 있을까요
English: My name is #@name# counselor. First of all, can you tell me the name of the teacher who answered the phone?
Yes, my name is #@name#
Yes, then please check.
Yes, I will check and call you back.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Hello, this is the Culture and Arts Team.

Korean: 그러십니까 처음에 전화를 받으신 분이 담당부서로 연결해 주신다고 했는데요
English: Is that so? The person who first answered the phone said he would connect me to the department in charge.
Send it to the department in charge

Korean: 현재 그러시면 기초수급자 관련해서는 어느 부서와 통화를 해야 되나요
English: If so, which department should I contact for basic livelihood security benefits?

Korean: 단순히 기초수급자 관련이면 저희 복지과에서 할 테고요
English: If it's simply related to basic livelihood security recipients, our welfare department will handle it.

Korean: 수해 관련해서 하면 다른 과가 아닐까 싶은데 제가 그 부분에 대해서는 잘 몰라서요
English: I think it might be a different department if it's related to flood damage, but I don't know much about that part.

Korean: 그러시면 혹시 내용 전달 부탁드려도 될까요
English: If so, could you please convey the details?

Korean: 네 내용 전달이요 그럼 제가 내용을 한번 적어 볼게요
English: Okay, I'll convey the content. Then I'll write down the content.

Korean: 네 현재 태안에 거주를 하시는 #@이름#님이십니다 민원인 연락처는 #@전번#입니다
English: Yes, you are #@name# currently residing in Taean. Your contact information is #@phone number#.

Korean: #@소속#와 #@소속#에 여러 번 문의를 하였으나 해결이 되지 않았습니다
English: I have contacted #@affiliation# and #@affiliation# several times, but the issue has not been resolved.
So you called us
Because the complainant wants to be contacted.

Korean: 담당 #@소속#에 민원을 넣었는데 해결이 되지 않으셨다고 합니다
English: I filed a complaint with the person in charge #@affiliation#, but they said it wasn't resolved.

Korean: 그 부분이 해결이 되지 않았다고요 답변을 받지 못했다는 말씀이신가요
English: Are you saying that part wasn't resolved and you didn't get an answer?
Yes, that's right, you didn't get an answer.

Korean: 저희 #@소속#에 답변을 해주라고 지금 재차 요구하시는 거죠
English: You are now again asking us to respond to #@affiliation#
Yes, I would like to request a response from #@affiliation#

Korean: 이 부분에 대해서 그럼 담당자를 찾아봐야 될 것 같은데요
English: I think I'll have to find the person in charge for this part.

Korean: 제가 이 부분에 관해 잘 몰라서요
English: I don't know much about this part
Yes, hello, this is #@affiliation#

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 #@전번# #@소속# #@이름#입니다 한 가지 내용 전달차 전화드렸습니다
English: Yes, hello. This is #@Phone# #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'm calling to tell you something.

Korean: 현재 태안 원북면에 거주하시는 #@이름# 님이 기초수급자이심에도 불구하구요
English: Even though #@Name#, who currently resides in Wonbuk-myeon, Taean, is a basic livelihood security recipient,

Korean: 그러면요 그쪽 부서로 저희가 연결드려 볼게요
English: Then we will connect you to that department.

Korean: 네 실례지만 전화받으신 교환실이고요 그 담당부서가 따로 있어요 잠시만요
English: Excuse me, but this is the switchboard you called from. There is a separate department in charge of that. Just a moment.
Yes, I understand. Please connect me. Thank you.
Hello, what's going on?
Hello, this is #@Phone# #@Affiliation# #@Name#. I'm calling to tell you something.
#@Name#, who currently lives in Wonbuk-myeon, Taean, is a basic livelihood security recipient.

Korean: 수해 피해로 원북 #@소속#와 #@소속#에 문의를 하였으나 해결이 안됐습니다
English: I contacted Wonbuk #@affiliation# and #@affiliation# about the flood damage, but it was not resolved.
So, you called #@affiliation#

Korean: 저희 #@소속# 측에서 #@소속#에 내용 전달 원하셔서 전화를 드렸습니다
English: We, #@Affiliation#, called to convey the information to #@Affiliation#.

Korean: 이 부분에 관해서 혹시 알고 계시는 부분 있으십니까
English: Do you know anything about this part?

Korean: 아니요 어떤 거 때문에 그러시는 거죠
English: No, why are you doing that?
I have filed several complaints to #@affiliation# and #@affiliation# due to flood damage.

Korean: 그런데 아직까지 해결이 되지 않았다고 저희 쪽으로 전화를 주셨습니다
English: But you called us and said the issue hasn't been resolved yet.

Korean: 어떤 민원인지 수해피해를 입으신 부분입니까 수해복구를 원하시는 부분입니까
English: What is the complaint? Is this the area that was damaged by flooding? Is this the area that you want to repair?
Yes, I want to restore the damage.

Korean: 지방 도로 점용 허가 없이 도랑 및 하천을 훼손한다는 부분 맞으신지요
English: Is it true that you are damaging ditches and rivers without a permit for occupying local roads?

Korean: 혹시 위치를 좀 정확히 알 수 있을까요
English: Could you please tell me the exact location?
Is this address #@Geumsan-gun, Chungcheongnam-do?
Yes, the river behind #@address#
#@Address# Is the river behind it damaged?

Korean: 예 하천 훼손 및 도로 훼손이지
English: Yes, river damage and road damage.

Korean: 근데 그게 일 년에 한 번씩 계속 파헤쳐요
English: But that keeps getting dug up once a year

Korean: 삼 년 동안 #@소속#에서 담당자가 돈을 먹고 그렇게 묵인을 해주는 건지요
English: For three years, has the person in charge at #@affiliation# been taking money and turning a blind eye to it?

Korean: 도대체 알 수가 없어가지고 내가 지금 답답해서 물어보는 거예요
English: I don't know what to do, so I'm asking because I'm frustrated.
I bet you were very frustrated, teacher.

Korean: #@소속# 가서 민원실 가서 접수를 해야 되는건지 어디에 접수를 해야 되는 건지요
English: #@Affiliation# Should I go to the civil affairs office to file a complaint or where should I file a complaint?

Korean: 아니면 기자를 불러서 해야 되는 건지요
English: Or should I call a reporter and do it?

Korean: 조치가 안 되는 건 왜 조치가 안되는지 그 이유가 알고 싶어서 그러는 거예요
English: The reason why no action is taken is because I want to know the reason why no action is taken.

Korean: 네 선생님 제가 말씀해주신 부분 잘 알겠습니다
English: Yes, teacher, I understand what you said.

Korean: 담당부서 담당자 확인 후에 선생님께 바로 연락을 드리도록 하겠습니다
English: After checking with the person in charge of the department, we will contact the teacher immediately.
Do you have any further questions?
No, no questions, thank you
Yes, I will contact you right away. It was #@Affiliation# #@Name#
I contacted #@affiliation#, teacher.

Korean: 말씀해주신 도로가 지방도일 경우에는 종합건설사업소에서 확인이 가능합니다
English: If the road you mentioned is a local road, you can check it at the general construction office.

Korean: 하지만 마을에 있는 도로인 경우에는 시장 군수 사항입니다
English: But if it is a road in a village, it is a matter for the mayor and county governor.

Korean: 그래서 해당 지역인 #@소속#으로 문의를 주셔야 정확한 답변이 가능합니다
English: So, you need to contact the relevant region #@affiliation# to get an accurate answer.

Korean: 관할이 도청 관할하는 데가 없다는 얘기예요 도청에서는요
English: The wiretapping department is saying that there is no jurisdiction over the wiretapping department.

Korean: 지방도로일 경우에는 담당하는 부분으로 전달을 받았습니다
English: In the case of local roads, it was passed on to the responsible department.
Are you sure this is a local road?

Korean: 네 그게 지방도로인데요 그런데 구청에 백날 얘기를 해도 시정이 안되니까
English: Yes, that's a local road, but even if I complain to the district office, they won't fix it.

Korean: 네 혹시 구거라고 말씀을 해주셨는데 구거가 또랑 옆에 하천도로가 있는 거죠
English: Yes, you mentioned Guger, but Guger is next to the river road.

Korean: 근데 그걸 #@소속#에 백날 얘기를 해도 시정이 안되고 있어요
English: But even if I tell #@affiliation# about it for 100 days, it is not being corrected

Korean: 정부청사 민원실에다가 얘기를 해야 되는 건지 모르겠어요
English: I don't know if I should talk to the government office's civil affairs office.
Okay, then I'll give it a try
If you don't accept it even in your wiretapping

Korean: 네 #@소속#에 있는 도랑 옆 하천 도로훼손 관련 문의 맞으십니까
English: Yes, is this the inquiry regarding the damage to the river road next to the ditch in #@affiliation#?

Korean: 예 자꾸 도로로 사용하려고 근디 도로 전용은 허가를 내고 하면은 상관이 없어요
English: Yes, they keep trying to use it as a road, but if they get permission to use it as a road, it doesn't matter.

Korean: 그런데 허가가 없는 상태에서 일 년에 한 번씩 파고 있어요
English: But they dig once a year without permission.

Korean: 삼 년 동안 그렇게 계속 파헤치는 거예요 그런데도 아무런 조치가 없어요
English: They've been digging like that for three years and still nothing has been done.

Korean: 도로점용 허가 없이 도랑이나 하천을 훼손한다는 부분 맞으십니까
English: Is it true that you are damaging ditches or rivers without a road use permit?

Korean: 예 그런데도 아무런 법적인 조치도 없고 시청도 안되고요
English: Yes, but there is no legal action and it is not being watched.

Korean: 그걸 도대체 상부기관 어디한테 해야 되는 건지 도청 민원실에 해야 되는 건지 해서요
English: I'm wondering if I should report this to the higher-level government agency or the wiretapping civil affairs office.

Korean: 정부청사 민원실에 해야 되는 건지 제가 확인하는데 시간이 조금 더 지연이 될 듯합니다
English: I'm checking to see if I should go to the government office's civil affairs office, but it seems like it'll take a little more time.

Korean: 확인 후에 선생님 성함과 연락처 남겨주시면 바로 전화를 드리도록 하겠습니다
English: After checking, please leave your teacher's name and contact information and we will call you right away.
Yes, my name is #@Phone# #@Name#
Have you contacted #@affiliation#?

Korean: 네 #@소속#에 몇 번을 했는데 일 년에 한 번씩 파는데도 아무 조치가 없더라고요
English: Yes, I've done it several times to #@affiliation#, but even though I sell it once a year, no action has been taken.

Korean: 그래서 그거 도대체 일 년에 한 번씩 파헤쳐도 되는 건가
English: So is it okay to dig that up once a year?

Korean: 한번 물어볼라고 개네도 아무 조치가 없더라고요
English: I asked once, but they didn't take any action.
Are you saying that there is no action?

Korean: 네 일 년에 한 번씩 파헤쳐도 그럼 또다시 와서 원상복귀시킨다고 합니다
English: They say that even if you dig it up once a year, they will come back and restore it to its original state.

Korean: 그럼 또 일 년에 한 번 또 파헤쳐놓고 그래요
English: Then we dig it up again once a year
Yes, it must have been very inconvenient.

Korean: 제가 이 부분 확인을 해보겠습니다. 잠시 기다려주시겠습니까
English: I'll check this part. Could you please wait a moment?
Yes I will wait. Thank you.

Korean: 기다려주셔서 감사합니다 말씀해주신 도로와 하천은 각각 부서가 따로 있습니다
English: Thank you for waiting. The roads and rivers you mentioned each have separate departments.
Which way should I direct you?

Korean: 하천 관련에서는 제가 확인을 해보니 도부서에는 하천 안전과가 확인이 됩니다
English: Regarding rivers, I checked and found that there is a river safety department in the provincial government.
And you can also check it at the general construction business office.

Korean: 예 시골 도로지 시골 뻘탕물이지 뻘탕 골짜기 물이요
English: Yes, it's a country road, it's a country muddy water, it's muddy valley water.
Is this a question about ditches?

Korean: 그쵸 또랑 큰 또랑인데 그걸 자꾸 파헤치고 사용할라고 또랑을 자꾸 좁히더라고요
English: Yes, it's a big ditch, but they keep digging it up and trying to use it, so they keep narrowing it.

Korean: 사용할라고 해도 하천도로는 사용허가도 안 나는 곳이에요
English: Even if you want to use it, it is a place where you don't even get a permit to use the river road.

Korean: 근데 왜 일 년에 한번씩 파헤치길래 너무 짜증이 나더라고요
English: But I was so annoyed that they only dug it up once a year

Korean: #@소속#에다가 그거 담당한테 백날 얘기를 해도 실행이 안돼요
English: #@Affiliation# Even if I tell the person in charge about it for 100 days, it doesn't work out

Korean: 그래서 한번 물어볼려구 법적인 제재가 없나 하구요
English: So I wanted to ask if there are any legal sanctions.

Korean: 네 그럼 저희가 한 번 확인 해 보고 연락 드리겠습니다 감사합니다
English: Yes, we will check it and contact you. Thank you.
Nice to meet you, I am #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 예 수고하십니다 건축과에 구거 담당 좀 부탁하는데요
English: Yes, thank you for your hard work. I would like to ask the architecture department to take charge of the old building.
Do you have any questions about Guger?
I would like to inquire about the road and river
Is this an inconvenience inquiry?

Korean: 예 한번 뭐 좀 여쭤 볼려구요
English: Yes, I have something to ask you.

Korean: 선생님 도로 하천 관련에서도 각 업무마다 담당자가 나뉘어집니다
English: Teacher, in relation to roads and rivers, each task is assigned to a different person.

Korean: 조금만 구체적으로 말씀해주시면 제가 담당자분 확인 후에 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: If you could be a little more specific, I will check with the person in charge and then give you guidance.
I heard you were in charge of the old building
It is difficult for the person in charge to confirm separately

Korean: 그럼 하천 하고 도로하고 있잖아요 그걸 자꾸 파헤치고 그라는데요
English: Then, they keep digging up rivers and roads.

Korean: 파헤치는걸 누구한테 물어봐야 되나 해갖고 연락드렸어요
English: I was wondering who I should ask to dig into this, so I contacted you.

Korean: 도로와 하천은 각각 부서가 나눠지고 있습니다
English: Roads and rivers are each divided into departments.

Korean: 말씀해주신 도로 하천이 어느 도로이고 어느 하천인지 알 수 있을까요
English: Could you tell me which road and which river you mentioned?

Korean: 어떤 도로 나 하천인지 지방하천인지 말 하면 되나요
English: Can you tell me which road, river or local river it is?
Is this a complaint regarding return shipping?
Yes, I have a question regarding the return.
Could you please tell me which area it is?
I'd like to contact Geumsan

Korean: 네 그럼 확인 하고 연결 해 드리겠습니다
English: Okay, then I'll check and connect you.

Korean: 지방 도로 점용 허가 없이 도랑 및 하천을 훼손한다는 부분 맞으신지요 혹시 위치를 좀 정확히 알 수 있을까요
English: Are you correct about the part about damaging ditches and rivers without a permit for occupying local roads? Could you tell me the exact location?
Is this address #@Geumsan-gun, Chungcheongnam-do?
Yes, it's the river behind number 1.
Is the river behind the first street damaged?

Korean: 예 하천 훼손 및 도로 훼손이지 근데 그게 일년에 한번씩 계속 파헤쳐요
English: Yes, river damage and road damage, but they keep digging it up once a year.

Korean: 삼년 동안 금산군에서 담당자가 돈을 먹고 그렇게 묵인을 해주는건지 도대체 알 수가 없어가지고요
English: I can't understand why the person in charge of Geumsan County took money and turned a blind eye to it for three years.

Korean: 내가 지금 답답해서 물어보는 거에요 그렇지 않으면은 세종시 가서 민원실가서 접수를 해야 되는건지 어디가서 접수를 해야 되는건지 해서요
English: I'm asking because I'm frustrated right now. Should I go to Sejong City and go to the civil affairs office to file a complaint? Or where should I go to file a complaint?

Korean: 그렇지 않으면 기자를 불러서 해야 되는건지 조치가 안되는 건 왜 조치가 안되는지 그 이유가 알고 싶어서 그러는 거에요
English: Otherwise, I'm calling a reporter and asking why things aren't being done. I'm asking because I want to know why things aren't being done.

Korean: 네 선생님 제가 말씀해주신 부분 담당부서 담당자 확인 후에 선생님께 바로 연락을 드리도록 하겠습니다 혹시 더 다른 문의사항 있으십니까
English: Yes, teacher. I will contact you right away after checking with the person in charge of the department you mentioned. Do you have any other questions?
No, there is no problem, thank you
Yes, I will contact you right away. It was #@Affiliation# #@Name#

Korean: 제가 도청 도로교통과에 문의를 해보니 선생님께서 말씀해주신 도로가 지방도일 경우에는 종합건설사업소에서 확인이 가능하신데요
English: I asked the wiretapping road traffic department and they said that if the road you mentioned is a provincial road, it can be checked at the general construction business office.

Korean: 마을에 있는 도로인 경우에는 시장군수 사항으로 해당 지역인 금천구청으로 문의를 주셔야 정확한 답변이 가능합니다
English: If it is a road in a village, you must contact the Geumcheon-gu Office, which is the mayor's office, to get an accurate answer.

Korean: 관할이 도청 관할 하는데가 없다는 얘기에요 도청에서는요
English: The wiretapping department is saying that there is no jurisdiction over the wiretapping department.

Korean: 지방도로일 경우에는 담당하는 부분으로 전달을 받았습니다 혹시 지방도로가 맞으십니까
English: If it is a local road, I have received information from the responsible department. Is it a local road?

Korean: 네 그게 지방도로인데요 그런데 구청에 백날 얘기를 해도 시정이 안되니까
English: Yes, that's a local road, but even if I complain to the district office, they won't fix it.

Korean: 네 혹시 구거라고 말씀을 해주셨는데 혹시 구거가 또랑 옆에 하천도로가 있는 거죠
English: Yes, you mentioned Guger, but is there a river road next to Guger?

Korean: 근데 그걸 금산구청에 백날 얘기를 해도 시정이 안되니까 구청이 아니면은 정부청사 어디다 얘기를 해야 되는건지요
English: But since even if I bring up the issue to the Geumsan-gu Office, no action will be taken, if not the district office, where else should I bring up the issue, to the government office?

Korean: 그냥 정부청사 민원실에다가 얘기를 해야 되는건지요
English: Should I just go to the government office's civil affairs office and talk to them?
Okay, then I'll give it a try
If your wiretapping doesn't accept it either

Korean: 네 금산군에 있는 도랑 옆 하천 도로훼손 관련 문의 맞으십니까
English: Yes, are you referring to the inquiry regarding the damage to the river road next to the ditch in Geumsan-gun?

Korean: 예 또랑하고 도로를 훼손하는건지 또랑을 삼분의 일정도 줄어들어요
English: Yes, it damages the road and reduces the width of the road by about a third.

Korean: 자꾸 도로로 사용할라고 근디 도로전용은 허가를 내고 하면은 상관이 없는데요
English: They keep saying they'll use it as a road, but if they get permission for road use, it doesn't matter.

Korean: 허가가 없는 상태에서 일년에 한번씩 삼년 동안 그렇게 계속 파헤치는 거에요 그런데도 아무런 조치가 없어요
English: They keep digging like that once a year for three years without a permit, and yet no action is taken.

Korean: 도로점용 허가 없이 도랑이나 하천을 훼손한다는 부분 맞으십니까
English: Is it true that you are damaging ditches or rivers without a road use permit?

Korean: 예 그런데도 아무런 법적인 조치도 없고 시청도 안되고 해서요
English: Yes, but there is no legal action and it is not being watched.

Korean: 그걸 도대체 상부기관 어디한테 해야 되는건지 도청 민원실에 해야 되는건지 해서요
English: I was wondering if I should report this to the higher-level government agency or the wiretapping civil affairs office.

Korean: 그러시면 선생님 정부청사 민원실에 해야 되는건지 제가 확인하는데 시간이 조금 더 지연이 될 듯 합니다
English: If that's the case, I'll have to check with the government office's civil affairs office, but it seems like it'll take a little more time.

Korean: 확인 후에 선생님 성함과 연락처 남겨주시면 바로 전화를 드리도록 하겠습니다
English: After checking, please leave your teacher's name and contact information and we will call you right away.
Yes, my name is #@Phone# #@Name#
Have you contacted Geumsan-gu Office?

Korean: 네 금산구청에 몇 번을 했는데 일년에 한 번씩 파재끼는데도 아무 조치가 없더라구요
English: Yes, I've been to Geumsan-gu Office several times, but even though I file a complaint once a year, they haven't done anything about it.

Korean: 그래서 그거 도대체 일년에 한번씩 파헤쳐도 되는건가 한번 물어볼라구 개네도 아무 조치가 없더라구요
English: So I was going to ask if it was okay to dig it up once a year, but they didn't do anything about it.

Korean: 일년에 한번씩 파헤쳐도 그럼 또 다시 와서 원상복귀 시킨다고 하고 그럼 또 일년에 한번 또 파헤쳐놓고요
English: Even if you dig it up once a year, they say they'll come back and restore it to its original state, and then they dig it up again once a year.
Yes, it must have been very inconvenient.

Korean: 제가 이 부분 확인을 해보니 현재 말씀해주신 도로와 하천은 각각 부서가 나눠지고 있습니다
English: I checked this part and the roads and rivers you mentioned are each divided into departments.
Which way should I direct you?

Korean: 하천 관련에서는 제가 확인을 해보니 도부서에는 하천안전과가 확인이 되고 종합건설사업소에서도 확인이 가능합니다
English: Regarding rivers, I checked and found that the river safety department of the provincial government and the general construction business office can also confirm.

Korean: 예 시골 도로지 시골 뻘탕물이지 뻘탕 골짜기물이요
English: Yes, it's a country road, a country muddy water, a muddy valley water.
Is this a question about ditches?

Korean: 그쵸 또랑 큰 또랑인데 그걸 자꾸 파헤치고 자꾸 사용할라고 또랑을 자꾸 좁히더라구요
English: Yes, it's a big ditch, but they keep digging it up and using it, so they keep narrowing it down.

Korean: 사용할라고 하천도로를 사용허가도 안 나고 근데 왜 일년에 한번씩 파헤치길래 금산구청에다가 구거담당한테 백날 얘기를 해도 실행이 안돼요
English: I don't even have a permit to use the river road, so why do they dig it up once a year? I've been talking to the person in charge of the Geumsan-gu Office about it for 100 days, but nothing happens.

Korean: 그래서 한번 물어볼려구 법적인 재제가 없나 해서요
English: So I wanted to ask if there were any legal sanctions.
By the way, is this a rural road?

Korean: 그렇죠 인제 진입로가 없는 도로같은 도로인데 그걸 자꾸 도로로 사용 할려고 거기 사시는 분들이 자꾸 파헤쳐 갖고 또랑을 좁히고 도로를 넓히는 거에요
English: Yes, it is a road with no access road, but the people living there keep digging it up to use it as a road, narrowing the ditch and widening the road.

Korean: 그러면 금산구청에서 몇 번 와서 그걸 시정 조치를 했어요 근데 일년에 한번씩 꼬박꼬박 파재끼더라구요
English: Then, Geumsan-gu Office came several times to take corrective action, but they kept digging up the land once a year.

Korean: 그걸 근데 그게 일년에 한번씩 이게 나라 땅을 건드려도 아무 법적인 조치가 없는건지 한번 물어볼라고
English: But I'm going to ask you once a year if there is no legal action if this touches national land.

Korean: 제가 그러면 도로교통과에 문의 후에 안내를 해드리겠습니다 잠시만 더 기다려 주시겠습니까
English: Then I will contact the Road Traffic Department and give you some more information. Could you please wait a moment?
Yes, I will wait.

Korean: 네 선생님 오래 기다리게 해드려 정말 죄송합니다
English: Yes, teacher, I'm really sorry for keeping you waiting for so long.
Nice to meet you, I am #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 예 수고하십니다 건축과에 구거 담당 좀 부탁 하는데요
English: Yes, thank you for your hard work. I would like to ask the architecture department to take charge of the old building.
Do you have any questions about Guger?
I would like to inquire about the road and river
Is this an inconvenience inquiry?

Korean: 예 한번 뭐 좀 여쭤 볼려구요
English: Yes, I have something to ask you.

Korean: 선생님 도로 하천 관련에서도 각 업무 마다 담당자가 나뉘어 집니다
English: Teacher, in relation to roads and rivers, each task is assigned a different person.

Korean: 업무내용을 조금만 구체적으로 말씀해주시면 제가 담당자 분 확인 후에 안내 해 드리겠습니다
English: If you could tell me a little more about the job description, I will check with the person in charge and then give you guidance.
I heard you were in charge of the old building
It is difficult for the person in charge to confirm separately

Korean: 그럼 하천하고 도로하고 있잖아요 그걸 자꾸 파헤치고 그라는데 그걸 누구한테 물어봐야 되나 해갖고
English: Then, there are rivers and roads, and they keep digging them up, so who should I ask about that?

Korean: 도로와 하천은 각각 부서가 나눠지고 있습니다
English: Roads and rivers are each divided into departments.

Korean: 말씀해주신 도로하천이 어느 도로이고 어느 하천인지 알 수 있을까요
English: Could you tell me which road and which river you mentioned?
Is it a road, river or local river?
Is this a complaint regarding return shipping?
Yes, I have a question regarding the return.
Could you please tell me which area you are in?
I would like to contact Geumsan
Hello, this is counselor #@name#

Korean: 학교 매점을 운영하는데요 재난기간 중에 문을 못 열었잖아요
English: I run a school store, but it was closed during the disaster.
Then will you give me a discount on the usage fee?
I will check for you about the fee reduction.

Korean: 문을 못 연 기간 만큼 사용료 감면이나 기간 연장이 가능합니다
English: You can get a discount or extension of the usage fee for the period of time you were unable to open the door.

Korean: 기간 연장이요 운영 중단한 날짜만큼 더 연장해주는거에요
English: It's an extension of the period. It's an extension of the period for the number of days the operation was suspended.

Korean: 맞습니다 사용료 감면이나 기간 연장 중 선택하실 수 있어요
English: Yes, you can choose between a reduced fee or an extended period.

Korean: 그럼 매점 내에 있는 자판기요 그건 뭐 지원 해주는게 있나요
English: Then, what about the vending machines inside the store? Does that provide any support?

Korean: 재난 기간 내에 사용요율을 인하해 드리고 있습니다
English: We are offering reduced rates during the disaster period.
How long does the disaster period last?

Korean: 이천이십일년 이월 이십일일부터 십이월 삼십일일까지 입니다
English: From February 21st to December 31st, 2021
How much will the usage rates be reduced?
Originally reduced from 5 percent to 1 percent
Okay, thanks for checking
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Hello, this is counselor #@name#

Korean: 기간제 교사 관련 문의 좀 드리려고 하는데요
English: I would like to ask some questions about temporary teachers.
Do you have any questions about temporary teachers?

Korean: 기간제 교사 연구학교 경력이 인정 되나요
English: Is my experience as a temporary teacher recognized?
Please wait, I'll check for you.
Research school experience is recognized

Korean: 그런 근거 같은게 어디에 나와 있나요
English: Where is there any evidence for that?
It is in the #@affiliation# personnel practice manual #@number# of 2016
So how are the scores calculated?
Add 0 points every month
What if it's less than a month?

Korean: 일개월 미만일 경우는 일일 당 영점 영영영삼점입니다
English: If it is less than a month, it is 0 points per day.
Okay, thanks for checking
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Hello, this is counselor #@name#

Korean: 검정고시 합격자인데요 수능 원서를 어디에 접수해야 되요
English: I passed the GED exam. Where should I submit my CSAT application?
Please wait, I'll check for you.

Korean: 주소지 관할 #@소속#에 수능 원서 접수하시면 됩니다
English: You can submit your college entrance exam application to the #@affiliation# in your jurisdiction.

Korean: 주소 말씀드리면 관할이 어딘지 확인 가능한가요
English: If I tell you the address, can you check where the jurisdiction is?
Yes, please tell me the address.
The address is #@address#, Busan
You can submit the address to #@affiliation#
So when is the application period?

Korean: 팔월 십구일에서 구월 삼일까지입니다 토일요일 제외구요
English: From August 19th to September 3rd, excluding Saturdays and Sundays.
What time is it?
From nine a.m. to five p.m.
Okay, thanks for checking
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Hello, this is counselor #@name#
I have a question regarding gifted education institutions.
Could you please give me some specific details?

Korean: 영재교육기관 강사 지원 자격이 어떻게 되나요
English: What are the qualifications for applying to be a lecturer at a gifted education institution?
Can I give you some information on the eligibility requirements? Just a moment.
Have completed more than thirty hours of gifted education training

Korean: 일년 이내 수료 가능한 초중등 교사로서 학교장 추천을 받은자 입니다
English: I am a primary and secondary school teacher who can complete the course within one year and has been recommended by the school principal.
What is gifted education job training?
This is a training course opened by #@affiliation# or #@affiliation# gifted education training institute.
Okay, are there any other qualifications for support?

Korean: 전문대학 이상 교육기관의 전임강사 이상의 교수이어야 하구요
English: Must be a full-time professor or higher at an educational institution higher than a junior college

Korean: 기타 영역별 전문가 또는 영재교육 학습지도 능력이 뛰어난자 입니다
English: A person who is an expert in another field or has excellent teaching skills in gifted education
Okay, thanks for checking
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Hello, this is counselor #@name#
I would like to ask about Meister High School.
Do you have any questions?
What exactly is Meister High School?
In connection with specialized industrial demand in promising fields

Korean: 예비 마이스터를 양상하는 특수 목적 고등학교 입니다
English: It is a special purpose high school that trains prospective masters.

Korean: 마이스터 고등학교에 대한 정보 나와있는데가 있나요
English: Is there any information about Meister High School?
There is a Meistergo portal site
Then please tell me the site address
The site address is #@URL#

Korean: 여기에 자세한 내용 같은게 나와 있나요
English: Are there any details here?
Yes, you can check it out
Okay, I'll check it out.
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Hello, this is counselor #@name#
I have a question about the college entrance exam.
Do you have any questions regarding the college entrance exam?

Korean: 고입전형 자료는 어디서 볼 수 있을까요
English: Where can I find information on college entrance exams?

Korean: 각 시도교육청에서 확인 하실 수 있는데요 혹시 보셨나요
English: You can check it at each city/provincial office of education. Have you seen it?

Korean: 아니요 교육청은 확인 안 해봤는데 그게 매년 달라지지 않나요
English: No, I haven't checked with the Board of Education, but doesn't it change every year?
