Korean: 선생님 죄송하지만 이 부분 #@소속# 감사과에 민원 넣어보셨나요
English: I'm sorry, teacher, but have you filed a complaint with the #@affiliation# audit department regarding this matter?

Korean: 아니요 그 쪽에는 해보지 않았고 우선 도청에다가 민원 넣었어요
English: No, I haven't tried it on your side. I filed a complaint with the wiretapping office first.

Korean: 여기에 얘기해도 해결 안되면 신문고에라도 얘기해야겠다 싶네요
English: If talking about it here doesn't solve the problem, I think I'll have to talk about it in the newspaper.

Korean: 왜 제가 직접 이렇게 발품 팔아서 보상을 청구해야하는지 모르겠네요
English: I don't know why I have to go through all this trouble to claim compensation.

Korean: 선생님 그러시면 우선 #@소속# 감사과로 민원 넣어주실 수 있나요
English: Teacher, if that's the case, could you first file a complaint with the #@affiliation# audit department?

Korean: 소속 공무원의 업무 처리에 대해 감사 업무를 담당하고 있습니다
English: I am in charge of auditing the work of affiliated public officials.

Korean: 그러면 제가 일단 거기로 먼저 연락을 드릴까요
English: Then, shall I contact you there first?

Korean: 군청 감사과로 문의하셔서 민원 제기해주시는 것이 좋을 듯 합니다
English: I think it would be best to contact the county office's audit department and file a complaint.
Okay, then please connect me to the county audit department.

Korean: 네 선생님 제가 #@소속# 대표번호로 바로 연결하겠습니다
English: Yes, teacher, I will connect you directly to the representative number of #@affiliation#
Yes, thank you. Thank you for your hard work.
Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 공사현장에서 사고 났다고 한 사람인데요 통화 괜찮으세요
English: Yes, I'm the person who said there was an accident at the construction site. Is it okay for me to talk to you?

Korean: 네 방금 전에 말씀 주셨던 거 이어서 말씀해주시겠어요
English: Could you please continue what you said just now?

Korean: 네 저는 군청에 민원 제기하면 해결책을 내주실 줄 알고 통화를 했거든요
English: Yes, I called the city hall because I thought they would come up with a solution if I filed a complaint.

Korean: 그런데 사고 경위를 들으시더니 얼마나 다치셨나 물어보지도 않더라구요
English: But after hearing the details of the accident, he didn't even ask how badly I was injured.

Korean: 그러면서 저한테 대뜸 군청에는 보험이나 보상 대책이 없다고 하더라구요
English: Then he told me out of the blue that the county office had no insurance or compensation measures.

Korean: 근데 제가 그런 얘기를 그분한테 들을려고 전화를 한 게 아니거든요
English: But I didn't call him to hear that story.

Korean: 솔직히 그런 대책이 있던 없던 그거는 저하고는 상관이 없는 얘기잖아요
English: Honestly, whether there was such a measure or not, it has nothing to do with me.

Korean: 군청이 어떤 안전 조치나 표시도 없는 위험한 공사현장을 방치한거잖아요
English: The city government left the construction site unsafe without any safety measures or signs.

Korean: 그걸 무방비 상태로 해놓은 상태에서 인도가 따로 있던 것도 아니고요
English: It's not like India was left defenseless.
Yes, teacher, please continue speaking.

Korean: 밤이라 보이지도 않았고 그래서 제가 넘어졌던 거거든요
English: It was night so I couldn't see and that's why I fell.

Korean: 그런데 얼만큼 다쳤냐도 안 물어보고 오히려 저한테 왜 앞으로 넘어졌녜요
English: But instead of asking me how badly I was hurt, he asked me why I fell forward.

Korean: 그러고서는 군에서는 어떤 보상을 해줄 수 없다고 하더라구요
English: Then the military said they couldn't give any compensation.

Korean: 제가 알아서 국가 기관에 보상 받는 곳에 연락하라고 하시더라고요
English: He told me to contact the government agency that provides compensation.

Korean: 그렇게 얘기하는 사람하고 무슨 얘기를 더 하겠어요
English: What more can I say to someone who talks like that?
That's why I contacted you directly at #@affiliation#

Korean: 선생님 밤 중에 갑작스런 사고로 얼마나 상심이 크셨습니까
English: Teacher, how heartbroken were you by the sudden accident in the middle of the night?

Korean: 제가 이 부분 민원실로 연결해드릴텐데 한번 상담 받아보시겠습니까
English: I'll connect you to the civil affairs office for this section. Would you like to come in for a consultation?

Korean: 네 그러면 민원실에다가 상담 받아볼게요 감사합니다
English: Yes, then I will go to the civil affairs office and ask for advice. Thank you.
Nice to meet you, this is #@Affiliation#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 수고하십니다 저는 서울에 살고 있는 #@이름#이라고 하고요
English: Yes, hello. Thank you for your hard work. My name is #@name# and I live in Seoul.

Korean: 제가 이주 전에 충남 태안 #@소속# 쪽으로 답사 차 갔었는데요
English: Before I moved, I went to Taean, South Chungcheong Province, to do some research.

Korean: #@소속#에서 도로를 공사하고 있는데 관리소홀로 제가 많이 다쳤습니다
English: #@Affiliation# is doing road construction and I got hurt a lot due to management negligence.

Korean: 그래서 #@소속#으로 연락을 했고 그 공사 업자분하고도 통화를 했습니다
English: So I contacted #@affiliation# and spoke to the construction contractor.

Korean: 공사 업자분께서 처음에는 잘 무마를 해줄 것처럼 얘기를 하셨어요
English: At first, the construction company said they would cover it up.

Korean: 제가 사고났을 당시에 사진도 보내드렸었고 내용도 설명도 해드렸었고요
English: When I had the accident, I sent you photos and explained the details.

Korean: 그 다음에 사고가 밤 아홉 시에 났는데 지구대랑 해경에 신고도 했어요
English: Then the accident happened at 9pm and I reported it to the police and the coast guard.
Yes, teacher, please continue speaking.

Korean: 사고가 난 날이 금요일이었고 공사 업자분이랑은 토요일날 통화가 됐고요
English: The accident happened on Friday, and I spoke to the construction contractor on Saturday.

Korean: 월요일에 군청으로 민원을 제기해주시라 하셔서 제가 민원제기를 했습니다
English: I was told to file a complaint with the county office on Monday, so I did.

Korean: 그럼 이번주 월요일에 #@소속#에 민원 제기 하신거네요
English: So you filed a complaint with #@affiliation# on Monday this week?

Korean: 네 월요일에 군청 관계자분하고 통화를 했어요
English: Yes, I spoke to someone at the county office on Monday.

Korean: 죄송한데 제가 잠깐 중요한 전화가 와서요 다시 전화드려도 될까요
English: Excuse me, I have an important call coming in. Can I call you back later?
Yes, you can contact me at the same number.
Teacher, this is #@Affiliation# #@Name#. You just contacted me through the highway sign.
I would like to pass on what you mentioned to #@affiliation#

Korean: 정확한 업무 처리를 위해 선생님께 연락 드리는 경우가 있습니다
English: We may contact you to ensure accurate processing of your work.

Korean: 실례지만 성함과 연락처 말씀해주시면 함께 전달해드리겠습니다
English: Excuse me, but if you tell me your name and contact information, I can send it to you.
My name is #@name# and my number is #@phone#

Korean: 말씀하신 도로가 당진 기지시에 있는 회전로타리 맞으십니까
English: Is the road you mentioned the rotary in Dangjin Gijisi?

Korean: 네 회전로타리이고 옛날에는 신호가 있었는데 완전 다 없애버렸더라고
English: Yes, it's a rotary and there used to be a signal, but they've completely removed it.

Korean: 그러고서 만든게 요즘에 유행하는 회전로타리 있잖아요
English: And then we made the rotary rotator, which is popular these days.

Korean: 빙글빙글 돌아서 가는 거 그걸로 공사를 다 해놨더라고요
English: They said they finished the construction by going around and around like that.

Korean: 그게 정말 불편해요 그러니까 그 쪽에 꼭 좀 내용 전달해줘요
English: That's really inconvenient, so please make sure to convey the information to that side.

Korean: 선생님 말씀 중에 죄송하지만 회전로타리만으로는 위치 확인이 어렵습니다
English: I'm sorry, but it's difficult to confirm the location with just a rotary rotary.

Korean: 회전로타리가 있는 곳의 주소지 확인이 가능하실까요
English: Could you please confirm the address of the place where the rotary is located?

Korean: 주소지는 저희가 모르고 #@주소# 국도 그니까 고속도로 나오잖아요
English: We don't know the address, but #@address# is the national road, so it's on the highway.

Korean: 저희가 이제 서서울 아이씨를 타고 나오거든요
English: We are now coming out on the West Seoul IC.
Giji City #@Address# National Road Rotary

Korean: 네 그걸 타고 #@주소# 나오면은 나오자 마자 있는 회전로타리에요
English: Yes, if you take that and get off at #@address#, there's a rotary right after you get off.

Korean: 네 그럼 문의 주신 부분으로 전달하겠습니다 다른 문의사항 있으십니까
English: Yes, then I will forward it to the part you asked about. Do you have any other questions?

Korean: 아니요 다른 건 없구요 그거만 빨리 해주세요
English: No, nothing else. Just do that quickly.
Yes, I will pass on your information. Thank you.
Nice to meet you, I am #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
I'm saying this because I'm having a hard time

Korean: 선생님 죄송합니다 다시 한번만 말씀 부탁드립니다
English: I'm sorry, teacher. Could you please say that again?

Korean: 힘들어서 그러는데요 혹시 #@소속#으로 오실 수 있어요
English: I'm having a hard time, but can you come to #@Affiliation#?
Excuse me, teacher, but what kind of work do you do?

Korean: 아빠가 핸드폰을 안준데요  저 입원했을 때 아빠가 한 번도 안 찾아와요
English: My dad didn't give me a cell phone. When I was hospitalized, he never came to see me.

Korean: 저 보기 싫다고 아빠가 도망 댕기고 그 다음에 자식이 아니라 원수라 해요
English: My father ran away because he didn't want to see me, and then he called me his enemy instead of his son.

Korean: 내가 저번에 경찰에 신고했는데 아빠가 그거 때문에 핸드폰을 안 줘요
English: I reported it to the police last time, but my dad won't give me my phone because of that.

Korean: 선생님 죄송하지만 말씀하신 부분 #@소속#에서는 답변해드리기 어렵습니다
English: I'm sorry, teacher, but I cannot answer the question you mentioned in #@affiliation#.

Korean: 경찰에 도움이 필요하신 부분이시면 #@전번#로 문의를 해보시게 어떨까요
English: If you need help with anything from the police, why not try calling #@phone number#?
They say that if you dial #@phone number# there, it will work

Korean: 그러시면 선생님의 업무내용이 정확히 어떤 업무이십니까
English: So, what exactly is your job?
Is there anything you need legal advice on?
Yes, I would like to get legal advice.
I will guide you to the free legal consultation center.
Yes, thank you. I will try to contact you. Thank you.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
Yes, I have a question for you.

Korean: 스마트폰으로 주차 위반된 거 사진 찍어서 신고할려고 하는데요
English: I want to take a picture of a parking violation with my smartphone and report it.
How should I proceed with that?
Are you inquiring about how to report a parking violation using your smartphone?
They say there is an app for that
I will check and let you know.
I checked and it seems that the app for reporting inconveniences in daily life has been confirmed.
Wait a minute, I have a note to report an inconvenience in my life.

Korean: 네 사진을 첨부하셔서 신고가 가능한 부분으로 확인이 됩니다
English: Please attach your photo to confirm that it is a reportable part.

Korean: 이게 만약에 같은 차가 있으면은 그 오늘 제가 사진 찍어서 올려요
English: If there is the same car, I will take a picture of it today and upload it.

Korean: 그 내일 또 올리고 내일 모레 또 올려요
English: I'll upload it again tomorrow and the day after tomorrow

Korean: 그럼 매 건마다 부과되는 거예요 그 사람한테
English: Then it is imposed on each person

Korean: 선생님 그 부분까지는 저희 쪽에서 확인이 어렵습니다
English: Teacher, it is difficult for us to confirm that part.

Korean: 주정차 업무 관련해서는 해당 지역 시군청으로 문의를 주시면 주시면 됩니다
English: For inquiries regarding parking work, please contact the local city/county office.
Yes, I understand.
Yes, do you have any other questions?
No, it's okay. Thank you for your hard work.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 네 다름이 아니라 로드킬 신고하려고 하는데요
English: No, I just wanted to report some roadkill.
I bet you were very surprised, teacher.

Korean: 로드킬 신고는 해당 도로에 따라 담당 기관이 다른 부분으로 확인이 됩니다
English: Roadkill reports are verified by different agencies depending on the road in question.

Korean: 발견하신 도로가 일반도로 지방도로 국도 중 어느 도로이십니까
English: Is the road you found a general road, a local road, or a national road?
I'm confused whether it's a regular road or a national road.

Korean: 도로 종류를 잘 모르시는 경우에는 해당 지역 시군청으로 문의를 하시면 됩니다
English: If you are not sure about the type of road, please contact your local city or county office.
What area did you find it in?
This is the Nonghyup Training Center #@Affiliation#

Korean: 네 선생님 제가 확인 후 안내해드리겠습니다
English: Yes, teacher. I will check and let you know.
Yes, please do that.
Thank you for waiting, teacher.

Korean: 검색해보니 세종시와 공주시 부근에 #@소속# 확인이 어렵습니다
English: I searched and found that it is difficult to confirm #@affiliation# near Sejong City and Gongju City.
Then, please search for #@affiliation#
Yes, sir, your location is confirmed as Sejong Special Self-Governing City #@Address#
I know it's inconvenient, but please contact #@Affiliation# #@Phone#
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Yes, please drive safely. #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 예 제가 지금 #@소속# 홈페이지를 보고 있는데요
English: Yes, I'm currently looking at the #@affiliation# homepage.

Korean: #@소속# 지침이라고 해야 하나 조례가 있는데 검색을 못해서 전화드렸거든요
English: #@Affiliation# There is a rule or regulation that should be called a guideline, but I couldn't find it, so I'm calling you.

Korean: 네 선생님 도 지침에 대한 어떤 조례이십니까
English: Yes sir, what are the rules for the guidelines?

Korean: 다른 도로와의 연결에 관한 허가 같은 거요
English: Something like a permit for connection to another road.
Yes, I will check and let you know.
Could you please wait a moment, sir?
Yes, I will wait.

Korean: 네 자치법규 정보 시스템에 확인해보니 #@소속# 도로와 다른 시설의 연결에 관한 조례 확인이 됩니다
English: Yes, I checked with the local government ordinance information system and I can confirm the ordinance regarding the connection of #@affiliation# roads and other facilities.
Is this the ordinance you are looking for?
Yes, that's right. How do you see it?

Korean: 네 선생님 #@소속# 홈페이지 접속 중이라고 하셨죠
English: Yes, teacher, you said you were accessing the #@affiliation# homepage.

Korean: 행정에 마우스를 올리시면 법무행정이라고 확인이 되십니까
English: If you hover your mouse over Administration, can you see that it is Legal Administration?
Yes, I see the legal administration

Korean: 네 법무행정 아래 부분으로 행자치법규 열람을 클릭하시면 됩니다
English: Yes, you can click on the section under Legal Administration to view the local government laws.
Yes, click on view.

Korean: 클릭을 하시면 그 법규명에 도로로 검색 부탁드리겠습니다
English: If you click, I will search by road for that law name.
Yes, I checked, thank you
Do you have any other questions?
No, there isn't. Thank you for your effort.

Korean: 네 업무 처리 잘 되시길 바랍니다 #@소속# #@이름#였습니다
English: I hope your work goes well #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 네 여보세요 제가 지금 #@소속# 앞에 있거든요
English: Hello, I'm in front of #@affiliation# right now.
Yes, teacher, please speak.

Korean: 여기서 콜택시를 하나 불러야 되는데 좀 알 수 있을까요
English: I need to call a taxi here. Can you tell me how?
Are you talking about the call taxi number?

Korean: 네 그리고 여기가 정확히 어느 지역인지를 모르겠어요
English: Yeah and I don't know exactly where this is

Korean: 선생님 혹시 택시 부를 장소를 안내해드릴까요
English: Teacher, can you tell me where to call a taxi?
Can you take notes now?
Notes are not available right now
Is that so? Then how may I help you?
What area exactly is this?
Located at #@Address# in Hongseong-gun
Then it's Chungcheongnam-do
Yes, that's right, teacher.

Korean: 예 고맙습니다 해결할 수 있을 거 같습니다
English: Yes, thank you. I think I can solve it.
Yes, have a happy day #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Yes hello this is #@name#
Yes, hello, this is #@affiliation#
I have a question.
Hey, what's going on?

Korean: 민원인께서 다른 부서에 연결요청을 하시면 민원인은 대기하시고 제가 공무원과 통화를 하잖아요
English: If the complainant requests to be connected to another department, the complainant waits and I talk to a government official.
Yeah, usually.

Korean: 그런데 민원인이 종료하고 공무원도 종료를 하면 에이피가 멈추는 상황이 생기거든요
English: However, if the complainant quits and the civil servant also quits, the AP stops.
What do you mean by AP stopping?

Korean: 오셔서 보시면 좋을 거 같긴 한데 아무것도 저장할 수 없게끔 멈춰버려요
English: I think it would be nice to come and see it, but it freezes so I can't save anything.
So all the recordings and history were gone.
That seems a bit serious

English: So how many people do you think would be considered overcrowded?

English: If you would like to know about the criteria, I can connect you to the relevant department.
Then where is the department in charge of this work?
Yes, Gyeonggi-do #@affiliation#
Then could you please give me your contact information?
Yes, just a moment #@Affiliation# My number is #@Phone#
I hope your work goes smoothly. This was counselor #@name#.
Hello, this is counselor #@name#

English: Hello, I would like to inquire about violation of the Anti-Bribery Act for Teachers.
Could you please tell me specifically what it is about?

Korean: 교사가 직무 관련된 사람한테 삼만 원 정도 저녁식사 접대를 받았는데
English: A teacher received a dinner worth about 30,000 won from someone related to his job.
Is the amount exactly thirty thousand won?

Korean: 맞아요 그리고 자리를 옮겨서 카페에서 육천 원 정도 커피도 받았어요
English: Yes, and I moved to a cafe and got a coffee for about 6,000 won.

Korean: 저녁식사 삼만 원에 커피 육천 원 총 삼만 육천 원이네요
English: Dinner is thirty thousand won, coffee is six thousand won, total thirty-six thousand won.

Korean: 네 이 경우에 청탁금지법 위반이 맞나요
English: Yes, in this case, is it a violation of the Anti-Bribery Act?

Korean: 식사와 음료가 시간적 장소적으로 근접성이 있다고 판단되면요
English: If the food and drink are judged to be close in time and place,

Korean: 두 번이 아닌 한 번으로 평가가 가능합니다
English: You can evaluate once instead of twice
Then it is a violation

Korean: 맞습니다 일 회에 음식물 삼만 원 가액기준을 초과했기 때문에요
English: Yes, because it exceeded the 30,000 won per person food allowance.

Korean: 이 경우는 교직원 청탁 금지법 위반에 해당한다고 볼 수 있습니다
English: This case can be seen as a violation of the law prohibiting solicitation of faculty and staff.
Okay, thanks for checking
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# #@Name#

Thank you for your inquiry regarding operating hours.

Are you open on public holidays?
Closed on public holidays

Korean: 추가로 노외주차장 날마다 이십사 시간 운영됩니다
English: Additionally, the off-street parking lot is open twenty-four hours a day.
Thank you for your kind guidance.
Thank you #@name#
Hello, this is counselor #@name#

Korean: 공사 소음 관련 민원 접수 하시려는 겁니까
English: Are you looking to file a complaint about construction noise?

Korean: 맞아요 너무 시끄러워서 사람이 살 수가 없어요
English: Yes, it's so noisy that people can't live there.
Just a moment, I'll check.
Teacher #@Elementary school is currently undergoing cafeteria expansion construction

Korean: 그건 아는데 아침 일찍부터 너무 시끄러우니까 잠을 잘 수가 없어요
English: I know that, but it's so noisy early in the morning that I can't sleep.

Korean: 그러십니까 이미 다른 분들도 관련 민원 요청을 해주셨어요
English: Is that so? Other people have already filed related complaints.

Korean: 그래서 시공사 측에 소음 방지 대책을 요청한 상태 입니다
English: So, we have requested noise prevention measures from the construction company.
Okay, so when will it be resolved?

Korean: 일단 방지 대책을 받고 계속 협의를 할 예정이고요
English: First, we will receive preventive measures and continue discussions.

Korean: 더 자세한 사항 문의를 원하시면 담당자 연락처를 알려 드릴게요

Please let me know who is in charge
#@Affiliation#
#@Name# My contact number is #@Phone#
Okay, I'll contact you.
Thank you, counselor #@name#

English: Yes, hello, I would like to give you some suggestions for improvement.

Korean: 지금 시 홈페이지에 일하는 가정 주거공간개선 대상가구를 모집 중이잖아요
English: Right now, the city is recruiting households that are eligible for home improvement projects on its website.
Yes, that's right, teacher.

Korean: 근데 지원 대상이 왜 여성으로만 한정되어있나요
English: But why is the support target limited to women only?

Korean: 가정 모집인데 지원 대상을 여성으로 한정한 건 성차별입니다
English: It is gender discrimination to limit the applicants to women when it is a home recruitment.

Korean: 집안 정리는 여성이 주 담당이라는 잘못된 인식을 주지 않습니까
English: Doesn't it create the misconception that housekeeping is primarily the responsibility of women?

Korean: 네 선생님 우선 시에서 주관하는 사업에 주신 많은 관심 감사드립니다
English: Yes, teacher, first of all, thank you for your interest in the city-sponsored project.

Korean: 그리고 말씀주신 사항으로 불편드려 죄송하다는 말씀 드립니다
English: And I apologize for any inconvenience caused by the information you provided.

Korean: 네 빠른 재검토가 가능하시면 재공지 요청드리고요
English: Yes, if you can quickly review it, I would like to request a re-announcement.

Korean: 그게 어렵다면 향후 사업 진행시 이런 부분도 고려 부탁드립니다
English: If that is difficult, please consider these aspects when conducting business in the future.

Korean: 네 선생님의 의견을 적극 반영하여 공고를 즉각 수정하겠습니다
English: Yes, we will immediately revise the notice to actively reflect your teacher's opinion.
Yes, thank you. Please be careful in the future.

Korean: 네 앞으로도 성평등한 관점으로 홍보하겠습니다 감사합니다
English: Yes, I will continue to promote it from a gender equality perspective. Thank you.
Hello, I am counselor #@Affiliation# and #@Name#

I will respond to your complaint.

English: #@Affiliation# announced that it will replace 10,000 of its postal delivery two-wheeled vehicles with safe, ultra-compact electric vehicles.

Korean: 하지만 십구년 사월 시범사업 설명회에서 수정 발표를 하였습니다
English: However, a revised announcement was made at the April 19 pilot project briefing session.

Korean: 이에 시범 사업으로 십구년부터 천대의 초소형 전기차를 배치하였습니다

The ceiling is now set

Korean: 긍정적 요인을 감안하여 지속적 도입은 필요하다고 판단하고 있습니다

Yes, there are many good points.

Korean: 아직까지는 외산 부품 의존도가 높아 수리 기간이 오래 걸립니다

Korean: 이러한 현황을 고려한다면 당장에 규모를 늘리는데 한계가 있습니다.

There are many difficulties in introduction

English: If a public official dies, twice the standard monthly income at the time is paid.

Korean: 두 배 인가요 그런데 금액이 두 배가 안되는 거 같은데
English: Is it double? But I don't think the amount is double.

Korean: 기준소득월액이 평균기준소득월액의 백 육십 퍼센트를 초과하면요
English: If the standard monthly income exceeds 160 percent of the average standard monthly income

Korean: 최고 백 육십 퍼센트만 지급됩니다 아마 그래서 금액이 다를거에요

English: We would like to inform you that we are preparing measures to distinguish between existing facilities and newly-built facilities.

English: In addition, please note that we will provide a grace period for administrative measures such as imposing enforcement fines.

Korean: 보다 상세한 사항은 내부 검토 중인 사항임에 따라 구체적으로 회신하지 못하는 점 양해 바랍니다

It's difficult to give a specific answer.

Yes, here is #@address#

Korean: 혹시 건의 접수를 위해 성함과 번호 알 수 있을까요

Your name is #@name# and my number is #@phone#

Yes, thank you #@Affiliation# #@Name#

Hello, I am counselor #@Affiliation# and #@Name#

Korean: 네 우선 투기과열지구 및 청약과열지역에서 공급되는 주택의 일반공급 일순위 자격 안내드릴게요
English: Yes, first of all, I will give you information on the first priority qualification for general supply of houses supplied in speculative overheated areas and subscription overheated areas.

English: The condition for applying for national housing is that you must have subscribed to the housing subscription savings plan and it has been two years since then.

Korean: 매월 약정납입일에 월납입금을 이십사 회 이상 납입하여야 합니다
English: You must pay the monthly installment at least twenty-four times on the agreed payment date each month.
Also, you must be the head of household.

English: All members of a household without a home must not have been the winners of another home within the past five years.

Korean: 국민 주택 조건은 그렇게 되고 민영 주택은 어떻게 되나요
English: What happens to the public housing conditions, but what about private housing?

Korean: 또한 별표 이의 예치기준금액에 상당하는 금액을 납입하여야 합니다
English: In addition, you must deposit an amount equivalent to the deposit standard amount of the asterisk.
Also, you must be the head of household.

English: Yes, if you meet the above requirements, you can apply for first-priority subscription regardless of region.

English: However, close contacts of confirmed cases at the school are continuously being identified.

English: Please wait a moment. I will check what you said.
Seoul City #@Affiliation#Middle School, right?
Yes, that's right #@affiliation#middle school

Korean: 사십년 이상 경과된 노후 건물을 기준에 따라 선정한거구요

Korean: 학교 구성원 참여를 통해서 환경을 자율적으로 조성하는 취지의 사업이에요

First of all, I apologize for any inconvenience caused by using the bus.

English: Our city's bus routes are operated under a private system in which transportation operators apply for changes to their business plans.

I'll check it out, just a moment

What is it specifically?

Korean: 고열량 저양양 식품은 일반적으로 패스트푸드나 인스턴트식품 이구요
English: High-calorie, low-nutrient foods are usually fast foods or instant foods.

Korean: 햄버거 피자 도넛 라면 뭐 그런것들인가요

Korean: 맞습니다 그리고 기타 학생 건강이나 영양에 적합하지 않은 것도요

Korean: 학교장이 지정하면 판매 제한 할 수 있습니다
English: Sales may be restricted if designated by the school principal.

Korean: 학교장 재량으로 판매 제한을 할 수 있다는 말씀인거죠

Yes, teacher, it's up to the principal's discretion.
Okay, I understand. Thank you.
Thank you, counselor #@name#
This is #@Name#, a counselor with the people.

Yes, teacher, what is your question?

Korean: 출입국 사무소 근무하시는 분들과 영어 소통이 어렵더라고요
English: I had a hard time communicating in English with the people working at the immigration office.

Korean: 비 영어권 국가 외국인도 영어는 하거든요
English: Even foreigners from non-English speaking countries speak English.

Korean: 네 맞습니다 한 분이라도 계시면 민원처리가 편할 것 같아요
English: Yes, that's right. If there's even one person, it would be easier to process the complaint.

Korean: 주신 의견처럼 저희쪽에서도 능통자 채용을 하고 있는데요

Korean: 모든 사무소마다 충분한 인력 배치가 어려운 상황입니다
English: It is difficult to allocate sufficient personnel to each office.

Yes, I understand what you mean.

English: First, you can consult in various languages by calling #@number# without the area code.

Korean: 해당 콜센터를 통해 민원인의 모국어로 업무 처리 가능합니다

Korean: 또한 직원들의 외국어 역량 강화를 위해 노력 하겠습니다

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 앞으로 콜센터도 이용해야 겠네요
English: Yes, I understand. I guess I'll have to use the call center from now on.

Korean: 네 감사합니다 다른 문의 더 있으십니까

No, it's okay. There isn't any.

English: I stole something from my friend's father with my friend. How will I be punished?

Korean: 네 공범의 가족 물건 절도의 처벌에 대한 것으로 이해됩니다
English: It is understood that this is a punishment for theft of family belongings of four accomplices.
Yes, that's right, the accomplice's family.

Korean: 아들과 친구는 합동으로 절도를 하였으므로 특수 절도죄가 성립합니다
English: The son and his friend committed theft together, so the crime of special theft is established.

Korean: 그러나 친구와 달리 아들은 친족상 도례 에 해당되어 형이 면제됩니다
English: However, unlike his friend, the son is exempt from the penalty as he is subject to the rite of kinship.
Am I the only one charged with special theft?

Korean: 네 그렇습니다 아들은 형법 제 삼백사십사 조 제 삼백이십팔 조 제 일 항의 친족상도례에 해당되어 면제됩니다
English: Yes, that's right. My son is exempted from the kinship rites of passage under Article 344 and Article 328 of the Criminal Act.

Korean: 이 사항은 구체적인 개별 사안에 따라 달라질 수 있습니다
English: This may vary depending on the specific individual case.
Okay, I understand

English: I suggested improving the distribution criteria for special housing supply for the disabled. What happened?

English: Thank you for your usual interest in the Land, Infrastructure and Transport Administration.

English: In the case of special supply for the disabled, the rules on housing supply apply.

Korean: 기관추천으로 국토교통부에서 관리하는 주택공급에 대한 규칙이 있습니다
English: There are rules for housing supply managed by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport through institutional recommendations.

Korean: 여기서는 기관추천의 기본적인 자격요건만 정하고 있습니다
English: Here, only the basic qualification requirements for institutional recommendations are set.
Detailed selection criteria are delegated to the recommending agency.

Korean: 네 기준이 각자 달라 해당 추천기관에 문의해주시면 감사하겠습니다

Please contact us and we will be happy to assist you.

You're saying that you want to increase the number of national kindergartens?

Korean: 맞아요 제가 지금 유치원 특수교사로 일하고 있는데요
English: Yes, I am currently working as a special education teacher at a kindergarten.

Korean: 국립유치원도 더 늘려야 하고 교사도 증원이 필요할 것 같아요
English: I think we need to increase the number of national kindergartens and increase the number of teachers.
Please also request additional kindergarten teachers.

Korean: 맞아요 지금은 교사 일인이 봐야하는 유아 수가 너무 많아요
English: Yes, there are too many children for one teacher to look after these days.

Korean: 지금 근무하고 계시는 유치원이 광주광역시 소재 맞으십니까
English: Is the kindergarten you are currently working at located in Gwangju Metropolitan City?

Korean: 맞아요 그런데 광주뿐만 아니라 전국적으로 늘려야 할 거 같거든요
English: Yes, but I think it needs to be expanded nationwide, not just in Gwangju.

Korean: 선생님 일단 광주시 현황을 좀 알려드리면요
English: Teacher, first, let me tell you about the current situation in Gwangju.

Korean: 얼마전인 팔월 십 이일에 유치원 교사 선발예정 인원을 공고했구요
English: On August 12th, a while ago, we announced the number of kindergarten teachers to be selected.

Korean: 안그래도 그것도 봤는데 인원이 너무 적은 것 같더라구요
English: I saw that too, but it seemed like there were too few people.

Korean: 그 인원수는 교육부가 시교육청에 통지한 인원수가 반영 된 겁니다
English: The number of people is reflected in the number of people notified by the Ministry of Education to the city/provincial office of education.

Korean: 더 궁금하신 점이 있으시면 담당 주무관 번호 알려드릴게요
English: If you have any further questions, I will give you the number of the person in charge.
Then please tell me the number of the person in charge.
#@Affiliation# #@Name# I am a scholarship student #@Phone#
Thank you for your guidance
Thank you, counselor #@name#

English: Yes, I would like to file a complaint about the Hanam Wirye New Town bus.
Yes, please tell me about the Wiryeseong District bus complaint.

Korean: 이번 #@주소#역 개통에 따라 다른 시와의 버스 노선 연계가 필요할 것 같습니다
English: With the opening of this #@address# station, it seems like there will be a need for bus route connections with other cities.
Yes, you requested improvement of the bus route.

Korean: 현재 위례지구에 송파구 성남시 우리시가 위치해 있습니다
English: Currently, Songpa-gu, Seongnam-si, and Woori-si are located in Wiryeseong-gu.

Korean: 이에 따라 지자체별 노선을 가능한 연계토록 추진 중입니다
English: Accordingly, we are working to connect routes by local government as much as possible.

Korean: 네 플로리체위례 버스 정류장에 정말 사람이 몰려요
English: Yes, the Florichewi bus stop is really crowded.

Korean: 현재 코로나도 있고 그런데 개선이 필요합니다
English: There is also corona now, so improvement is needed.

Korean: 위례지구 버스정류소 중 이용자가 가장 많습니다 플로리체위례 버스정류소가
English: Among the bus stops in the Wiryeseong district, the Floriche Wiryeseong bus stop is the most used.
That's why we're expanding and replacing the facility.

Korean: 추가적으로 노선별 모니터링을 통해 노선버스 이용에 불편을 최소화하겠습니다
English: Additionally, we will minimize inconvenience in using route buses through route-specific monitoring.
Yes, thank you.
Be careful of Corona. The complainant was #@name#
Hello, this is counselor #@name#

Korean: 독서실 설립 기준 문의 드리려고 하는데요
English: I would like to inquire about the criteria for establishing a reading room.
Could you tell me the criteria for establishing a reading room?
Is it possible to set up a reading room on the upper floor of a coin karaoke room?
I will check for you.

Korean: 일단 교육환경 보호에 관한 법률에 해당하는 시설이 존재할 경우는요
English: First of all, if there is a facility that falls under the Educational Environment Protection Act,

Korean: 독서실 설립이 불가한 것으로 확인이 됩니다
English: It has been confirmed that the establishment of a reading room is impossible.
Is it impossible even if it's not the floor right above?

Korean: 이십 미터 이내의 같은 층이거나 바로 위아래층인 경우는 불가능합니다
English: It is not possible if it is on the same floor or the floor directly above or below within 20 meters.

Korean: 그거 말고 다른 요건이 또 있나요
English: Are there any other requirements besides that?

Korean: 해당 건축물용도가 근린생활시설 또는 교육연구시설이어야 하구요
English: The building's intended use must be a neighborhood living facility or an educational research facility.

Korean: 화장실은 남녀 구분해서 대변기 각각 한 대 이상 마련되어야 합니다
English: Toilets must be separated into men's and women's areas and have at least one toilet.
Are there any regulations regarding reading rooms?

Korean: 열람실 면접 합계는 백 제곱미터 이상이어야 합니다
English: The total area of the reading room interview must be at least 100 square meters.
Thank you for checking
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Hello, this is counselor #@name# from #@affiliation#

English: Yes, thank you for your hard work. I just called to ask you a question.

Korean: 네 어떤 문의 이신지 말씀 해 주시겠어요
English: Yes, please tell me what your inquiry is.
What is the definition of tide?

Korean: 조석은 해수면이 규칙적인 상승 또는 하강하는 현상입니다
English: Tides are regular rises or falls in sea level.

Korean: 달과 태양 그리고 지구 사이의 만유인력 등에 의해 발생하는 현상이죠
English: It is a phenomenon caused by the universal gravitational force between the moon, the sun, and the earth.

Korean: 좀 더 자세히 설명 해 주실수 있을까요
English: Could you explain in more detail?

Korean: 해수면이 가장 높아진 상태를 고조라 합니다
English: The highest sea level is called high tide.

Korean: 반대로 가장 낮아진 상태를 저조라고 합니다
English: Conversely, the lowest state is called low tone.

Korean: 아 네 잘 알겠습니다 친절한 상담 감사합니다
English: Oh, yes, I understand. Thank you for your kind advice.
Yes, do you have any further questions?

Korean: 네 아직은 없구요 더 궁금한게 있으면 다시 연락 드리겠습니다
English: No, not yet. If I have any further questions, I will contact you again.
Thank you #@Affiliation# #@Name#

English: I would like to ask some questions about special sports students.
What exactly are you talking about?

Korean: 제 아들이 초등학교 오 학년인데 체조 특기자가 되고 싶어서요
English: My son is in the fifth grade of elementary school and he wants to be a gymnastics specialist.

Korean: 훈련 받기 위해서 이 학기 동안 매일 일 교시만 하고 조퇴를 했어요
English: In order to receive training, I only went to class once every day during this semester and left school early.

Korean: 이 학기 동안 매일 일 교시만 하고 조퇴요
English: During this semester, I only go to class once a day and then leave early.

Korean: 네 이럴 경우 오 학년 수료가 가능한가 해서요

English: The number of attendance days required to complete each grade course is at least two-thirds of the number of class days.

Korean: 아니요 일 교시 후 조퇴는 출석일수에 포함이 되기 때문에 가능합니다
English: No, leaving early after class is possible because it counts as attendance days.

English: I was wondering if it is against the law to have an incinerator nearby.

English: Is the law you are referring to the law on protection of educational environment?

English: Yes, as you said, many parents contact us.

English: It is stipulated that the straight-line distance is within a range of two hundred meters from the school boundary, etc.

English: However, it says that the facility is not located within the educational environment protection zone.

English: Depending on the time, you can take only #@Product#, or you can take it freely.

Thank you #@Affiliation# Counselor #@Name#

Korean: 아 그래요 제가 지금 강의 목록을 그럼 잘못 보고 있나봐요 확인해보겠습니다
English: Oh, I see. I think I'm looking at the lecture list wrong. I'll check.

Korean: 네 고객님 다시 한번 확인해보시고 그래도 확인 안 되실 경우 재상담 부탁드리겠습니다
English: Yes, please check again. If you still can't confirm, please contact us again.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 친절한 상담 감사합니다 지금 확인할게요
English: Yes, I understand. Thank you for your kind advice. I will check it now.

Korean: 다른 추가 문의 사항은 더 없으실까요
English: Are there any other additional questions?
Yes, that's enough for now. Thank you for your concern.
I will be with you until the day you pass. Thank you. #@Affiliation#
Hello customer, this is #@affiliation#, counselor #@name#

Korean: 안녕하세요 저 #@이름# 교수님 인강 관련해서 문의 있어가지구요
English: Hello, Professor #@Name#, I have a question regarding your lecture.

Korean: 네 고객님 어떤 부분 도와드리면 될까요
English: Yes, sir. How can I help you?
#@Product# When will the Sunday lecture be uploaded?
Is this the course you inquired about #@product#?

Korean: 네 그거 맞아요 이거 일요일에 녹화한 강의가 지금 확인이 안 되서요
English: Yes, that's right. I can't check the lecture recorded on Sunday right now.

Korean: 해당 강의 금요일 격주마다 촬영하고 있는 강좌로 확인됩니다
English: It is confirmed that the lecture is filmed every other Friday.

Korean: 교수님께서 4월 9일 금요일 4월 16일 금요일에는 촬영 계획이 없으시고요
English: The professor has no filming plans on Friday, April 9th and Friday, April 16th.

Korean: 4월 23일 금요일 4월 30일 금요일에 촬영하시어 그 후에 인강 업로드 진행 예정입니다
English: We will film on Friday, April 23rd and Friday, April 30th and upload the lectures thereafter.

Korean: 아 그러면 2주나 기다려야되겠네요 생각보다 오래 걸리네요
English: Oh, then I guess I'll have to wait two weeks. It'll take longer than I thought.
Yes, customer, please understand the time constraints.
Okay, I'm glad you asked. I'll take note and study it.

Korean: 합격까지 함께하겠습니다 언제든 문의주세요 #@이름# 상담사였습니다 감사합니다
English: I will be with you until you pass. Please contact me anytime. #@Name# I was a counselor. Thank you.
Hello, this is the absolute best in transfer #@affiliation#

Korean: 네 저 #@상품# 구입하고 싶은데 구입 가능한가해서요
English: Yes, I would like to buy #@product#, but I am wondering if I can buy it

Korean: 네 고객님 현재 #@상품#는 판매가 마감되어 구매가 어려운 점 양해 부탁드립니다
English: Yes, dear customer, we apologize for the inconvenience and ask for your understanding as #@Product# is currently sold out and cannot be purchased.

Korean: 아 그러면 #@이름# 강의를 기초부터 심화까지 들으려면 어떻게 해야하죠
English: Oh, then how can I listen to the #@name# lecture from the basics to the advanced level?

Korean: 네 고객님 #@이름# 교수님 강좌는 #@상품#로 구매하여 수강 가능하십니다
English: Yes, customer #@name#, you can take Professor #@'s course by purchasing it with #@product#.

Korean: 다만 2023학년도 편입시험까지 염두해두시는 분들을 위해 1년 6개월짜리 상품으로 수강기간이 긴 상품인 점 참고 부탁드립니다
English: However, for those who are considering taking the 2023 transfer exam, please note that this is a long-term product with a 1 year and 6 month course period.

Korean: 아 엄청기네요 그럼 그냥 단과로 구매해서 듣는 수밖에 없겠네요
English: Oh, that's really great. Then I guess I'll just have to buy it and listen to it.

Korean: 네 맞습니다 고객님 만족스러운 답변 드리지못해 죄송한 말씀 드립니다
English: Yes, that's right. I apologize for not being able to give you a satisfactory answer.

Korean: 아닙니다 어쩔 수 없죠 제가 빠르지 못했네요
English: No, I can't help it. I wasn't quick enough.

Korean: 추가로 다른 궁금 사항 같은 거 있으실까요
English: Do you have any other questions?
No, this consultation is enough for today.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 언제든 문의 전화 주세요
English: Yes, I understand. Feel free to call me anytime.
I was a counselor #@name# Thank you
Thank you for the shortcut to transfer #@Affiliation# Counselor #@Name#

Korean: 저 수강 관련해서 문의 드리려고 연락드렸습니다
English: I'm contacting you to inquire about the course.

Korean: 네 고객님 어떤 부분 도움 필요하실까요 편하게 말씀해 주세요
English: Yes, please tell me what you need help with.

Korean: 다름아니라 제가 지금 온라인 종합반 3개월 구매를 해서 이용하고 있는데요
English: The thing is, I am currently using the 3-month online comprehensive course that I purchased.

Korean: 편입 수학의 경우 한달에 두 강좌까지만 수강이 되더라고요
English: For transfer math, you can only take two classes per month.

Korean: 네 고객님 안타깝게도 온라인 영수 종합반의 경우는 한달에 신청 가능한 수학강좌가 2강좌로 제한되어 있습니다
English: Yes, dear customer, unfortunately, in the case of the online comprehensive course, the number of math courses that can be applied for per month is limited to 2.

Korean: 전 수학만 듣고 싶어서 그런데 첫달만이라도 3개를 수강할 수 있게 해주실 수 없을까요
English: I only want to take math, but could you let me take 3 classes, even if it's just for the first month?

Korean: 다른 회원님들 모두 동일하게 적용되며 판매 페이지 이용안내에도 명시되어 있는 부분입니다
English: This applies equally to all other members and is also stated in the sales page usage instructions.

Korean: 수학 강좌 추가 수강 도움을 드리기 어려운 점 양해 부탁드리겠습니다
English: We apologize for not being able to help you with adding math classes.

Korean: 네 혹시나 편의를 봐주실까 하여 여쭤봤는데 역시 안 되는군요
English: Yes, I asked in case you could be considerate, but it seems like it won't work out.

Korean: 만족스러운 답변 드리지 못해 죄송한 말씀드립니다
English: I apologize for not being able to give you a satisfactory answer.
Do you have any additional questions?

Korean: 아뇨 더이상 없습니다 오늘 상담 감사합니다
English: No, no more. Thank you for your consultation today.

Korean: 수험 생활 언제든 문의주시고 좋은 하루 보내세요 감사합니다

Thank you, my transfer companion #@affiliation#

Yes, what part are you curious about?

Korean: 제가 #@상품#를 구매하고 수강 신청을 한 상태인데요
English: I purchased #@product# and applied for the course.

Korean: 그 강의 기간이 제한이 되어 있던데 그 이후로는 들을 수가 없는 건가요
English: The lecture period is limited, so I can't listen to it after that?

Korean: 네 고객님 모든 강좌는 각각 단강좌 상품으로도 판매가 되고 있어서 고유의 수강 기간이 설정됩니다
English: Yes, dear customer, each course is sold as a single course product, so each course has its own unique course period.

Korean: 수강 종료 후 같은 강좌를 다시 수강하고 싶으시면 종료일 이후 다시 수강신청 해주시면 됩니다
English: If you want to take the same course again after the course ends, you can apply for the course again after the end date.

Korean: 아 그럼 제가 지금 수강하는 과목이 이번달 말에 종료인데 다시 듣고 싶으면 말일 이후에 재신청 하면 된다는거죠
English: Oh, so the course I'm taking now ends at the end of this month, and if I want to take it again, I can reapply after the end of the month.

Korean: 네 맞습니다 고객님 다만 #@상품#로 수강신청한 강좌의 수강기간이 1월 31일을 경과한 경우에는요
English: Yes, that's right, customer. However, if the course you applied for with #@Product# has a course period that has passed January 31st,

Korean: 고유 수강기간이 남았더라도 패스 이용 종료와 함께 수강도 불가능한 점 참고해주세요
English: Please note that even if you have a unique course period remaining, you will no longer be able to take the course once the pass expires.

Korean: 아 당연히 패스를 이용하니까 그럴거라고 생각했네요
English: Oh, of course I thought that would be the case since I was using a pass.

Korean: 그러실 수 있죠 추가로 궁금하신 사항 있으실까요
English: You may ask me any additional questions.
No, there isn't. Thank you for your consultation today.
Yes, I will be with you until the day you pass.
I am #@affiliation# counselor #@name# Thank you
Your companion for passing is #@affiliation#

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 저 수강 관련해서 궁금한 게 있어 전화드렸습니다

Korean: 네 고객님 강좌명이나 해당 사항 자세히 말씀해 주시면 상담 도와드리겠습니다
English: Yes, customer. Please tell me the name of the course or the details so I can help you.

Korean: 저 수강 기간 연장이 되는지 알고 싶어서 그러는데요
English: I'm asking because I want to know if the course period can be extended.

Korean: 제가 #@이름# 기초수학을 들을려고 하는데 혹시 기간이 다 지나고 기간 연장 가능한가요
English: I'm planning to take #@name# basic math. Is it possible to extend the period after the period ends?

Korean: 네 고객님 수강기간 연장 기능은 단강좌 및 패키지 강좌 구매시에만 이용 가능합니다
English: Yes, the extension feature for your course period is only available when purchasing a single course or package course.

Korean: 또한 수강 연장 신청은 강좌당 최대 2회까지 가능하며 1회 최대 5일까지 연장할 수 있고 연장 비용이 발생됩니다
English: In addition, you can apply for extension of course registration up to 2 times per course, and you can extend it up to 5 days at a time, and an extension fee will be charged.

Korean: 수강 연장 비용은 일할 수강료에 연장일수를 곱하시면 됩니다
English: To calculate the extension fee, multiply the number of extension days by the daily tuition fee.

Korean: 아 그럼 일할 수강료는 어떻게 산정되는지 알 수 있을까요
English: Oh, then can you tell me how the tuition fee is calculated?

Korean: 일할 수강료는 전체 수강료를 수강 기간으로 나눈 비용입니다
English: The tuition fee for work is the total tuition fee divided by the duration of the course.

Korean: 네 이해했습니다 참고하여 수강 연장 신청 해볼게요
English: Yes, I understand. I will take note and apply for an extension.

Korean: 다른 사항 더 궁금하신 건 없으신가요

Korean: 오늘 전부 다 여쭤본 것 같습니다 감사합니다
English: I think I asked everything today. Thank you.

Korean: 네 고객님 저는 #@이름# 상담사였습니다 좋은하루 되세요

Thank you, this is the shortcut to transfer admission #@affiliation#

Korean: 저 환급 모의고사 관련해서 문의 좀 드리려고 합니다
English: I would like to inquire about the refund mock exam.
Yes, customer, what part are you curious about?

Korean: 환급을 받으려면 총 5번의 모의고사를 봐야 된다고 써있던데요
English: It says that I have to take a total of 5 mock exams to get a refund.
Of course, this assumes you've passed the school.

Korean: 지금까지 전국 6월 모의고사 한번 응시한 상황인데요
English: So far, I have taken the nationwide mock exam once in June.

Korean: 8월 9월 10월 모의고사 그리고 최종 배치고사까지 해서 총 4번을 보면 횟수가 5번으로 카운팅 되는게 맞을까요
English: If I take the mock exam in August, September, October, and the final placement exam a total of 4 times, is it correct to count it as 5 times?

Korean: 네 고객님 맞습니다 6월 전국 모의고사를 이미 응시하신 상황이기 때문에요
English: Yes, that's right, customer. Because you have already taken the national mock exam in June.

Korean: 남은 8월 9월 월별 편입 모의고사 10월 전국 모의고사 11월 배치고사 까지 모두 응시하게 되시면요
English: If you take all the remaining August and September monthly transfer mock exams, October national mock exams, and November placement exams,

Korean: 모의고사 환급 조건 5회를 충족하실 것으로 예상됩니다
English: It is expected that you will meet the mock exam refund conditions 5 times.
I asked just in case, and it turned out to be true.

Korean: 네 고객님 수험 생활 준비 잘 하셔서 환급 장학금까지 수령하시길 응원하겠습니다
English: Yes, I hope you prepare well for the exam and receive the refund scholarship.
Thank you. I will prepare hard and take the exam.
Do you have any further questions?
No, there isn't, everything is resolved.
Have a day that brings you closer to passing
I was a counselor #@name# Thank you
Thank you, the absolute best in transfer #@affiliation#

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 저 #@상품#로 생물이랑 화학 과목도 수강 가능한가 문의드리려고요
English: Yes, hello. I would like to inquire whether I can take biology and chemistry classes with #@product#.

Korean: 네 고객님 #@상품#는 편입 영어와 편입 수학 준비 시 이용가능한 패스로 확인됩니다
English: Yes, customer #@Product# is confirmed to be a pass that can be used for transfer English and transfer math preparation.

Korean: 따라서 생물과 화학 등 전공과목 수강은 어려운 점 양해 부탁드립니다
English: Therefore, please understand that it may be difficult to take major courses such as biology and chemistry.

Korean: 아 그러면 #@상품#나 #@상품#를 통해서 생물이나 화학 과목 따로 수강해야 할까요
English: Oh, then should I take biology or chemistry classes separately through #@Product# or #@Product#?

Korean: 네 고객님 현재 말씀해 주신 #@상품#의 경우 올해 판매가 종료되어 구매가 불가능하시고요
English: Yes, customer, the #@product# you mentioned is no longer available for purchase as sales have ended this year.

Korean: 현재 연고대 전공 과목 수강이 가능한 패스상품은 #@상품#입니다
English: Currently, the pass product that allows you to take major courses at Yonsei University is #@Product#
Oh, then I guess I have to pay for #@product# and take the course.

Korean: 네 고객님 해당패스의 경우 기초 과정 강좌를 12월 31일 까지 수강 가능하십니다
English: Yes, customer, for this pass, you can take the basic course until December 31st.

Korean: 네 참고해서 수험 생활 하도록 하겠습니다 감사합니다
English: Yes, I will take note of it and prepare for the exam. Thank you.
Do you have any additional questions, customer?

Korean: 아뇨 오늘 상담으로 전부 해결했습니다 감사합니다
English: No, everything was resolved through consultation today. Thank you.
Please contact us anytime. We will help you throughout your exam preparation.
I was a counselor #@name# Thank you
Thank you, transfer expert #@affiliation#

Korean: 네 저 상담 문의 좀 드리려고 합니다
English: Yes, I would like to inquire about consultation.

Korean: 고객님 편히 말씀해 주시면 적극적으로 도와드리겠습니다
English: Please feel free to tell us and we will be happy to help you.

Korean: 모의고사 기준으로 갈 수 있는 학교가 궁금한데요
English: I'm curious about the schools I can go to based on my mock exam results.

Korean: 문과 학사편입 기준으로 모의고사 30% 수준이면 어느 학교 가능할까요
English: Which schools would be acceptable if I have a mock exam score of 30% for transfer to a liberal arts college?

Korean: 백분위 70의 과년도 합격자는 인서울 중위권 대학에 합격했습니다
English: The 70th percentile of previous year's successful applicants were accepted to mid-tier universities in Seoul.
So you're saying that roughly the middle tier of Seoul is going to be there?

Korean: 자세한 사항은 추후 진행예정인 모의고사 서비스를 통해 확인 가능하십니다
English: For more detailed information, please check the mock exam service scheduled for the future.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 일단 목표가 생긴 것 같아요
English: Okay, I understand. I think I have a goal.

Korean: 다행입니다 고객님 다른 문의사항은 더 없으실까요
English: Good luck, sir. Do you have any other questions?
No, thank you for your consultation today.

Korean: 항상 최상의 교육 서비스로 보답하겠습니다 저는 #@이름# 상담사였습니다
English: I will always reward you with the best educational service. I was a counselor #@name#
Thank you, I am the number one university transfer student #@affiliation#

Korean: 안녕하세요 토익으로 편입 가능한 간호대학이 있는지 궁금해서요
English: Hello, I was wondering if there are any nursing colleges that I can transfer to with TOEIC.

Korean: 네 고객님 공인영어로 간호학과 진학 가능한 대학 말씀이신가요
English: Yes, sir, are you talking about a university where you can enter the nursing department with an official English proficiency?

Korean: 삼육대 성신여대 을지대 원광대 지방 국립대 등이 있습니다
English: There are Samyuk University, Sungshin Women's University, Eulji University, Wonkwang University, and local national universities.

Korean: 제 최종 학점이 3.69에 토익은 800인데요 900후반까지 올리면 가능할까요
English: My final GPA is 3.69 and my TOEIC score is 800. Is it possible to raise it to the upper 900s?

Korean: 네 고객님 수도권 대학의 경우 공인 영어 점수가 높게 형성됩니다
English: Yes, dear customer, in the case of universities in the metropolitan area, the official English score is formed high.

Our university is a 4-year university, not a credit bank system.
If you graduated from a junior college, you can transfer to the third year.
Applicants can apply as a third-year student in the Department of Health Administration, and recruitment for the first semester of 2020 will begin on December 1.
If I start recruiting on the 1st, how long will it last?
We are recruiting until February, before the start of the semester in March.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Yes, thank you. It was #@Affiliation#, counselor #@Name#

English: I am #@Affiliation#, a counselor full of happiness, #@Name#. How may I help you?

English: It is said that you must complete 4 credits of prerequisite courses related to chemistry or biology.

English: In my case, I only need 4 credits. Can I complete them here?

Korean: 네 일단 저희 대학 시간제 입학을 통해 원하시는 교과목만 수강 가능합니다
English: Yes, first of all, through our university's part-time admission, you can take only the courses you want.

Korean: 하지만 2019년 2학기 시간제 입학은 현재 모집이 종료되었습니다
English: However, part-time admission for the second semester of 2019 has now closed.

Only the first semester of 2020 is scheduled for recruitment.

English: Yes, you can check the schedule on our school website.

English: If you want to take the class again, you can apply separately through the course history on the website.

What if you lose your password?

Korean: 이메일 주소로 임시 비밀번호 등을 보내 드리기 때문입니다
English: Because we will send you a temporary password, etc. to your email address.

Korean: 그렇군요 이메일 주소가 없는데 만들어야 겠네요
English: I see, I don't have an email address, so I'll have to create one.

Korean: 이메일 주소가 없으면 무료 계정 사이트를 방문하셔서요
English: If you don't have an email address, visit our free account site
After receiving the email, sign up for #@affiliation#
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Please feel free to contact us with any further questions
Good morning #@Affiliation# Counselor #@Name#
Hello, I am a member of #@affiliation#
Hello, member. How may I help you?
I want to change the name and date of birth I signed up with.

Korean: 회원가입 시 입력하신 성함 성별은 수정이 어려워요
English: It is difficult to change the name and gender you entered when signing up.
Oh, I see. I changed my name.

Korean: 아 개명하셨군요 그럼 한 가지만 더 물어보겠습니다
English: Oh, you changed your name. Then I have one more question.

Korean: 혹시 #@소속# 사이트에서 개명 전 이름 결제 내역이 있습니까
English: Do you have any payment history for your name before the name change on the #@affiliation# site?
Yes, I have paid for the course at #@affiliation#
Then, please contact #@affiliation# customer center #@phone number#

Korean: 개인정보 확인절차를 거쳐 도움을 드리도록 하겠습니다
English: We will help you by verifying your personal information.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
ABe careful of Corona. This was counselor #@name#.
Good morning #@Affiliation# Counselor #@Name#
I'm calling because I have a question.
Yes, sir, what are you curious about?
#@Affiliation# Why can't I log in to the site?
Did you enter your ID and password correctly?
Yes, I entered it correctly, but it doesn't work.

Korean: #@소속# 홈페이지 정보를 업데이트하지 못해 발생하는 경우가 많아요
English: #@Affiliation# This often happens because the homepage information cannot be updated.
Oh, I see. I'll try updating it.
If that doesn't work, please contact #@affiliation# customer center #@phone number#

Korean: 연락 주시면 내용 확인 후 도움을 드리도록 하겠습니다.
English: Please contact us and we will review the details and assist you.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Be careful of the rain. This was counselor #@name#.
Sorry for the late response, this is counselor #@Affiliation# #@Name#
I'm calling because I have a question.
What are you curious about, customer?

Korean: 제가 회원가입을 했는데 아이디와 비밀번호를 잊어버렸어요
English: I signed up for membership, but I forgot my ID and password.
To find your member ID

Korean: #@소속# 로그인 페이지 내 하단 아이디 찾기 비밀번호 찾기를 클릭하세요
English: #@Affiliation# Click Find ID/Find Password at the bottom of the login page

Korean: 찾기 팝업 창이 뜨면 아이디 찾기에서 이름 생년월일 등을 입력하면 알 수 있어요
English: When the Find pop-up window appears, you can find out by entering your name, date of birth, etc. in the Find ID field.
How do I find my password?

Korean: 비밀번호 찾기에서  E-mail  주소 연락처 중 1가지만 입력해서 확인하실 수 있습니다
English: You can check by entering only one of your email address contacts in Find Password.
Okay, I understand. I'll try.

Korean: 만약 안되시면 신규 회원 가입을 하셔서 이용하여 주시기 바랍니다
English: If it doesn't work, please sign up as a new member and use it.
Yes, thank you for the detailed explanation.
Have a nice day, this was counselor #@name#
Thank you for calling #@Affiliation# This is counselor #@Name#
Hello, I am a mother of a third grader.
Hello parents, how can I help you?

Korean: 주위 아이 친구 엄마들이 #@소속#가 괜찮다고 해서 회원 가입하려고요
English: The mothers of the children around me said #@affiliation# was good, so I'm thinking of signing up.
That's right, our #@affiliation# is popular.
How do I sign up?

Korean: 홈페이지 메인 화면 우측 상단에 회원가입을 클릭하신 후
English: After clicking on Sign Up at the top right of the homepage main screen,

Korean: 약관을 읽으시고 동의하시면 회원가입 양식이 나옵니다
English: If you read and agree to the terms and conditions, a membership registration form will appear.
Yes, you signed up on my homepage.

Korean: 필수항목은 반드시 기입해 주시고 개인정보 인증을 위해 핸드폰 인증을 해주세요
English: Please fill in the required fields and verify your mobile phone number to verify your personal information.
Yes, I will do that. Thank you.
Good day, this was counselor #@name#
Thank you for calling #@Affiliation# This is counselor #@Name#
Hello, I signed up before.
Yes, member, how may I help you?
I lost my ID and password.
How to find it

Korean: 홈페이지 메인 화면 우측 상단의 아이디 찾기 메뉴를 이용하면 됩니다
English: You can use the ID search menu at the top right of the homepage main screen.

Korean: 아이디는 생년월일이나 휴대폰 번호로 찾으시면 되고요
English: You can find your ID by your date of birth or mobile phone number.
How do I find my password?

Korean: 아이디 이름 가입 시 입력했던 핸드폰 번호를 이용하여 비밀번호 찾기가 가능해요
English: You can find your password by using the mobile phone number you entered when signing up for your ID name.

Korean: 제가 알려주신 방법으로 해봤는데 일치하지 않는다고 나와요
English: I tried the method you told me, but it says it doesn't match

Korean: 그러시면 학생이 소속된 캠퍼스 원장님 권한으로 학생 정보 조회가 가능하거든요
English: In that case, the student's campus director can check the student's information with the authority to do so.
Please contact your affiliated campus.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
The weather is cold, so take care of your health. This was counselor #@name#
I will cherish you #@Affiliation# Counselor #@Name#
Hello, I'm calling because I have a question.
Yes, what are you curious about, sir?

Korean: 로그인했는데 소속 캠퍼스가 지정되지 않았다고 나와요
English: I logged in but it says my campus affiliation has not been specified
Are you a student on our campus?
Yes, I registered on campus 3 days ago.
If so, please log in to the #@affiliation# homepage first.
Please click on Edit Member Information in the upper right corner.
I clicked on Wait a minute

Korean: 비밀번호를 입력 후 하단의 소속 캠퍼스 메뉴에서 캠퍼스 설정을 하시기 바랍니다
English: After entering your password, please set up your campus from the affiliated campus menu at the bottom.
That's how it's done, thank you

Korean: 추가 문의 사항이 있으면 언제든 연락 주세요 상담사 #@이름# 이었습니다
English: If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact me at any time. This was my counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 학부모 회원가입은 어떻게 해야 하나요
English: Yes, hello. How do I sign up for parent membership?

Korean: 네 학부모 회원가입 관련해서 문의해 주셨고요
English: Yes, you asked about parent membership.

Korean: 네 맞아요 아이거는 되어있는데 제가 안되어있어서요
English: Yes, that's right. I have it, but I don't.

Korean: 네 홈페이지 보시면 우측 상단에 회원가입을 눌러주시고요
English: If you look at the homepage, click on Sign Up at the top right.

Korean: 약관 동의 본인인증 먼저 하신 다음 자녀분 아이디 비밀번호 있으시죠
English: Agree to the terms and conditions. First, verify your identity. Then, make sure your child has an ID and password.

Korean: 그대로 입력해 주시면 학부모 회원가입이 진행됩니다
English: If you enter the information as is, parent membership registration will proceed.

Korean: 아 네 감사합니다 그럼 사실상 본인인증만 하면 되는거네요
English: Oh, yes, thank you. So, in reality, all you have to do is verify your identity.

Korean: 음 네 거의 그렇습니다 자녀분 아이디 비밀번호도 꼭 기억하셔야 하고요
English: Yes, almost. You must remember your child's ID and password.

Korean: 아 네 알겠습니다 알려주신 대로 가입 할게요 감사해요
English: Oh, yes, I understand. I will sign up as you told me. Thank you.

Korean: 네 앞으로도 저희 #@소속# 많이 이용해주시구요 상담원 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Yes, please continue to use our #@affiliation# a lot. This was counselor #@name#.
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 제가 평생교육과 편입 지원 후에 등록금을 전부 납부했는데요
English: Yes, hello. I paid all the tuition after applying for lifelong education and transfer.

Korean: 혹시 과 변경이 가능할지 궁금해서 문의드렸습니다
English: I was wondering if it was possible to change the degree.

Korean: 네 과 변경 관련해서 문의해 주셨고요 우선 성함과 번호 확인 부탁드립니다
English: Yes, you have inquired about a change in your major. First, please confirm your name and number.
Yes, my name is #@name# and my number is #@phone#

Korean: 네 현재 디자인과에 재학 중이신데 어느과 알아보시고 계시나요
English: Yes, I am currently studying design. Which department are you looking into?

Korean: 아 네 저 마술 치료학으로 전과하고 싶습니다
English: Oh yes, I want to major in magic therapy

Korean: 아 네 우선 전과 기준이 과마다 전부 다르기 때문에 확답을 드리기 어렵고요
English: Ah, yes. First of all, it is difficult to give you a definite answer because the criteria for each department are different.

Korean: 제가 입시 홍보처로 다시 연결해드릴 테니 상담받아보시겠어요
English: I'll connect you back to the admissions office so you can get some advice.

Korean: 네네 그렇게 할게요 입시홍보처 번호 좀 부탁드릴게요
English: Yes, yes, I will do that. Could you please give me the number of the admissions office?
Yes, #@phone number#. Is this confirmed?

Korean: 네 감사합니다 여기 전화해서 다시 상담좀 받아볼게요
English: Yes, thank you. I'll call back here and get some advice.

Korean: 네 직접적인 해결을 못해드려서 죄송합니다 지금까지 상담원 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Yes, I'm sorry I couldn't give you a direct solution. This was counselor #@name#.
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?
Yes, hello. I applied for transfer.

Korean: 결과 발표가 오늘이라고 적혀있는데 몇시쯤 나올까요
English: It says the results will be announced today, but when will they be announced?

Korean: 네 신편입생 추가 1차 합격자 발표는 목요일 오전 10시에 공지 되었고요
English: Yes, the announcement of the first round of additional successful applicants for new transfer students was made on Thursday at 10 AM.

Korean: 예비대학은 오늘 오후 7시 건물 지하 1층에서 진행될 예정입니다
English: The preparatory college will be held today at 7:00 PM on the first basement level of the building.

Korean: 아 그럼 저는 목요일 날 나오겠네요 친구는 오늘 오후 7시라 했거든요
English: Oh, then I'll come out on Thursday. My friend said today at 7pm.

Korean: 아 네 그 친구분은 예비대학 말씀하신거 같네요
English: Oh yes, I think that friend was talking about preparatory school.
Yes, I understand. Thank you for letting me know.

Korean: 네 추가로 더 궁금하신 점 있나요
English: Yes, do you have any further questions?
No, there isn't anything in particular.

Korean: 네 그럼 좋은 결과 얻으시길 바라고요 상담원 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Yes, I hope you get good results. This was counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 제가 상담학과 편입 지원을 희망하는데요
English: Yes, hello. I would like to apply for transfer to the counseling department.

Korean: 아 저희 대학 상담학과 편입 지원이요
English: Oh, I'm applying for transfer to the counseling department at our university.

Korean: 네 맞아요 근데 제가 지원 시기를 놓쳤어요 그래서 정보를 좀 알고 싶은데요
English: Yes, that's right, but I missed the application period, so I'd like to know some information.

Korean: 재학생 인원수와 3학년 편입학을 해도 신입생 명칭을 부여받는지 궁금합니다
English: I am curious about the number of students enrolled and whether transfer students in their third year are given the title of freshman.

Korean: 아 네 우선 해당 사항은 각 과마다 전부 다른 기준을 가지고 있습니다
English: Oh yes, first of all, each department has different criteria for this matter.

Korean: 아 그럼 입학해서 알 수 있나요
English: Oh, then can I find out after I enroll?

Korean: 아니요 그건 아니고요 저희 입시 홍보처가 따로 있는데요
English: No, that's not it. We have a separate admissions promotion office.

Korean: 해당 부서로 안내해드릴 테니 한번 상담받아보시겠어요
English: I will direct you to the relevant department, so please come and get some advice.
Yes, okay, please do that.
I'll give you my number. It's #@phone number#. Did you make a note of it?
Yes, I wrote #@phone number#. Thank you for letting me know.

Korean: 네 그럼 좋은 하루 보내시고요 상담원 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Okay, have a nice day. This was counselor #@name#
#@Affiliation# with the best information How can we help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 제가 회원가입을 하려고 하는데 어떻게 하나요
English: Yes, hello. I want to sign up for membership. How do I do that?

Korean: 네 혹시 지금 저희 사이트 접속 중이신가요
English: Yes, are you currently on our site?
Yes, that's right, it's in there

Korean: 아 그러시면 우측 상단에 회원가입 보이시죠
English: Oh, then you can see the sign-up button at the top right.
Can I just write in the order that appears after pressing?

Korean: 네 맞습니다 약관 읽어보시고 개인정보 입력 후 가입 완료해주시면 됩니다
English: Yes, that's right. Please read the terms and conditions, enter your personal information, and complete the registration.

Korean: 아 네 알겠습니다 여기보면 선택항목이라고 나와있는거있는데
English: Oh, yes, I understand. If you look here, it says optional.
You don't have to write this

Korean: 네 고객님께서 원치 않으시면 선택 항목은 제외하고 기입해주시면 됩니다
English: Yes, if you do not want to, you can just fill it out without selecting the items.
Yes, I understand. Thank you for letting me know.

Korean: 네 그럼 좋은 하루 보내시구요 상담원 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Okay, have a nice day. This was counselor #@name#
#@Affiliation# with the best information How can we help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 제가 이번에 이사를 했는데요
English: Yes, hello. I recently moved.

Korean: 아 혹시 회원정보 변경 관련해서 궁금하신가요
English: Oh, do you have any questions about changing your membership information?

Korean: 오 네 맞아요 주소를 변경해야하는데 어디서 해야하나요
English: Oh yes that's right I need to change my address where do I do it
Yes, please log in first.

Korean: 이후 화면 상단의 고객님 아이디를 클릭해주시면요
English: After that, click on your customer ID at the top of the screen.
You can change your address information right away.

Korean: 아 네 감사합니다 그럼 나중에 핸드폰 바꿔도 동일한  방법으로 하면 되나요
English: Oh, yes, thank you. Then, if I change my phone later, can I do the same thing?

Korean: 네 맞습니다 아이디 클릭해주시면 연락처 이메일 주소 변경 가능합니다
English: Yes, that's right. If you click on the ID, you can change your contact email address.
Yes, I understand. Thank you for letting me know.

Korean: 네 그럼 좋은하루 보내시구요 상담원 김미영이었습니다
English: Yes, have a nice day. This was counselor Kim Mi-young.
#@Affiliation# with the best information How can we help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 혹시 제 아이디 변경이 가능할까요
English: Hello, is it possible to change my ID?

Korean: 아이디 변경 관련해서 문의해주셨고요 죄송하지만 어렵습니다
English: You asked about changing your ID, but I'm sorry, it's difficult.

Korean: 아 네 평소에 쓰던건데 오타가나서 등록이 되었더라고요
English: Oh, yes, I used to use it, but it was registered because of a typo.

Korean: 죄송하지만 아이디 변경의 경우 보안상의 문제도 있고요
English: I'm sorry, but there are security issues when changing your ID.

Korean: 사이트 이용에 악용될 가능성이 높아서 저희가 규제하고 있습니다
English: We regulate it because it is highly likely to be abused for site use.

Korean: 아 네 듣고보니 그럴 수 있겠네요 어쩔수 없죠 제 실수니까요
English: Oh, yes, now that I hear it, that could be possible. I can't help it, it was my mistake.

Korean: 네 혹시 추가로 더 궁금하신 부분있으신가요
English: Yes, is there anything else you would like to know?
No, there is no way to change your ID.

Korean: 네 그럼 행복한 주말 보내시고요 상담원 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Yes, have a happy weekend. This was counselor #@name#
#@Affiliation# with the best information How can we help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 회원 가입을 하려고 하는데 중복된 이메일이라고 떠서요
English: Yes, hello. I'm trying to sign up for membership, but it says it's a duplicate email.

Korean: 아 네 이전에 가입하셨거나 타인과 아이디가 겹칠 때 해당증상이 있는데요
English: Oh, yes, if you have previously registered or your ID overlaps with someone else's, you may experience this symptom.

Korean: 혹시 저희 사이트 이전에 가입 했었나요
English: Have you ever registered on our site before?

Korean: 어 잘 모르겠어요 안한거 같아요 제 기억에는요
English: Oh, I don't know. I don't think I did. From what I remember

Korean: 혹시 휴대폰 인증하실 때 별다른 문구 없었나요
English: Was there anything special written when you authenticated your phone?
I haven't gotten that far yet

Korean: 네 그럼 저희가 한번 알아보겠습니다 휴대폰 번호와 성함 알려주세요

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 혹시 계정을 여러 개 만들 수 있나요
English: Yes, hello. Can I create multiple accounts?

Korean: 각각 다른 이메일을 사용하신다면 계정을 여러개 만드실 수 있습니다
English: You can create multiple accounts if you use different email addresses.
Is it impossible with one ID?

Korean: 네 맞습니다 아이디 공유 금지 정책이 있어서요
English: Yes, that's right. There is a policy against sharing IDs.

Korean: 한개의 아이디로 동시에 여러 기기에서 접속이 불가능합니다 유의해주세요
English: Please note that you cannot access multiple devices simultaneously with one ID.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 이런 정책이 있는지 몰랐네요 잘 지키도록 하겠습니다
English: Yes, I understand. I didn't know there was such a policy. I will make sure to follow it.

Korean: 네 추가로 더 궁금하신 부분 있나요
English: Yes, is there anything else you would like to know?
Are there any disadvantages to simultaneous connections?

Korean: 네 우선 로그아웃이 되고요 해당 문제가 10회 이상 확인되면 차단됩니다
English: Yes, you will be logged out first, and if this issue is confirmed more than 10 times, you will be blocked.
Yes, thank you so much for the detailed explanation.

Korean: 네 그럼 점심 맛있게 드시고요 상담원 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Yes, then enjoy your lunch. This was counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 혹시 회원 가입할 때 따로 제출할 서류가 있나요
English: Yes, hello. Is there any separate document I need to submit when signing up for membership?

Korean: 특별히 제출할 서류는 없고요 이메일과 #@소속#으로 가입하시면 됩니다
English: There are no special documents to submit, just sign up with your email and #@affiliation#

Korean: 네 생각보다 간단하네요 둘 중 선택해서 가입하면 되는 거죠
English: Yes, it's simpler than you think. Just choose one of the two and sign up.

Korean: 네 맞습니다 추가로 더 궁금한 사항 있으신가요
English: Yes, that's right. Do you have any further questions?
What are the customer service center's operating hours?

Korean: 네 평일 오전 10시부터 오후 7시까지 운영되고 있습니다
English: Yes, we are open weekdays from 10am to 7pm.
By the way, what time is lunch time?
Yes, from 12 to 1 pm.
Yes, thank you. I will take note.
Okay, have a nice day. This was counselor #@name#
Thank you for calling #@Affiliation# This is counselor #@Name#
Hello, I have a question.
Hello, what are you curious about?
#@Affiliation# I'm trying to withdraw my membership, but I can't withdraw.
Customer, why do you want to withdraw?
I got into the university I wanted through regular admissions.
I sincerely congratulate you on passing.

Korean: 혹시 강좌 수강 상품이 유효기간이 남아 있나요
English: Is there any remaining validity period for the course product?
Yes, there is about a month left.

Korean: 그러시면 모든 상품의 이용 기간이 종료된 다음 탈퇴하셔야 합니다
English: In that case, you must withdraw after the usage period for all products ends.
Okay, I understand. Thank you.
Have a nice day, counselor #@name#
Thank you for your inquiry. This is counselor #@Affiliation#, #@Name#
Hello, I am a prospective high school freshman.
Hello, how may I help you?

Korean: 제가 회원 가입중 인데요 학교명을 검색했는데요
English: I'm signing up for membership and I searched for the school name.
My school name is not searchable

Korean: 신규 학교나 학교명이 변경된 경우 검색이 안 될 수 있습니다
English: If the school is new or the school name has changed, the search may not be possible.
Oh, our school is a new school.

Korean: 신규 학교는 등록 과정에서 조금 시간이 걸릴 수 있어요
English: New schools may take a little longer to register
Then should I wait?

Korean: 고등학교 입학전이니 주변학교를 검색하셔서 학교명을 입력하셔도 됩니다
English: Since this is before entering high school, you can search for nearby schools and enter the school name.
Then can I change it later?
Yes, it will change
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Have a nice day, this was counselor #@name#
Thank you for your inquiry. This is counselor #@Affiliation#, #@Name#
Hello, I would like to change my membership information.

Korean: 회원정보 변경은 컴퓨터와 모바일로 변경 가능합니다
English: You can change your membership information on your computer or mobile device.
Is it impossible to edit information in #@Affiliation# and #@Product#?
Yes, I'm sorry, but that's not possible.
I'm trying to change my name
Your name cannot be changed.
I changed my name, what should I do? Is there no other way?

Korean: 개명의 경우 변경된 학생증이나 가족관계 증명서를요
English: In case of name change, you will need a changed student ID or family relationship certificate.

Korean: 고객센터 게시판에 주민등록번호 뒷자리를 가려서 올려주시면 변경해드려요 ????
English: If you post your resident registration number on the customer center bulletin board with the last digits of your number hidden, we will change it for you.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 온라인 강의 수료증은 어디서 발급이 가능한가요
English: Yes, hello. Where can I get a certificate of completion for an online course?
Have you attended more than 80 percent of your classes?
Yes, I have currently completed 90% of the course.

Korean: 네 발급 기준은 80퍼센트 이상으로 충족되셨구요 서류로 받고싶으신거죠
English: Yes, you have met the issuance criteria by more than 80%, and you want to receive it in writing.

Korean: 네 맞습니다 어떻게 받아야하죠 직접 받으러 가야 하나요
English: Yes, that's right. How do I get it? Should I go get it in person?

Korean: 아 아닙니다 저희 사이트 아래에 고객센터 이메일 주소 보이시나요
English: Oh no, do you see the customer center email address at the bottom of our site?
Yes, I see an address starting with #@affiliation#

Korean: 네 그 주소로 아이디 성함 과정명을 보내주시면요 파일로 첨부해드리고 있습니다
English: Yes, please send your ID, name, and course name to that address. I will attach it as a file.
Oh, yes, you are giving it to me as a PDF file.
Yes, that's right. We are issuing it through PDI Pro.
Okay, thanks for letting me know.

Korean: 네 그럼 오늘도 좋은 하루 보내시구요 상담원 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Yes, then have a good day today. This was counselor #@name#
Thank you for calling #@Affiliation# This is counselor #@Name#
Hello, I am a member of #@affiliation#
Hello, member.

Korean: 제가 주소를 변경하려고 하는데 어떻게 해야 하나요
English: I want to change my address, what should I do?
Why do you want to change it?
I moved a while ago

Korean: 회원정보 변경은 사이트 우측 상단에 마이페이지에서 변경가능합니다
English: You can change your membership information on My Page at the top right of the site.
Where do I change my page?

Korean: 마이페이지 나의 정보를 누르시고 정보 수정을 클릭하시면 됩니다
English: Click on My Page, My Information, and then click on Edit Information.
Oh, oh, I understand. Thank you.

Korean: 추가 문의 사항 언제든지 연락 주세요 상담사 #@이름# 이었습니다
English: If you have any further questions, please contact me anytime. I am a consultant at #@name#
Sorry for the late response, this is counselor #@Affiliation# #@Name#
Hello, I am a high school sophomore.
Hello, how may I help you?

English: I'm trying to sign up, but it says I'm already signed up.

Korean: 그러시면 동일 정보로 가입을 하셨거나 휴면 회원인 것 같습니다
English: If so, it seems like you signed up with the same information or are a dormant member.

Korean: 그래요 저는 가입한 기억이 안 나요
English: Yeah, I don't remember signing up.

Korean: 고객님께서 기억을 못 하셔서 그러실 수 있습니다
English: It may be because the customer does not remember.
I see, I guess I didn't remember.

Korean: 로그인을 오랫동안 못하셨으니 아이디와 비밀번호를 확인해보세요
English: You haven't logged in for a long time, so please check your ID and password.
Yes, I understand. Thank you.
Do you have any other questions?
I don't have any right now, but I'll call you back when I get some.
Thank you, counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 저기 연말정산 시에 교육비 공제가 가능한가요
English: Yes, hello. Is it possible to deduct education expenses when filing your year-end tax return?
Oh, I'm sorry, but it seems like it'll be difficult.
It's difficult for some reason

Korean: 교육비 공제는 #@소속#에서 지정한 시설의 경우에만 가능합니다
English: Tuition deductions are only available for facilities designated by #@affiliation#

Korean: 아 그럼 그 시설에 포함이 안되어있다는 말씀이신가요
English: Oh, so you're saying it's not included in that facility?

Korean: 네 #@소속#에 인가받은 업체가 아니므로 세액공제 대상이 아니에요
English: Yes, since it is not a company authorized by #@affiliation#, it is not eligible for tax deduction.

Korean: 아 네 알겠습니다 말씀해주신 부분 유의해야겠네요
English: Oh, yes, I understand. I will pay attention to the part you mentioned.

Korean: 네 추가로 더 궁금하신 부분 있으신가요
English: Yes, do you have any further questions?
No, there is none

Korean: 네 그럼 코로나 조심하시구요 상담원 #@이름# 이었습니다
English: Yes, then please be careful of Corona. This was the counselor #@name#
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

English: Yes, hello. I am a student taking offline classes. How do I receive a certificate of completion?

Korean: 오프라인 강의는요 완강하시고 종강 때 발급해드리고 있어요
English: For offline lectures, you can take the course and receive a certificate at the end of the course.
Oh, I guess it's different from online.

Korean: 네 맞습니다 온라인의 경우와 조금 차이가 있습니다
English: Yes, that's right, it's a little different from online

Korean: 그러게요 저번에 온라인했을때는 80퍼센트 수강하고 수료증 받았거든요
English: Yes, last time I took it online, I completed 80 percent of the course and received a certificate.

Korean: 아 네 맞습니다 혹시 더 궁금하신 부분 있나요
English: Oh, yes, that's right. Do you have any further questions?

Korean: 아니요 없습니다 어쩔 수 없이 종강하고 받아야겠네요
English: No, there isn't. I have no choice but to finish it and receive it.

Korean: 네 답변 도움이 되셨길 바라구요 상담원 #@이름#이었습니다
English: I hope your answer was helpful, this was counselor #@name#
Yes, thank you for letting me know.
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 혹시 수강신청 확인서는 어떻게 받을 수 있나요

Korean: 아 우선 해당 서류는 수강료 결제가 완료가 되어야지만 발급이 가능하세요
English: Ah, first of all, the document can only be issued once the tuition fee payment is completed.
Yes, the tuition fee has been paid.

Korean: 고객님 성함과 과정명을 혹시 불러주실 수 있을까요

Your name is #@name# and the process is #@product#

Korean: 네 #@이름# 회원님 확인 되셨구요 메일로 보내드릴까요
English: Yes, member #@name#, we have confirmed your identity. Shall we send it to you by email?

Korean: 네 메일로 보내주세요 아니면 다른 방법도 있나요
English: Please send it to my email or is there another way?

Korean: 다른 방법은 우편 전송 서비스인데요 시간이 좀 걸려요
English: Another way is by postal service, but it takes some time.
Oh, just send it to me by email. Thank you.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 그럼 좋은 하루 보내시구요 상담원 #@이름# 이었습니다
English: Okay, I understand. Have a nice day. This was counselor #@name#.
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 혹시 제 아이디 하나로 여려 명이 같이 들을 수 있나요
English: Yes, hello. Can several people listen together with just one ID?

Korean: 하나의 기기에 모여서 여러 명이 듣는 것은 가능합니다
English: It is possible for multiple people to gather on one device and listen.

Korean: 아 그럼 제 아이디를 가지고 각자 핸드폰으로 듣는 거는요

Korean: 죄송하지만 말씀해주신 경우는 원칙적으로 금기시하는 행위입니다
English: I'm sorry, but the case you mentioned is a generally taboo act.

Korean: 하나의 아이디로 여러 기기에서 접속할 시 나중에는 차단될 수 있습니다
English: If you access multiple devices with one ID, you may be blocked later.

Korean: 몰랐네요 죄송합니다 어쩐지 계속 로그아웃 되는 거 같더라고요
English: I didn't know, sorry, but it seems like I keep getting logged out

Korean: 네 10회 적발 시 차단되니 각별히 주의해주세요
English: Yes, please be careful because you will be blocked after 10 attempts.
Okay, I understand. I should tell my friends about it.

Korean: 네 추가로 더 궁금하신 부분 있으신가요
English: Yes, do you have any further questions?
No, nothing else

Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 제가 회원가입을 하려고 하는데요
English: Yes, hello, I would like to sign up for membership.

Korean: 네 관심 가져주셔서 감사합니다 어떤 사항이 궁금하신가요
English: Thank you for your interest. What are you curious about?

Korean: 회원 가입하기 누르기 전에 광고성 정보 수신 동의 체크란이 있는데요
English: Before clicking on sign up, there is a checkbox to agree to receive promotional information.

Korean: 이걸 체크하면 혜택 같은 거가 있나요
English: Are there any benefits to checking this?

Korean: 네 정기적으로 발송해드리는 자료와 이벤트 안내를 받을 수 있습니다
English: Yes, you can receive regularly sent materials and event information.

Korean: 할인 혜택이나 그런 건 없는 거죠
English: There are no discounts or anything like that.

Korean: 네 다만 수신하시면 이벤트 안내 같은 것을 바로 받을 수 있습니다
English: Yes, but if you receive it, you can immediately receive event information and such.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 일단 체크는 해두고 좀 지켜봐야겠네요
English: Okay, I understand. I'll check it out and wait and see.

Korean: 네 감사합니다 추가로 더 궁금한 부분 있으신가요
English: Yes, thank you. Do you have any further questions?
No, there is none

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 힘찬 하루 보내시고요 상담원 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Yes, I understand. Have a great day. This was counselor #@name#.
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 제가 해킹을 당해서 휴대폰도 바꾸고 여기도 탈퇴하려고 하는데요
English: Yes, I was hacked, so I changed my phone and I'm trying to cancel my membership here.
Are you curious about how to withdraw?

Korean: 네 맞습니다 어떻게 탈퇴를 해야 하죠
English: Yes, that's right. How do I unsubscribe?

Korean: 네 지금 로그인한 상태로 접속 중이신가요
English: Yes, are you currently logged in?

Korean: 네 맞습니다 #@소속# 메인 화면에 들어와 있어요
English: Yes, that's right #@Affiliation# It's on the main screen

Korean: 네 우측 상단에 성함 누르시고 마이페이지 들어가시면요
English: Yes, click on your name in the upper right corner and go to My Page.

Korean: 회원정보 수정이 보이실 꺼에요 혹시 확인하셨나요
English: You will see the member information modification. Did you check it?

Korean: 네 확인했습니다 혹시 아래 작은 버튼으로 탈퇴하기 이건가요
English: Yes, I checked. Is this the small button below to unsubscribe?

Korean: 네 맞습니다 해당 버튼 누르시고 인증해주시면 탈퇴가 진행됩니다
English: Yes, that's right. Click the button and authenticate to proceed with withdrawal.
Yes, I understand. Thank you for letting me know.

Korean: 네 그동안 이용해주셔서 감사했습니다 좋은 하루 보내세요
English: Yes, thank you for using our service. Have a nice day.
Hello, this is #@Affiliation# counselor #@Name#. How may I help you?

Korean: 네 안녕하세요 제가 여기 강의를 들으려고 저번 주에 수강신청을 했는데요
English: Yes, hello. I applied for the course last week to take this course.

Korean: 근데 집안에 사정이 생겨서 강의를 못 들을 거 같아요
English: But I don't think I'll be able to attend the lecture due to family circumstances.

Korean: 네 그럼 혹시 수강취소 철회 관련해서 전화 주셨을까요
English: Yes, then did you call me to ask about canceling your course registration?
Yes, that's right. What should I do?

Korean: 네 수강 목록 들어가셔서요 수강취소를 진행하시면 먼저 취소가 될 거예요
English: If you go to your course list and cancel your course, it will be canceled first.

Korean: 네 강의료 지불한 것도 다시 돌아오나요

Korean: 네 맞습니다 카드사 운영일에 따라 다르지만 전부 다시 받을 수 있으세요
English: Yes, that's right. It depends on the card company's operating days, but you can get them all back.

Korean: 네 감사합니다 아마도 6개월 정도 뒤에 다시 수강해야 할 거 같아서요
English: Yes, thank you. I think I'll have to retake the class in about 6 months.

Korean: 네 알겠습니다 언제든 다시 가능하니까요 걱정 마세요
English: Yes, I understand. Don't worry, you can always do it again.
Yes, thank you for letting me know.

Korean: 네 그럼 즐거운 주말 보내세요 상담원 #@이름#이었습니다
